669387016.name: Beautiful chirch
669387016.author: a TripAdvisor user
669387016.reviewBody: Place of the virgin of Health...people from near and far come to visit this church to pray to this Patron ...the building from the 16th century is surrounded by a plaza where street vendors sell their goods...

itemReviewed.name: Basilica de Nuestra Senora de la Salud

658928950.name: Beautiful church with beloved Virgin of Health
658928950.author: a TripAdvisor user
658928950.reviewBody: This church is very popular with the local people, due to their reverence for the Virgin of Health.  It is always packed on Sundays and Holy Days.  The interior of the church was recently completely repainted and regilded.  It is kept immaculately clean.

itemReviewed.name: Basilica de Nuestra Senora de la Salud

641836319.name: A must see in Patzcuaro!
641836319.author: a TripAdvisor user
641836319.reviewBody: A beautiful colonial era church right up the hill from the plazita. Cool and shady, vendors set up during the day in front of the church.

itemReviewed.name: Basilica de Nuestra Senora de la Salud

630671893.name: Beautiful Basilica
630671893.author: a TripAdvisor user
630671893.reviewBody:
We were told this Basílica dates from the 1500's.
It is a place where people from all over the lake region of Pátzcuaro come to party their respects to "our Lady of Health".
The interior is beautiful and not too overdone with details.
It is a must visit at the heart of town.

itemReviewed.name: Basilica de Nuestra Senora de la Salud

568756846.name: Pilgrimage site of the Virgin of Health
568756846.author: a TripAdvisor user
568756846.reviewBody: This is the Basilica built by Vasco de Quiroga in Patzcuaro and contains the Virgin of Health which is venerated throughout Michoacan. The basilica was meant to have 5 naves but only this one was built. Don\'t miss it.

itemReviewed.name: Basilica de Nuestra Senora de la Salud

559601464.name: Interesting for its religious significance but elatively plain by Spanish Colonial standards
559601464.author: a TripAdvisor user
559601464.reviewBody: We took in the Basilica de Nuestra Se\u00f1ora de la Salud, which was more notable for its age and its status as a pilgrimage site than for any element of its architecture or decoration, which by Spanish Colonial standards was quite plain. The one exception was the santo of the Virgin, both the real thing, resplendent above the altar and the copy, accessible by stairs behind, where pilgrims pin little metal milagros depicting afflicted parts of the body in hopes that the Virgin will deliver a cure. The area between the street and the front plaza was chockablock with stands selling the typical local tamales (corondas), religious items and ordinary curios.

itemReviewed.name: Basilica de Nuestra Senora de la Salud

546925921.name: Virgin makes miracles if you ask
546925921.author: a TripAdvisor user
546925921.reviewBody: This church is beautiful and the virgin makes miracles health if your ask for you, for friend or family\nVisit she

itemReviewed.name: Basilica de Nuestra Senora de la Salud

545619902.name: Don\'t miss this in Patzcuaro!
545619902.author: a TripAdvisor user
545619902.reviewBody: If you do nothing else in Patzcuaro, don\'t miss this lovely Basilica.  Huge barrel boveda ceiling dating from the 16th century.  Great example of early Spanish colonial architecture.

itemReviewed.name: Basilica de Nuestra Senora de la Salud

538267682.name: Nicely decorated
538267682.author: a TripAdvisor user
538267682.reviewBody: The frescos on the ceiling give this place a depth we have not seen in other churches, plus the lighting gave it a different feeling which was wonderful. The stone work in the facade of the church is simple but it tells a story of its own.

itemReviewed.name: Basilica de Nuestra Senora de la Salud

534593620.name: Charming and local
534593620.author: a TripAdvisor user
534593620.reviewBody: worth the time to visit - interesting details inside and out - cool in th heat of the day which makes it all the nicer

itemReviewed.name: Basilica de Nuestra Senora de la Salud

661164968.name: It was a busy day in the copper town
661164968.author: a TripAdvisor user
661164968.reviewBody: We must have arrived on a celebration day as the parking was very difficult and we had to walk fairly far to the center of town. That being said, there was music and dancing and food stalls and a street market that made our walk worthwhile. This is a quaint little town and the main product is copper which you see on display in all the shops and in the street d\u00e9cor. We would have liked to have a demonstration of the copper crafting but the craftsman was out sick for the day and we had very little time left to look for another craftsman.

652126462.name: Artisans at Work
652126462.author: a TripAdvisor user
652126462.reviewBody: A scheduled stop on our Airstream caravan, we visited the Casa de Felicitas and watched the process of making beautiful copper bowls, though that is certainly not all they make. All done by hand, no machinery. A must see!

646183634.name: Our Second Visit
646183634.author: a TripAdvisor user
646183634.reviewBody: Santa Clara del Cobre is only about a 20 minute drive from P\u00e1tzcuaro and is an interesting drive. The village is very small and there are not a lot of places to eat. It is MOST interesting to visit the workshops and if you like copper there is lots to buy. The main reason we came back a second time was to buy some specific copper items some of which we had bought last year and wanted more of. The second reason was to show the village to the friends we were travelling with. A couple of hours is all you need

629812781.name: Amazing village
629812781.author: a TripAdvisor user
629812781.reviewBody:
We pass by in this village in the way to Morelia during a vacation time in Michoacan i like it so much that we decide to have lunch and dinner here and stay in their plaza central and make some shopping of handmade copper

This is an fantastic place to see and the people here are also very nice

for sure this was one of the best places that i visited before

621625190.name: October 2018 big works taking place
621625190.author: a TripAdvisor user
621625190.reviewBody: Because of the building works along the main shopping streets and plaza we didn\'t see this town at its best. Was not straight forward catching a bus from Patzucura to Santa Clara as they do not leave from Patzucura market plaza but on the main road which is a 15 to 20 min walk away (head out of Patzucura past the Plaza where traditional crafts are sold and keep going until you hit T junction - buses leave from there).

614933219.name: Off the Charts Interesting
614933219.author: a TripAdvisor user
614933219.reviewBody: Where else can you see a whole town devoted to copper (and silver)? There are copper items of all description-from bath tubs and sinks to earrings and bracelets. The prices are excellent, and even though I have never polished anything in my life, I bought some great burnished copper trays and a bell to remind me of the thousands of church bells in Patzcuaro.

600761425.name: Beautiful Copper Art
600761425.author: a TripAdvisor user
600761425.reviewBody: This is a very small town, considered a \u201cPueblo M\u00e1gico\u201d of the state of Michoacan. It\u2019s located just 20-30 minutes from Patzcuaro and I believe it\u2019s worth the visit. There you can enjoy the different work of the artisans that have worked with copper for many generations, and their work is beautiful (you can actually go inside the workshops). There\u2019s also a copper museum with some award winning pieces. The church has beautiful copper chandeliers. This would be a half a day visit that you won\u2019t regret.

589336198.name: Fine if you\u2019re interested in copper and artsy stuff
589336198.author: a TripAdvisor user
589336198.reviewBody: Went here on a couple of occasions for half a day each time. You have to be interested in copper products to spend more time than that. It has a nice plaza which can be very quiet at times and bustling at other times. Not much more, it gives a good flavor of a smaller Michoac\u00e1n pueblo.

577131577.name: You shouldn\u2019t miss del Cobre
577131577.author: a TripAdvisor user
577131577.reviewBody: We always go here while we visit Patzcuaro.   The artisans are plentiful, products varied, and shops prolific.  Little restaurant on the plaza is a good place for any meal.

572743250.name: A true adventure
572743250.author: a TripAdvisor user
572743250.reviewBody: A beautiful little town with a remarkable history. I highly recommend the visit, the shopping  here would require a truck if I live in Mexico.

570488929.name: Small, quaint, welcoming town
570488929.author: a TripAdvisor user
570488929.reviewBody: Little gem tucked away in Michoacan with plenty of artisan delights. This town is true to it\'s name and offers the best in copper artistry items, mostly all handmade. Take a local with you if you plan to go to get the best prices. Food isn\'t the big highlight here, there are neighboring pueblo magicos with much better food options but this place is best if you are looking for copper items.

569204935.name: Astounding
569204935.author: a TripAdvisor user
569204935.reviewBody: If you apprec\u00edate and respect craftsmanship, make the 30 min drive from Patzcuaro and walk around. Try to see a workshop (taller) if you can.

567876172.name: Enchanting
567876172.author: a TripAdvisor user
567876172.reviewBody: Copper everywhere.  We were able to get a demonstration on how the copper is processed.  There was so much to choose from.  I have never seen so many beautiful copper items.

564957751.name: Copper Country
564957751.author: a TripAdvisor user
564957751.reviewBody: This quiet city\'s streets are lined with shops selling copper items of all sizes and quality. The museum explains how copper items are made, and there was a live demonstration of the process, complete with bellows, fire, and five men pounding the copper discs at one time. Fascinating..

561962948.name: Historical Visit and Taco Tasting
561962948.author: a TripAdvisor user
561962948.reviewBody: Came to this area to visit distant family, but found so many interesting areas! Come on the weekends because there are like make shift markets, taquerias and taco stands with other neat foods and horchatas or Jamaica drinks. I loved the authentic foods from this area!! I tried a dozen taquerias and found that Mauricio\'s Taqueria in the front of his home is best! Try the tacos al pastor!!!\nThere are so many things to do here but the weekend is packed!

555683106.name: Copper artisans
555683106.author: a TripAdvisor user
555683106.reviewBody: We got a wonderful demonstration of how the copper is heated and worked at one of the shops/workshops.  I was fascinated.  We came away with a new appreciation of the beautiful copper art created in this town...and some of that art came home with us.  The copper work here is almost embarrassingly affordable, especially when you know how long the piece took to make.

554878954.name: If copper\u2019s your thing, this is the place
554878954.author: a TripAdvisor user
554878954.reviewBody: A fun side trip from Patzcuaro. Don\u2019t look for fine dining here! Many small and large shops selling quality copper pieces of all sorts. Some are museum quality and expensive. Others fun for home use - Pots, pans, vases, etc.

549484967.name: Copper village- great day trip!
549484967.author: a TripAdvisor user
549484967.reviewBody: We were here on Christmas Day, and it was wonderful! On their main Square nearly a hundred little kids were dressed in identical costumes doing traditional dances to a packed audience. The town specializes in Copper and we bought a bowl at near giveaway prices!  The whole town is packed with Artisan producers and we enjoyed it tremendously.  I would guess that Saturday and Sunday is the best time to visit.

546684827.name: Quaint little town about an hour from Patzcuaro.
546684827.author: a TripAdvisor user
546684827.reviewBody: Artisans are visible making large pots, vases, and a large number of copper roses, and a variety of trinkets to be used as souvenirs.  There are several upper class stores in the area, as well as smaller shops that offer a variety of hand crafted copper products.  Average restaurants that have very tasty and interesting food, at a very reasonable price.

544095026.name: Shopoing for copper sink
544095026.author: a TripAdvisor user
544095026.reviewBody: Beautiful little town. To find all the copper shops just follow the sound of hammering. The prices can\'t  be beat. We bought a copper sink for our home in Minnesota and they packaged it for air transport

517823068.name: all for copper
517823068.author: a TripAdvisor user
517823068.reviewBody: Beautiful little village along the lake. Most of the workers are deaf from hammering copper all day.

505197936.name: Copper
505197936.author: a TripAdvisor user
505197936.reviewBody: Santa Clara is a great place to buy anything copper.  El Port\u00f3n is a wonderful store. If they don\'t have what you need in copper, they will make it.

492157007.name: Great old Mexican town
492157007.author: a TripAdvisor user
492157007.reviewBody: Beautiful town square, fantastic shopping experience if you want copper, lots of stores, demonstrations on how pots are hand hammered, wonderful day.\nDid not spend the night there.

485986232.name: Interesting, especially the opportunity to see the craftspeople at work
485986232.author: a TripAdvisor user
485986232.reviewBody: As everyone knows this is the place for copper.  From bracelets, rings and necklaces all the way up with large sculptures, pots & pans all at very reasonable prices.  However, this is more than just the vendors around the square, take the time to visit the copper museum and also go to one of the active forges so they can explain the entire process.  That will doubtless give you greater respect for what these people do with such skill and humility.

482711589.name: Santa Clara de Cobre but more than just copper
482711589.author: a TripAdvisor user
482711589.reviewBody: Second visit to Santa Clara de Cobre.  If you want anything in copper this is the place to go.  Beautiful artwork, pots, crosses, plates and other souvenirs in the town located around the town square.  Although known for it\'s copper artwork it has a bit more to offer, friendly people, fantastic carnitas, delicious corundas and other foods are available and freshly made.  So after you\'re done buying all the copper you want make sure you visit the other vendors and enjoy the taste of authentic Mexican food from the street vendors.

480015378.name: Visit a Copper Forge!
480015378.author: a TripAdvisor user
480015378.reviewBody: Highlight of the vacation was the visit to a copper forge and seeing first-hand the labor that goes into making a hand-hammered copper piece. In addition the copper work is amazing\u2014I only wished we had bought more!

475967041.name: Great town for copper
475967041.author: a TripAdvisor user
475967041.reviewBody: It\'s like going to the source. A quaint little working town filled with wonderful artistry. \n\nWorth the drive if you are exploring the area.

474775543.name: Coppertown
474775543.author: a TripAdvisor user
474775543.reviewBody: "Cobre" is Copper in Spanish, which tells you what this modest litle town, about 20 or so minutes from Patzcuaro, is about..  The main street is lined with stores selling various copper products, from kitchen sinks down to the smallest of ringlets, and there is a nice copper museum to visit.  Another store to visit is El Porton (the copper museum is at the corner of that street and the main drag, and the store is up one block); in the back is an open shed where you can watch the artisans at work. They are happy to demonstrate their art, and maybe they will let you try your luck with a finishing hammer on a piece of copper!   Prices here are reasonable, and all in all, it is a nice way to spend a day.  If you are coming from Patzcuaro, don\'t worry about being directed onto a parallel one-way street; just drive past the church and start looking for parking spaces on the side streets.  P.S.  Their plaza at Christmastide is as pretty as any I have seen around here.

467847300.name: A bit disappointed
467847300.author: a TripAdvisor user
467847300.reviewBody: after having just been to charming Patzcuaro.  This town is much smaller and there really isn\'t a lot to see except the copper vendors stands.

464640240.name: A must see with very skilled cobre craftsman
464640240.author: a TripAdvisor user
464640240.reviewBody: I\'ve grown up near a copper mine and these artisans take working with copper to a new level.  Wonder, detailed complicated pieces abound.  Don\'t miss a demo if possible...just go!!!!

463756840.name: tiny town specialized in copper handcrafts
463756840.author: a TripAdvisor user
463756840.reviewBody: The town is tiny and not as nice as P\u00e1tzcuaro, but the copper handcrafts are amazing. It is 20 minutes from Patzcuaro and it has at least a dozen stores with beautiful and very affordable copper products. Really worth the trip.

462206501.name: Copper road
462206501.author: a TripAdvisor user
462206501.reviewBody: What an interesting place. We were lucky enough to tour where they make the copper sinks, bathtubs, pots etc. Incredible history. If your buying copper check the weight. The heavier the better quality. Well worth a visit.

458693874.name: the real Mexico
458693874.author: a TripAdvisor user
458693874.reviewBody:
we went to to Santa Clara del Cobre to buy some souvenirs to bring to family and friends
this place is like a open market which you can buy all type of items from leather to metal at a very economic price i should mention that this items are hand made and really good
with 200 Euro you can buy gifts for more than 20 friends and they have a huge variety 
The center of the city is beautiful and the people very friendly
this was a unique experience for me and i recommend it for all
In case you want to eat try the Carnitas

458372623.name: Active, warm colorful pueblo!
458372623.author: a TripAdvisor user
458372623.reviewBody: We arrived on a Sunday. The zocola was packed with Mexican families and vendors selling everything from copper sinks to sombreros. We had a light lunch at a restaurant on the plaza and ended up buying two copper sinks for future projects. Worth a visit!

451766165.name: Copper heaven.
451766165.author: a TripAdvisor user
451766165.reviewBody: If you like anything copper you will rate this town with a 5 , it is nice and it has its history, not too big but nice for a quick visit.

446634443.name: Beautiful, interesting, unique copper art, lots to see and buy
446634443.author: a TripAdvisor user
446634443.reviewBody: It is definitely a great place to visit for a few hours. Start with their museum, which will give you an idea of what they are doing, and then go to a couple of workshops to actually see the artists working. It is definitely worth buying their copper pots and pans since they are very well done and 7th the price of what you will pay in Europe or the US. As for their copper/brass art - it is unique and very attractive. It is definitely cheap by international standards but here you will spend a few hundred USD for a very attractive piece. Once you understand how they do it and how long it takes, you will appreciate it much more. Some of the art pieces for sale are superb. We found Casa Saucedo Ramirez to be a good place to shop - away from the main street, competitive prices and good selection.

437234325.name: Go buy a copper sink
437234325.author: a TripAdvisor user
437234325.reviewBody: Authentic Mexican town with great industry of anything copper.  I have one of their copper sinks...unique addition

435900996.name: Copper goods galore
435900996.author: a TripAdvisor user
435900996.reviewBody: I have visited Sta Clara over 2 dozen times over the past 15 years and I am always happy to walk around and browse. The copper handiworks are amazing (most are made local) and I have acquired a fair amount of kitchen items over the years. From small toys to full size, solid copper bathtubs and fountains, there is something for everyone. Local food vendors abound around the plaza. Enjoy your visit.

418209059.name: An obligated visit when staying in Patzcuaro
418209059.author: a TripAdvisor user
418209059.reviewBody: My family owns hotels around the country and we have one in Patzcuaro. I\'ve been visiting Patzcuaro for as long as I can remember. Santa Clara del cobre is an OBLIGATED visit for all foreigners and nationals alike. The copper factories show you how their artisans "work" their magic with copper. Mostly they use old copper cables used for telephone lines.\nRegardless this is a lot of fun, local stores have a huge range of products and you can have custom made pieces.

417127870.name: To much copper :)
417127870.author: a TripAdvisor user
417127870.reviewBody: Its one of Mexico\'s magical towns and it has lot stores where mostly everything is made of copper.You will love it

416306494.name: Pueblo Magico
416306494.author: a TripAdvisor user
416306494.reviewBody: One of my many magic town that I visited during my June 2016; 19 day visit throughout Mexico.  This town\'s gift to humanity is the Workmanship of the Copper.  wonderful experience.  Must visit a local copper shop.

403267977.name: Copper is King
403267977.author: a TripAdvisor user
403267977.reviewBody:
It had been several years since I had been to Santa Clara del Cobra and it had changed a great deal.  When I visited with my wife several years ago it was on a Saturday.  My daughters and I went on a Monday this time. It seemed more hustled and bustled, less clean and less hospitable.  But we enjoyed ourselves.  I was disappointed because the craftsmen were not working at the National Museum Of  Copper.  They are probably there on weekends and it is a very interesting demonstration.  The Museum itself is interesting with examples from the first pieces created by the Purepecha right up to recent work done by award winning national artisans.  

In previous trips artisans were insistent that we not only see their finished work on display for purchase, but invited us to their shop to see the works being crafted.  That did not happen this trip.  But the copper work is beautiful, and with the current exchange rate more than reasonably priced.   

We ate lunch at a small hotel and restaurant on the Zocalo.  We did not write down the name because we were sure we could remember it; but we do not.  The food was good, but the waiter was young and missed a few things. One of the things that distresses me most in my travels in Mexico is there are no refills on coffee.  Coffee is considered more of an after dinner drink with desert and they bring you a separate cup each time and charge you for each individually.  Some restaurants make an exception at breakfast, particularly if coffee is included in the price of the meal, but do not count on it.  It can come as a shock if you are a big coffee drinker and not aware of the practice.  

Parking is something of an issue as it is in much of Mexico.  We were able to find a place a couple of blocks from the Zocalo and go through the courtyard of the Cathedral to get there.  In addition to numerous shops around the Zocalo there are street vendors set up under the porticos around the Zocalo.  From Morelia or Patzcuaro it is a day trip well worth taking.

375296198.name: Great town for copper shopping...not much more
375296198.author: a TripAdvisor user
375296198.reviewBody:
The purpose of my trip to Mexico was to buy copper products and I found out that Santa Clara del Cobre was the place to do it.  I normally like to stay in very small towns, and I considered making hotel reservations here, but I'm glad I decided to sleep in Patzcuaro.

There are dozens of shops to buy copper in Santa Clara.  Some specialize in small articles, like bowls and trays, and other stores have a large selection of larger types of products, such as tables.  

Bargaining with the vendors was not well received, and for the most part we paid the asking price on virtually everything we bought.  That being said, I spent a few hundred dollars (US) on a table that would have cost $3000 in the states.  I have not yet received it and I will have to pay for the shipping, but I still think it will turn out to be a bargain.

The town itself didn't seem to be that scenic, and while it's a great place to shop for a few hours, once you have accomplished that, it's time to leave.  Patzcuaro, 20 minutes away by car, is larger and offers more for the tourist.

365823205.name: Excellent Craftsmanship
365823205.author: a TripAdvisor user
365823205.reviewBody: Thsi is a quaint city with a proud tradition of copper artistry. Beautiful wares at remarkable prices.  Will definitely visit whenever I visit Patzcuaro.

361038958.name: Number 1 village to visit!
361038958.author: a TripAdvisor user
361038958.reviewBody: Not far by taxi, copper of all kinds and descriptions tumbles out of very store. Up\nthe alley next to the copper museum ( a must!) are two or three shops that have the forges running in the back.  The artisans will welcome you as observers and will show you the whole incredibly fascinating process.  Tip them for their time.

360197529.name: Great Town with Plenty of Copper Shopping!
360197529.author: a TripAdvisor user
360197529.reviewBody: We visited Santa Clara del Cobre with a small group and enjoyed a demonstration at El Porton. We walked across the street to Las Felicitades and they had beautiful copper goods. Then we headed one block down to the National Museum of Copper which was really remarkable. The town was filled with stands and shops. It was Easter weekend so there was plenty of activity. I highly recommend visiting this incredible village of over 300 coppersmiths!!

357930477.name: Small town, nice square and good shopping
357930477.author: a TripAdvisor user
357930477.reviewBody: Known for its copper, there are many stores selling products made of copper.  When we were there on Palm Sunday the square was also full of stalls selling a range of products. Also saw the parade bringing the plants etc to the church.

354633150.name: Authentic "Pueblo M\u00e1gico"
354633150.author: a TripAdvisor user
354633150.reviewBody: Lovely small town in Michoac\u00e1n, famous for the handmade jewelry and artisanal utensils made of copper, the town is full of small workshops were you can find all type of items and gifts, the church and plazas are beautiful places to spend an afternoon

353832103.name: Excellent day trip
353832103.author: a TripAdvisor user
353832103.reviewBody: My wife & I thoroughly enjoyed walking around Santa Clara del Cobre. We visited many of the copper workshops and met a few of the artisans. Great selection of copper items at affordable prices. We watched & learned some of the many techniques used in coppersmithing.

352390099.name: Great to see how it\'s made
352390099.author: a TripAdvisor user
352390099.reviewBody: Took a stop here on our tour of many small towns in the Patzcuaro area.  Our tour guide took us into one shop where the back part was a workshop and we got to see how the copper items are made.  Very Enjoyable!

351690463.name: Art lover heaven
351690463.author: a TripAdvisor user
351690463.reviewBody: Visiting Santa Clara Del Cobre for me is like visiting art musium. I get blown away by the talent of generations of copper masters creating beautiful pieces. You can find there everything... From furniture to ... mirrors... plates and kitchen ware...

347256579.name: Lovely Mexican Town
347256579.author: a TripAdvisor user
347256579.reviewBody: We wanted to see the area around Patzcuaro, Mexico.  It is a very short drive from Patzcuaro to Santa Clara del Cobre.  Wonderful metal working artisans.

346355961.name: Quaint town in beautiful Michoacan
346355961.author: a TripAdvisor user
346355961.reviewBody: This is a lovely town with a calm atmosphere. The copper crafts are beautiful and make very reasonably priced gifts or souvenirs. There are several restaurants around the town square to enjoy a relaxed lunch. We like the coffee shop/copper shop on the square with tables outside so you can watch the world go by while enjoying a cappuchino.

344382223.name: The land of Copper...
344382223.author: a TripAdvisor user
344382223.reviewBody: My wife and I visited Santa Clara as part of a mini-tour of some of the best towns in the state of Michoac\u00e1n... Santa Clara is not to be missed!!!\nIf you are looking for a copper souvenir, this is the place to get it...

335204243.name: Copper land
335204243.author: a TripAdvisor user
335204243.reviewBody: Great place to see real handmade copper and a great tradition of handcrafting that has lasted for more than 500 years , the place is a small village full of copper stores and you will find excellent prices for a real handcrafted pice.

332788180.name: Copper place
332788180.author: a TripAdvisor user
332788180.reviewBody: This is a town, 20 minutes away from Patzcuaro where you can find all kinds of copper handcraft things. also you can visit the copper museum where you can see early on the weekends a local craftsman make a copper  cooking pot. ask for the right timing so you can take pictures, it worth.

332502013.name: Classic Mexican Artisan Town
332502013.author: a TripAdvisor user
332502013.reviewBody: Santa Clara is an excellent example of the many Mexican towns and villages that focus on a particular craft or art.  In Santa Clara, its all about copper.  Take a few minutes to visit the museum then hit the streets.  We particularly enjoyed the shop El Viejo Almacen which across the main street from the main plaza.  They have an excellent selection of practical and decorative locally produced copper products.  If you ask, Olimpia can arrange for you to visit their workshop a couple of blocks away where you get an fascinating hands-on exposure to the their craftsmanship.  On the same street as that workshop,you\'ll find another fine shop/foundry, Cobre el Porton.  Craftmanship in these and other shops is impressive and prices are even lower than you could imagine.  Santa Clara is a great half day trip if you\'re staying in Patzcuaro.

330514297.name: beauty and history both
330514297.author: a TripAdvisor user
330514297.reviewBody: I was lucky to be introduced to Santa Clara del Cobre with an experienced guide who knew several local people and was familiar with the town.  We saw some of the sights we might have missed otherwise, and spent time in the studio of one of the copper artisans.  He showed us many aspects of the process of transforming a lump of unformed copper into beautiful vessels of varying designs.  I even got to wield a very heavy hammer.  The shops are filled with really beautiful crafts ranging from pennies to thousands, all worth way more than their prices.

328860033.name: Worth the Visit
328860033.author: a TripAdvisor user
328860033.reviewBody: Santa Clara del Cobre is definitely worth the visit if you are staying in Patzcuaro.  We watched a demonstration of how copper is handcrafted into beautiful artisan pieces which gave us such an appreciation for the amount of work involved.  If visiting Santa Clara del Cobre, make sure to take in the Copper Museum too.

326266619.name: Excellent place to see classic copper goods workshops ... one of the reasons for the fame of the Patzcuaro Lake!
326266619.author: a TripAdvisor user
326266619.reviewBody: Excellent place to see classic copper goods workshops ... one of the reasons for the fame of the Patzcuaro Lake!

324534612.name: Quaint, lovely town
324534612.author: a TripAdvisor user
324534612.reviewBody: This is a great place to spend the day. Visit the copper museum or some of the shops that hold demonstrations of copper making during the day. There are some nice spots to eat around the plaza.

324200471.name: Copper work that will blow your mind and, possibly, your budget
324200471.author: a TripAdvisor user
324200471.reviewBody: The workshops and stores provide a window onto arts and crafts that continue to impress in memory. Of course, photos help. If you\'ve seen or own a copper sink, it likely came from here. Take your time exploring, and then decide on what to take home.

316176380.name: It Has Become a Habit
316176380.author: a TripAdvisor user
316176380.reviewBody: Santa Clara del Cobre is always a learning experience for us!  While it was quite evident that this wonderful and talented town has been severely hurt by the negative media relating the tragic events that have been somewhat common in recent years - we continue to hold out hope that the town will rebound.\n\nWe understand that many of the merchants have been hurting but were put off by the "time share types" trying to steer the few visitors to the shops paying them a fee!

314938089.name: Nice little town
314938089.author: a TripAdvisor user
314938089.reviewBody:
Was impressed with all the copper available in the
street markets and shops. Very nice. Very authentic
and historical town. Enjoyed also shopping for the
breads, cake, and meats we took into the country
with us.

314773423.name: If you love copper this is for you.
314773423.author: a TripAdvisor user
314773423.reviewBody: I have wanted to go to Santa Clara del Cobre for 45 yrs  I finally got there.  First stop was El Porton, which is off the main street, above the square on the side of the Copper Museum.  They did a great demo of copper forming.

314706162.name: beautiful and peaceful
314706162.author: a TripAdvisor user
314706162.reviewBody: beautiful town!! if you want to buy copper this is the place a lot to see,and you should try the carnitas the are the best in food there.

314701162.name: Hand-Forged and Hammered Copper: Not to Be Missed
314701162.author: a TripAdvisor user
314701162.reviewBody: Just a short 30-minute taxi ride from Patzcuaro, Michoacan is the famed pre-Columbian copper mining town of Santa Clara del Cobre. Getting here was a dream-come-true because it was a place I always wanted to visit. Go to the museum first where you will get a history of copper smithing and see award winning sculptural and functional pieces. Visit the museum store where you might find "a find" -- prices here are much less than in the shops for some very fine quality pieces. Visit the churches to see copper adornments. Walk up side street to visit Casa Felicitas where I bought a huge copper framed mirror that they shipped to me (came whole) for a very small price. Be sure to see the workshop demonstration where you will see the hand-forged and hammered methods. Just a wonderful Mexico artisan experience. Be sure to go away from the main street to get more quality pieces.

313257807.name: Never disappointing!
313257807.author: a TripAdvisor user
313257807.reviewBody: We were shopping for a copper table top and mirror. They are fabulous here and will make anything you want. They also ship anywhere in Mexico so that is an added plus when you want custom pieces!

310669586.name: Looking for Copper?
310669586.author: a TripAdvisor user
310669586.reviewBody: Awesome shopping if you are looking for copper. Free museum. We actually made a purchase for a home improvement project and had it shipped home.

305885875.name: A must visit when staying in Patzcuaro
305885875.author: a TripAdvisor user
305885875.reviewBody: Copper copper everywhere!  Jewelry, pots, trays, vases, sinks, lights, even bathtubs!  Everything in town is made of copper. There are also exhibitions of hammering it out which you can participate in.  A fun and easy side trip.

303505280.name: YOU HAVE SEE this town- beautiful copper town!!
303505280.author: a TripAdvisor user
303505280.reviewBody: Who likes copper-have to visit Santa Clara del Cobre, Just take omni for a 12 pesos and 20 min you are in a real Mexico- copper everywhere!!!! Pots,pans,clocks with a nice painting over copper!!!  BEAUTY!!!!We spent a lot!!!!!!

293810484.name: Buy your copper here
293810484.author: a TripAdvisor user
293810484.reviewBody: We were astonished at the quality and prices of the copper manufactured here. Kitchen sinks, bar sinks, bathroom sinks and hoods, all in copper, were featured. Also jewelry. Buy it and ship it home, as the quality and price invite a remodeling job at home.

292482811.name: Great place to buy copper
292482811.author: a TripAdvisor user
292482811.reviewBody: Many people don\'t realize that Santa Clara del Cobre and Tasco don\'t mine their minerals. It is all imported. None the less it is a great place to buy copper items. They are about 10-25% cheaper in the street. Ask around first before you make a purchase. Everyone has just about the same handcrafts. Beautiful hand painted earrings of copper starting at $20 pesos.

281156534.name: Ground zero for copper
281156534.author: a TripAdvisor user
281156534.reviewBody: As Taxco specializes in silver, Santa Clara del Cobre specializes in copper, and a spectacular job it does too. You can find anything from cheap copper trinkets on the street to spectacular copper artwork and utility products (pots, pans, etc.) in private stores and galleries. The town\'s cool, mountain setting is great, and it\'s just a 15-minute drive to the beautiful colonial town of P\u00e1tzcuaro where you can spend the night.

267571346.name: The real mexico
267571346.author: a TripAdvisor user
267571346.reviewBody: A simple unassuming town going about its business .  Great tacos.  I went to commission some copper designs and it all went smoothly.  A memorable trip to an u touristy town

266480118.name: Well worth the trip
266480118.author: a TripAdvisor user
266480118.reviewBody: Take the time to visit this beautiful town and the copper museum.\nIt\'s only 20 minutes by cab from Patzcuaro.

263790636.name: Lots of copper stores
263790636.author: a TripAdvisor user
263790636.reviewBody: This was not really worth a trip because you can see everything that you see for sale in Santa Clara can also be bought in Patzcuaro for just about the same price.  If you are bored one day, it is a pleasant trip.

261070538.name: Copper
261070538.author: a TripAdvisor user
261070538.reviewBody: Didn\'t stay in the town but it\'s a nice drive from Patzcuaro and great place to pick up some copper pieces. Many shops and choices.

258838413.name: COPPER LOVERS PARADISE
258838413.author: a TripAdvisor user
258838413.reviewBody: Get ready to \'shop till you drop\' in this beautiful colonial town!  Wonderful copper pieces to add to any decor in your home.  Many of the design stores ship everywhere, which is a bonus if you already are loaded with many purchases from the wonderful country of Mexico.  The town is not large and the stores are all centered in one area but you need a good 3 to 4 hours to explore.

254008067.name: Artisan Town near Patzcuaro
254008067.author: a TripAdvisor user
254008067.reviewBody: Santa Clara itself is not the most beautiful town, but the real reason my wife and I went was to see copper crafts and the artisans who make these crafts.  We visited many shops as well as visited an artisan that had approx. 10 workers busy making copper pieces.  We also purchased some items at what I consider very reasonable prices.

250543009.name: Learning the copper making craft.
250543009.author: a TripAdvisor user
250543009.reviewBody: We had a demonstration by one of the crafters which was very interesting and enjoyable. We also bought a few items in the area.

239540105.name: Copper heaven
239540105.author: a TripAdvisor user
239540105.reviewBody: Copper, copper everywhere. Had a working demonstration of the copper making process. Beautiful things to buy. Nice plaza. Very busy during Noche de los Muertos weekend.

234740897.name: The copper factories are an obligated visit
234740897.author: a TripAdvisor user
234740897.reviewBody: Copper is the name of the game in this tiny town. It is worth the visit to go from factory to factory to learn how the artisans bring copper to artful pieces ranging from \u00a1dishes, plates, vases, etc.\nThere is even a live "show" where they teach you how copper is worked. It is a nice visit. For Lunch I would go to Zirahuen or Patzcuaro. Not much to offer here for tourists.

226706939.name: Best copper crafts in Mexico
226706939.author: a TripAdvisor user
226706939.reviewBody: It is nice to find almost anything made in copper at Santa Clara, since the local craftsmen are well known as talented people doing it from prehispanic times. Is was not an accident that back to 1968, the Olimpic games in Mexico, these people were chosen to manufacture the olimpic fire basin, all made of copper, of course!

220174572.name: Nice afternoon visit
220174572.author: a TripAdvisor user
220174572.reviewBody: We travelled from Patzcuaro by bus (14 pesos) for an afternoon visit to this town. \n \nThe museum is a nice place to visit and there are a number of stores selling all sorts of copper products.  As we were travelling light, we only bought earrings and bracelets, and the prices were incredibly low for such beautiful things.  Saw the same earrings in Patzcuaro for three times the price.

212054480.name: Wonderful Village
212054480.author: a TripAdvisor user
212054480.reviewBody: Santa Clara del Cobre has been a stop of mine for the past 4 years.  The merchants are varied and offer a range of quality items, from the mass produced trinkets to the one of a kind pieces of sculptured copper.  As usual, I bought more than the one I planned on buying.  The tourist trade is very slow; the news of the violence in Michiocan is stopping many from visiting.  I stayed on the main roads and did not feel endangered at all.  Many of the shops I had visited previously were closed due to the low tourist trade.  To me, this town is a must see when in the Patzcuaro area.

208913775.name: A must do, visit these Magical towns.
208913775.author: a TripAdvisor user
208913775.reviewBody: The surroundings of Santa Clara and Patzcuaro very much worth the trip for sight seeing, enjoy also the local gourmet and colors.

198295979.name: Charming Village, Great Copper Craftmanship at Bargain Prices
198295979.author: a TripAdvisor user
198295979.reviewBody: A charming Mexican village with the traditional public square surrounded by shops with exquisite copper art and wares. It\u2019s a lovely \u00bd day trip from Patzcuaro. We bought several hand hammered cooking pots 8-10 inches round for about $8 US, a cover for a Bic lighter, hand hammered for $4 US and a handmade copper tile of a dragonfly for $3 US, works of art everyone! Want a copper country kitchen sink this is the place? Gorgeous ones around $700. Shop around, prices vary. The shop with the best prices we found was as follows; stand in the village square facing the main street, walk to your left, leaving the square and down the sidewalk, shop is on the first corner you come to same side of the street as the square.

197530539.name: Worth going to
197530539.author: a TripAdvisor user
197530539.reviewBody: Just 3h 36 min from Zihuatanejo and one of many Magical towns around Patzcuaro. If you can take the time to visit and enjoy the Purepecha culture and the colonial feeling of the town.

193505956.name: Great copper!
193505956.author: a TripAdvisor user
193505956.reviewBody: We caught a local "combi" bus (9 pesos) to Santa Clara del Cobre.from Patzcuaro. There are several local workshops where they are still making the copper items in the traditional way, entirely by hand, no machines. They heat the copper on open fires & hammer it into shapes that range from simple & functional to absolutely astounding. Check out the local copper-working museum, & go to one of the several places where the craftsmen are actually making the copper items. You can watch, & you can pick up a hammer & give the stuff a few whacks to see how it feels. Don\'t expect fancy dining & such; this is down home Mexico. The town center though is surrounded by retail outlets where you can buy anything from an exquisite vase to a hand-made pig boiling vat to (literally) the kitchen sink, Definitely worth the time!

192812198.name: Handcrafted copper
192812198.author: a TripAdvisor user
192812198.reviewBody: Each year we make a trip from the beach town we live in up through Guadalajara and over to Morelia, settle into Patzcuaro and eventually, make the 20 minute trip to Santa Clara del Cobre.  The drive is scenic, easy and safe. Santa Clara is one of  the many unique artisan pueblos in the Patzcuaro area that have developed their own market specializing in one main craft.  Coppersmithing is what draws us to Santa Clara.  You can enjoy an entire morning wandering from shop to shop, comparing a variety of beautiful copper crafts hand made by incredibly gifted local artists.  The prices you will pay here are a fraction of what you would pay in the States or Canada for the same product. (A farmhouse kitchen sink that cost $3,200 in Canada was just over $400 US).  There are a wide variety of copper items including mirrors, kitchen sinks and baths, vases, urns, jugs, candlesticks; and many other beautifully designed products.   The museum holds pieces of copper that are prehispanic as well as showcases annual winners of National and International competitions. Shop owners are friendly and interesting to chat with - lots of history and on site displays of coppersmithing.

188327825.name: Worth the trip.
188327825.author: a TripAdvisor user
188327825.reviewBody: Nice small town focused or course on hand made copper goods. nice scenic drive from Patzcuaro. Two interesting small churches, down home Mexican food and not to crowded. Check out the copper museum.

188297638.name: Another unique craft town in MIchoacan
188297638.author: a TripAdvisor user
188297638.reviewBody:
As the name suggests, Santa Clara del Cobre is all about copper, in just about every crafted and hammered form imaginable. They've been making things out of copper here long before the Spanish showed up, so they know what they're doing. Most of the families have been doing this for many generations. It's unique in Mexico, and maybe in the world.

Nearly all of the shops surrounding the plaza sell copper items, from touristy things like key chains and so forth, to very serious cooking pots, to sinks and bathtubs. It's worth spending an afternoon here and also having a meal at "El Portal", right on the plaza. 

I'm revealing another of my little secrets by mentioning El Portal, but I doubt there's any danger of them being overwhelmed with gringo tourists since nearly the entire state of Michoacan is under a US State Dept travel security alert, as in....don't go anywhere except Morelia and fly directly there if you can. 

However, Danger is my middle name. I almost always drive in Mexico, many thousands of kms over the past 15 years, including all around Michoacan, with no problems ever. I will take the bus if I'm just going to a specific place and returning to D.F. but otherwise having a car is worth it for the ability to stop and check out anything and everything.

The word from my Mexican friends in Patzcuaro, who are maybe in the best position to know since they have lived all their lives there, is not to go down into the Tierra Caliente, but as they say..... 'why would you want to go there anyway?'. So, if you're contemplating a day trip to Nueva Italia, thinking perhaps the town is a reconstruction of Venice in the middle of nowhere in Mexico, I'll save you the trouble. I've been there and can tell you that there are no canals with gondolas gliding quietly by, but I didn't get shot at there, either. I've been way more afraid in South Central LA.

Anyway, back to Santa Clara... if you want a copper comal, this is about the only place in the world you will find one, and they are fantastic for cooking tortillas. And further, if you want anything of copper that is made in Santa Clara, it will be at least 25% less expensive than in Patzcuaro, which is only 30 minutes away. Figure double if you buy the same items in Mexico City. And most of the really amazing things aren't sold in other cities. So, for example, if a person was going to buy something pretty expensive, like a bathtub or a 500 lb. 6 foot tall urn or a set of the most beautiful heavy gauge copper cookware this side of France, it would be worth the trip here just to save a serious chunk of money. And it's a really nice quiet little colonial town. 

We came back twice in two days, just to make sure we went in every shop. There's also a nice little municipal copper museum with a demonstration forge, closed on Mondays.
It may be best to stay in Patzcuaro and make a day trip. I did see one hotel sign but didn't check it out.
I'm not sure why another reviewer only gave it one dot, because it is worth 4. Maybe if she/he went in the evening it would be a 1 because there wouldn't be anything at all to do, or maybe if the reviewer doesn't like copper stuff, but during the day it's definitely worth the visit for anyone with a curious streak and a free day to go there. And one of the days we went was tianguis day, so we got a little bonus.
Venga y disfruta

186114349.name: Worth a detour from Patzcuaro
186114349.author: a TripAdvisor user
186114349.reviewBody: After a short tour around the free museum (not especially worthwhile) I visited Casa Fel\u00edcitas at Pino Suarez No.88 that is both a store and taller (workshop).  You can see and learn about the way they transform recycled copper into beautiful objects including plates, pitchers, bowls and serving trays. People friendly & prices not super cheap but fair for the high quality they offer.

177960239.name: If you like copper......
177960239.author: a TripAdvisor user
177960239.reviewBody: Santa Clara is to copper what Taxco is to silver.  This is the copper capital of Mexico and the products are fantastic.  My favorite store is the Casa Felicitas, which is 1/2 block off the main plaza at #88 Pino Suarez.  They have the most extensive and varied stock that I have found, and have a working exhibition in the back of the building where you can watch the product being made as they have done it for decades.  There are many, many more shops in Santa Clara, so if you\'re into copper products, you can easily spend a whole day there browsing to your heart\'s content.  It\'s just a short drive from Patzcuaro, so be sure not to miss it.

169785544.name: Incredible
169785544.author: a TripAdvisor user
169785544.reviewBody: Be sure to visit Cobre El Porton and watch the works in copper made. I brought back three items which are extraordinary. The owner is a fascinating guy with a great knowledge of his craft, and his area.

169071046.name: Great place for jewelry
169071046.author: a TripAdvisor user
169071046.reviewBody: Made seem weird to say, but this a great place for cooper jewlery. It is not famncy, but it is unique and well-made. Also a very good deal. I have visted this town twice. This last time i bought only jewelry, but three years ago we also bought beautiful bowls. The sinks and furniture are also amazing.

164084856.name: a joy to see traditional Mexico
164084856.author: a TripAdvisor user
164084856.reviewBody: Santa Clara Del Cobre is a famous place in Mexico. First for copper crafting but for also being the home of famous personaje "Pito Perez". At least three movies were made about Pito Perez, you may check Youtube. From The PLaza Vasco De Quiroga in Patzcuaro we took a "combi"( 7 pesos) to la "centrale de camiones" and from there we took a bus to Santa Clara. Cost is about 17 pesos. It is a 30 minutes trip. There are also combis going every few minutes making some stops along the way. In Santa Clara we first saw the busy Sunday market and then we went to the Museo Nacional Del Cobre. There are all kinds of things made from copper, some as low as 10 pesos, some incredibly large pieces for about 15000 pesos: Plates, cooking utensils, sinks, table tops, decorative vases, souvenirs... and even antique looking bathtubs! Great craftsmanship! In the museum courtyard we saw several  craftsmen pounding on a piece of copper after taking it off the fire. There are other places also where you can see how copper is handcrafted, just ask the many stores around. There are other things to see in Santa Clara Del Cobre like the colonial antique portal, the solar clock from the XVIII century, etc. Coming up August 10, 2013 through the 18 is the XLVIII F\u00e9ria Nacional Del Cobre- LXVIII Concurso Nacional de Cobre  Martillo. We did enjoy Santa Clara Del Cobre very much.

157055953.name: AllThings Copper
157055953.author: a TripAdvisor user
157055953.reviewBody: If you can\'t find the copper piece your looking for in Santa Clara del Cobre, give up your search. Having taken part in one of the many demonstrations offered in the town, I have a new app region for copper pieces. Here every piece is completed solely by hand, or many hands as any be required. It is astonishing to see what intricate work these artisans are able to produce. Fom jewelry to pits and vases there is something for everyone. \n

156797294.name: Great show and tell
156797294.author: a TripAdvisor user
156797294.reviewBody: Our group, Los Amigos del Arte Popular had a great time visiting the foundry, where we were shown the forge, the pounding hammers(invited to try our own hammering). We then were free to shop, shop,shop!

154676815.name: Great copper and demonstration
154676815.author: a TripAdvisor user
154676815.reviewBody: We visited Cobre El Porton when we were in Santa Clara.  We found it to have some of the best copper selection and they gave us a great demonstration on how they make their copper things.  If you are in Santa Clara, which is only a short drive from Patzcuaro, be sure to visit this great little store just off the main street.

151829556.name: Great town
151829556.author: a TripAdvisor user
151829556.reviewBody: We spend some time in a copper fabricating shop watching the artisans demonstrate how they melt down and fashion their wares. They displayed their commitment to the continuation of the tradition of hand-working copper.

151017159.name: Charming pueblo
151017159.author: a TripAdvisor user
151017159.reviewBody: The town is beautiful and the copper work they do there is simply fabulous. Wish there were a better restaurant.

146109715.name: Died and Gone to Copper Heaven
146109715.author: a TripAdvisor user
146109715.reviewBody: What an amazing trip and worth every bit of the big- bus ride to Uruapan, smaller- bus to Patzcuaro and taxi to Santa Clara. We are presently in Zihuatanejo. We were fortunate to have a personal demonstration, purely by chance, and they offered my husband a chance to do a little hammering. Truly amazed and impressed by these artisans who turn a piece of hot metal into incredible vases, pots of all kinds, sinks, counter tops....the list is too long. Visited the museum (museo) and they even undercharge for that look and see (only 5 pesos each). The pieces in the museum are so unique- handles on the pots are snakes or reptiles- a continuous piece of the original pot. How they make the big pots is a mystery. Prices are so reasonable. In summary- very pleased we made the trip to an area few foreigners get to experience.

145682567.name: copper shopping
145682567.author: a TripAdvisor user
145682567.reviewBody: gets to be a bit overwhelming with so many shops, but there is some magnificent pieces to be seen and prices are fair

145094882.name: Copper Heaven
145094882.author: a TripAdvisor user
145094882.reviewBody: Just a 40 minute drive from Patzcuaro is Santa Clara del Cobre. As the name implies they make copper here! A must see is the Copper Museum for a demo of how they turn copper into some great articles. Just around the corner about mid-block is a great copper store where you can buy everything from earrings to kitchen sinks in copper. Also check out Casa Felicitas...for very fine copper work!

144696882.name: Charming town
144696882.author: a TripAdvisor user
144696882.reviewBody: The center of town has the beautiful colonial architecture of Michoac\u00e1n. The main plaza is surrounded by beautiful buildings of thick adobe walls, wooden columns, red tiled roofs. There is a Kiosk with a copper roof. It is fascinating to see the way the copper is worked. The museum is very interesting and one can visit different workshops in town. It is worth the trip.

144580203.name: A whole town dedicated to making magnificent copperware.
144580203.author: a TripAdvisor user
144580203.reviewBody: The skill demonstrated by these craftsmen is totally impressive.   They make things out of a lump of copper that just blow your mind.  Days and days of hard work.   If you are interested in Mexican crafts don\'t miss this town.

141742209.name: A MUST DO!
141742209.author: a TripAdvisor user
141742209.reviewBody: If you like copper, this is heaven. Explore many of the stores, because in the back of several there are craftsmen working with the copper, making items while you watch.

140781590.name: Copper heads
140781590.author: a TripAdvisor user
140781590.reviewBody: The best place to visit is the Copper museum where copper-smiths demonstrate their skills. Like so many tourist towns, every shop sells copper-ware (apart from the butcher\'s!).

138304939.name: Annual copper festival
138304939.author: a TripAdvisor user
138304939.reviewBody: Visited Santa Clara during this year\'s copper festival (speciality of the town) and was impressed by the enthusiasm of all the locals who are more than keen to show their way of working the copper and what they manage to produce by hand! There\'s a display of the previous years\' winning objects as well as the current competition. Plus there were concerts in the main square and people everywhere. Was a really lively and passionate little town!

136165810.name: Copper Table!
136165810.author: a TripAdvisor user
136165810.reviewBody: Shopped and bought a beautiful round copper table top!  Now, to design a base...  Maybe in iron?  Cantera?

134858498.name: Beautiful Mexican village
134858498.author: a TripAdvisor user
134858498.reviewBody: It was a beautiful drive through the countryside from Patzcuaro to the town center where parking was easy, the folks friendly and LOTS and LOTS of amazing copper artisans. Don\'t miss the copper museum and displays.

130771665.name: Great little town, friendly and interesting.
130771665.author: a TripAdvisor user
130771665.reviewBody:
We visited here while driving between Morelia and Patzcuaro. It was easy to find and easily accessible on a good paved road. We were hungry when we arrived so we had an excellent three course comida corrida at the hotel on the main square. Sitting outside enjoying the view we all had an excellent Sopa Tarasca, a good crisp green salad and then we all had a different main course, pork chops, chicken en mole and enchiladas. All meals were excellent, the price incredible, and their cafe de olla flavoured with cinnamon, vanilla and a hint of sugar was divine. 

Then fortified with nourishment we went exploring for the copper the town is famous for. All around the square there are many shops selling a variety of things made from copper - even the kitchen sink - really! One shop had a model kitchen in one corner displaying almost any kitchen item you could ever need all done in copper - including the sink and drain board! I fell in love with a huge copper bathtub - but it was out of budget and too big to fit in the Cherokee. As we explored the different shops a fellow came by with a flyer inviting us to a demonstration of how they work the copper. Since it was located close by, in a shop/workshop located just up and around the corner from the main square, how could we resist?

The copper artisans showed us how they start with a lump of copper and by firing it and hammering it several times and using different hammers they turn that lump of copper into a glistening copper pot. Quite fascinating. They also told us that the copper mines in the area are no longer in production so they are making all new items from recycled copper. 

If you are in the area and you like copper don't miss Santa Clara del Cobre.

130439686.name: A Must See & Buy
130439686.author: a TripAdvisor user
130439686.reviewBody: Museum should not be missed.  Many of the shops off detailed demonstrations.  If offered, accept a demo.  The variety of product in the town is impressive.

126612169.name: Copper utensils everywhere
126612169.author: a TripAdvisor user
126612169.reviewBody: Hammered copper artworks to enrich the soul made by hand by some of the most amazing metalsmiths and artisans in the country. Or more utilitarian objects as well ... but shipping these pieces costs more than the works themselves.

125001934.name: Very interesting town
125001934.author: a TripAdvisor user
125001934.reviewBody: If you like copper, this is the place for you! You can watch demonstrations of copper being formed into pots and pans. Very interesting and the copper pieces are very reasonable

123447459.name: copper
123447459.author: a TripAdvisor user
123447459.reviewBody: visit Santa Clara, Mexico\'s most famous copper town, beautiful objects at every store.. amazing

122678392.name: Nice, typical town
122678392.author: a TripAdvisor user
122678392.reviewBody: The town is very cute and keeps the characteristics of the towns that sorround Patzcuaro lake.  The houses are white and red all along downtown.  It has a main plaza where a lot of artisans expose their copper pieces.  You can walk 2 blocks from downtown and go to the actual shops and see the artisans working on their pieces.  Depending on the day of the week and season, one or more shops are open and you can have a little tour with explanation on how copper is worked and pieces decorated.

121871223.name: I had no idea copper could be so beautiful (and useful).
121871223.author: a TripAdvisor user
121871223.reviewBody: This was such an unexpected delight--we took a (nice) bus from Patzcuaro to Santa Clara del Cobre and found the little town clean, charming, and ALL about copper. The museum was filled with extraordinary works of copper art. The finest quality I have ever seen. My husband was amazed while going through the foundry and watching the workers forge copper into beautiful pieces. A worthwhile side trip from Patzcuaro!

121301606.name: Not much to see
121301606.author: a TripAdvisor user
121301606.reviewBody: It is a nice landscape view during the trip, but once you get there, there is not much to do or see.

120879781.name: Gorgeous
120879781.author: a TripAdvisor user
120879781.reviewBody: The workmanship of the copper is wonderful.  Prices are great.

117920595.name: Copper Capital of Mexico
117920595.author: a TripAdvisor user
117920595.reviewBody: Santa Clara del Cobre aka Villa Escalante or Salvador Escalante on many maps is located about a 20 to 25 minute drive into the mountains from Patzcuaro, Michoacan.  Since we import copper products to the US, we have made numerous trips to this town.  Its location means that it is surrounded by mature pines and there is a definite "mountain feel" to the community.  There is a large "indigenous" population and they have been working copper dating back to the pre-Hispanic period.  Roughly 80% of the town\'s population is involved in the making of copper products.  In the early days, copper ore was brought into the region but virtually 100% of todays copper products are made from 100% recycled copper.  The town enjoyed a real boom back in the late 1990\'s and early 2000\'s but has been experiencing a downturn because of 9/11, higher world copper prices and cheap imports from India and China, neither of which can match the handmade techniques, the traditions or the quality of the products from Santa Clara.\n\nStay in either Patzcuaro or Morelia but visit this town for a real educational experience and see some of the finest copper products in the world!  They can certainly use the business!

670563892.name: Wonderful view from the top!
670563892.author: a TripAdvisor user
670563892.reviewBody: If you have time, don\u2019t hesitate to pay a visit to this area. The view of the lake and the town of Patzcuaro from there it\u2019s AMAZING! Unless you are used to hiking uphill and the altitude, I would recommend to drive to the top. If you choose to walk, be aware that it\u2019s a good 3km, almost on a steep hill, but part of the way up has a nice shade from the trees by the road. Bring lots of water, just in case. It\u2019s though, but doable. At the top, there\u2019s a gazebo and some tables to have a picnic or take a rest while looking at the view.

itemReviewed.name: The Stirrup Volcano (Volcan del Estribo Grande)

632184531.name: Exercise to Great View
632184531.author: a TripAdvisor user
632184531.reviewBody: In Patzcuaro, this uphill walk is called El Estribo, and as others have said, it is easy to find the main rocky road. When we travel, we like to workout to get a dose of daily exercise, and in Patzcuaro, El Estribo is an outstanding outdoors option. The start is a little rough with a rocky road climbing through a poor but friendly neighborhood. There is lots of commerce and fellow exercisers on the road to El Estribo making one feel safe. The upper part of the climb is a beautiful, tree-lined road that leads to a fabulous lookout and picnic area. A steep set of 300-400 stairs takes climbers to the very top of the volcano. However, the lookout/ gazebo area has the best view.  In our 7 days in Patzcuaro, we sweated up El Estribo 3 times and loved every 2-hour roundtrip walk. Non-walkers could take a taxi to the lookout area and gazebo to enjoy the fantastic views and appreciate the beauty of Lake Patzcuaro.

itemReviewed.name: The Stirrup Volcano (Volcan del Estribo Grande)

617777205.name: Nice view and hike
617777205.author: a TripAdvisor user
617777205.reviewBody: It\u2018s a nice walk up... you can also drive but walking is a good exercise. The view over the lake and the valley is nice, also to see P\u00e1tzcuaro from the Top. If you do the stairs, you will have a nice view over Patzcuaro town. \nIt\u2019s worth doing that walk. On the way up or down are a view Hotels with a restaurant... they got a nice view over the lake, we didn\u2019t go in but I think always nice for a stop.

itemReviewed.name: The Stirrup Volcano (Volcan del Estribo Grande)

568756616.name: New road to the top and Gazebo make this a must see
568756616.author: a TripAdvisor user
568756616.reviewBody: The volcano know as the Estribo offers spectacular views of Lake Patzcuaro and the surrounding area. There is a new road to the top. Once there you can hike and even climb the steps to the very top of the mountain. Recommended.

itemReviewed.name: The Stirrup Volcano (Volcan del Estribo Grande)

567169549.name: Rough road at beginning but a pleasant walk one you reach the flatter bit.
567169549.author: a TripAdvisor user
567169549.reviewBody: Very rough road for part of route. We drove up and parked after we felt we had been shaken about enough! and then walked on  only to find a newly paved route about 100 yards after parking! Easy walking to the mirador.  Very hazy so didn\'t go to top. Noticed places to eat / drink en route but didn.t have time to check them outl

itemReviewed.name: The Stirrup Volcano (Volcan del Estribo Grande)

537506514.name: Wonderful vistas and good exercise
537506514.author: a TripAdvisor user
537506514.reviewBody: They are currently rebuilding the road in cobblestones and it will be beautiful when it\'s completed. There were no vendors at the mirador, maybe because they\'re rebuilding the road? I highly recommend this hike, it\'s about 3 hours return, and only the last section up the stairs is steep, and the view from up there isn\'t any better, not even as good in fact as   from the quiosco.

itemReviewed.name: The Stirrup Volcano (Volcan del Estribo Grande)

513707930.name: Glorious View!
513707930.author: a TripAdvisor user
513707930.reviewBody: They\'re currently remodeling the road and ensuring that the original character is maintained. We went walking enjoying the shadow of the trees and the view along the way is very good, but as soon as you get to the top this becomes stunning. I LOVE IT!!

itemReviewed.name: The Stirrup Volcano (Volcan del Estribo Grande)

456051186.name: Exercise!
456051186.author: a TripAdvisor user
456051186.reviewBody: This is a great hike up to the observation point, maybe 3 miles from town (just a guess) and uphill most of the way.  I walked Calle Ibarra to the west from town, through poor and middle class neighborhoods.  Just keep heading uphill. This route popular with local joggers and cyclists.  Partway up is Eco Hotel Ixhi which has a lovely breakfast restaurant, open 9 a.m. - noon, a good place to take a break.  All the way up are great views, interesting sights, friendly people.  A new road is under construction the upper part of the hike, and one might stick to the old cobbled road.  At the top is a pavillion, and you can continue to the very top of the old volcano on the 400+ step staircase, but if it\'s hazy you won\'t see much more from there.  One could also take a taxi to the pavilion, and then hike up the stairs.

itemReviewed.name: The Stirrup Volcano (Volcan del Estribo Grande)

378112085.name: Shady Hike - Great Views!
378112085.author: a TripAdvisor user
378112085.reviewBody:
I love Patzcuaro but needed a 'country' fix and this did it.  The other reviews are right just follow Ponce de Leon (runs next to the main Plaza) and it will cross the highway. Take any road that goes 'up' and it will the the right one. You can ask people on the way just to confirm.  You will pass through lovely and interesting village areas then the cobblestone road is lined only with trees and pastures.  I found it easier to take the dirt path running parallel to the road. It ranges from 5-15' away from the road but you are always in sight of it.
Obviously the earlier you go the cooler it is and you will see walkers, runners and cyclists.  I (solo woman) went alone and it was comforting to see the odd sports fiend up there with me.
It was a really lovely trek.  I even took the stairs.  You will see them behind the pavilion. You will huff and puff but it is so worth it at the top!  
Even better views and a wonderful sense of accomplishment1

itemReviewed.name: The Stirrup Volcano (Volcan del Estribo Grande)

348350551.name: View side
348350551.author: a TripAdvisor user
348350551.reviewBody: It was definitely a beautiful place and a nice hike with a beautiful of all of the surrounding mountains and the lake. Breathe taking for sure.

itemReviewed.name: The Stirrup Volcano (Volcan del Estribo Grande)

670307570.name: A nice plaza
670307570.author: a TripAdvisor user
670307570.reviewBody: When we were here, the plaza was surrounded by tents with artisans selling their wares.  So we really didn\'t get to see the square as it would normally be, but we had a wonderful time shopping at all the stalls.

663535375.name: The place for characters
663535375.author: a TripAdvisor user
663535375.reviewBody: Perhaps not somewhere you should be after dark, especially if you are an American, but you will not see so many characterful faces like this close together anywhere else.

658930372.name: Nice plaza to sit and watch parades, dancing, etc
658930372.author: a TripAdvisor user
658930372.reviewBody: This is THE place in Patzcuaro to go and to sit to watch parades, dancing, Sunday strolling.  There are bars and restaurants to sot at if desired.

641835843.name: A great place to relax or have a meal.
641835843.author: a TripAdvisor user
641835843.reviewBody: There are shops, cafes, hotels and a large park like square. One can sit in in a sidewalk cafe and have a drink or a hot chocolate and people watch or have a fine meal in one of the many hotels. At Christmas time they really decorate the plaza!

635094702.name: P\u00e1tzcuaro
635094702.author: a TripAdvisor user
635094702.reviewBody: P\u00e1tzcuaro is located in the center of the state of Michoacan, is known worldwide as a colonial tourist destination and for being located next to the Patzcuaro Lake, also P\u00e1tzcuaro is a magic town. In P\u00e1tzcuaro people can do many things like visiting the \u201cBasilica de Nuestra Se\u00f1ora de la Salud\u201d, or they can go to the \u201cMercado de Artesan\u00edas\u201d, one of the best things to do in P\u00e1tzcuaro is going to see the altars of the day of the dead.\nTypical of the P\u00e1tzcuaro region is the consumption of tamales de zarzamora (blackberry), accompanied by a corn masa atole, or a cup of hot chocolate, also a typical food is pre-Hispanic recipes such as Tarascan tamales made with acoramara, the famous white fish of the region, or the uchepos and the tamales of ash, and finally the famous pasta ice cream.\nAlso, people can buy things such as handcrafts or some typical Mexican clothes like ponchos or clothes embroidered by craftsmen.

614932486.name: I Loved walking Here
614932486.author: a TripAdvisor user
614932486.reviewBody: This is the main square in town-the Plaza Grande. It\'s chock block bars, restaurants, and stores with several hotels to boot. There\'s always something going on in the middle-particularly on weekends. I saw vendors, pony rides, balloons, music, and lots of people to watch. You just can\'t miss this place-literally.

589330334.name: Very green and cool. Pleasant
589330334.author: a TripAdvisor user
589330334.reviewBody: The plaza is extra large, and lined with huge trees which gives it lots of shade. The plaza is very open and green if you like that. It is the center of town so nearly always busy with people. Quite interesting.

577752332.name: Beautiful town square in deepest Mexico
577752332.author: a TripAdvisor user
577752332.reviewBody: There are fantastic artisanal shops surrounding this wonderful deeply authentic Mexican town square. The quality of work was NOT reflected in the prices - it was a fantastic shopping experience - to haggle over price would have been greedy.

577134135.name: We never miss Quiroga while visiting Patzcuaro,my favorite market town.
577134135.author: a TripAdvisor user
577134135.reviewBody: This town is easy to enjoy.  It\u2019s a market town with a heart.  Just a couple main streets full of good shops, a continuous street market, and a clean,colorful plaza with a super good restaurant.   Carnitas vendors line the street in front of the plaza, and they are famously good, but we choose to go sit in the restaurant in the plaza and have a half kilo of carnitas. Very well served, a serious place.  It\u2019s been here for a long time.  We never miss going here when in Michoac\u00e1n.

576642142.name: Beautiful plaza filled with tradition
576642142.author: a TripAdvisor user
576642142.reviewBody: This is the center of downtown Patzcuaro and the home of the iconic fountain with a statue of a very important character in the history of Michoacan, Vasco de Quiroga. He was a man who came from Spain around 1530\u2019s and helped organizing the towns close to the lake in different trades so there would be commerce and economic growth in the area. Very beautiful plaza that most of the time has music playing, artists selling their paintings or dancers that show the traditional \u201cdance of the old men\u201d. Around the plaza you\u2019ll find many different restaurants or cafes to enjoy the nice breeze of Patzcuaro.

574595886.name: Lively and well maintained
574595886.author: a TripAdvisor user
574595886.reviewBody: Like all Mexican towns Patzcuaro has a central plaza.  This one is quite large considering the size of the town.  It is also very clean and well maintained with lots of trees to provide for a cool place to rest on a hot day.

572743033.name: A beautiful and romantic square
572743033.author: a TripAdvisor user
572743033.reviewBody: Loved hanging around this square and people watching eating and loving live as the many people do on a regular day.

570842157.name: One of Mexico\'s most beautiful Plazas
570842157.author: a TripAdvisor user
570842157.reviewBody: Plaza Vasco de Quiroga ("Plaza Grande" to the locals) is marvelous!  The tall shade trees are incredible, as are the centuries old buildings containing the city hall, shops and restaurants that surround the plaza. You can spend several hours just savoring the sights.  Any visit to Patzcuaro must include a visit to Plaza Vasco de Quiroga

567875783.name: Peaceful.
567875783.author: a TripAdvisor user
567875783.reviewBody: They are in the process of upgrading the streets around the plaza.  Will look amazing when done. Beautiful square stones and nice curbs add to the effecr.

564962962.name: Social Center
564962962.author: a TripAdvisor user
564962962.reviewBody: This tranquil main square was inviting - clean and shady - after a morning of sightseeing, but the best was the ice cream sold from carts under porticos across the street. My elote (corn) was the best! Stroll around the stores on the periphery to get a taste of life in Central Mexico.

561964173.name: Beautiful Historic Location
561964173.author: a TripAdvisor user
561964173.reviewBody: Great location with tons of historical buildings and fun stores and street vendors. This area has so much history and beautiful statues and fountains. It\'s a good opportunity to sight see and buy tons of artisan souvenirs to bring home. I bought a bunch of silver bracelets and jewelry, wooden toys, handwoven clothes and scarves. This is such a beautiful area that I would certainly recommend a visit here!!!

560503632.name: Beautiful square. spotless and fascinating.
560503632.author: a TripAdvisor user
560503632.reviewBody: I loved this beautiful square. At night it was lit up with nice lighting and there are a number of nice shops and restaurants all around it. Quieter than the bustling smaller square down the street. Personally I didn\'t like the elevator music that was constantly playing. If they are going to do this, at least play some local or Mexican music. Not easy listening jazz.

559889471.name: Well groomed downtown plaza
559889471.author: a TripAdvisor user
559889471.reviewBody: We have been to various downtown "Pueblo M\u00e1gico\'s" plazas across Mexico. This one has to be one of the most well kept ones. Ambient music playing in the background set to a beautiful park bustling with activities. City has done a great job balancing the mix of street vendors. They are present, but don\'t overpower the essence  of the pueblo. Great job P\u00e1tzcuaro!

557349223.name: "Dance Of The Old Ones"
557349223.author: a TripAdvisor user
557349223.reviewBody: We were on a full day private tour from Morelia touring some of the small towns of Michoacan. We decided to stop in Patzcuaro for lunch. Spent an hour or so in this central plaza as there was music and locals dancing the "Los Viejtos" or the dance of the aged!! Being in our late sixties we could identify with this!!! Dancers were dressed in colorful attire and were quite entertaining. The square itself is quite beautiful with enormous trees , and well maintained colonial structures surrounding it. Grab an ice cream or other sweet from one of the local vendors and sit back and relax!!

549483269.name: The Beating Heart of Patzquaro
549483269.author: a TripAdvisor user
549483269.reviewBody: The square is a magnet for everybody in town. We were there over Christmas and it was packed with giant straw figures of regions in Michoacan.
