Lots of vendors, kids, music, and families promenading in the evening.  Best spot in town to experience small town Mexican culture.  We loved it and the people of Mexico!

546925511.name: A magical place!
546925511.author: a TripAdvisor user
546925511.reviewBody: You need to visit Patzcuaro and eat an corn, ice cream, enchiladas, all here is delicious and wonderful!

545620324.name: One of Mexico\'s loveliest plazas!
545620324.author: a TripAdvisor user
545620324.reviewBody: Large and beautiful plaza enjoyed at all times of day and night.  The highlight of a visit to Patzcuaro without doubt!

541464726.name: Central Plaza
541464726.author: a TripAdvisor user
541464726.reviewBody: All around the Plaza at Easter, there were tents set up for the Artisans to sell their products. One block away at a smaller Plaza, the native women were making a sweet bread wrapped in corn husks.  Very tasty and unique.

538269444.name: Relaxing
538269444.author: a TripAdvisor user
538269444.reviewBody: Great place to relax during the day but at night it comes to life with the local vendors and the inhabitants strolling through the streets. We were there when the day of the dead celebrations took place and the plaza was nicely decorated and made an alter to commemorate the monk who helped this town during the Spanish rule.

537507709.name: Lots of activities for los Muertos!
537507709.author: a TripAdvisor user
537507709.reviewBody: I was here the week of Los Muertos and they had entertainment every night, starting before sunset. They had some great bands and traditional dancers. Plus, of course, lots of vendors with food, clothes, ornaments, you name it. The plaza was more beautiful before they set it up for the mercado, with a few fountains and many plants. Lots of good street food and restaurants. I went early in the morning before they set up the mercado and many people were jogging and walking around the plaza.

535575281.name: The most beautiful place on the magic village of Patzcuaro
535575281.author: a TripAdvisor user
535575281.reviewBody:
The center of any city tells us about its legacy, its history and tradition, there is no place that reflects more the identity of this culture than that part.

In this case, the main square of Patzcuaro is that magical place where people congregate, where all the people and tourism converge.

513721377.name: Clean, Green and Lovely Plaza!
513721377.author: a TripAdvisor user
513721377.reviewBody: It is very relaxing walking around this Plaza while eating one Nieve or Elotes! There is always something going on and the colonial architecture is just perfect : )  I highly recommend this place!

494851980.name: The prettiest plaza in Mexico
494851980.author: a TripAdvisor user
494851980.reviewBody: We\'ve seen many Mexican plazas, and Patzcuaro\'s is the prettiest! A dedicated army of cleaners keeps it tidy, as they obviously take great pride in it. Sunday nights are the liveliest, with families strolling and eating and often watching live entertainment.

492159334.name: Beautiful stroll
492159334.author: a TripAdvisor user
492159334.reviewBody: Beautiful large town square, always people strolling by, on weekends it is very busy with families out for visiting

485782200.name: Nice plaza
485782200.author: a TripAdvisor user
485782200.reviewBody: Come in to town this place is center of town.  Park the car walk around see artwork get ice cream enjoy history of building around !! Very nice!

484520409.name: Enchanted
484520409.author: a TripAdvisor user
484520409.reviewBody: Right in the heart of P\u00e1tzcuaro is this place where you can see the typical dance of "the aged ones" or "Los viejitos", eating a delicious ice cream of a variety of flavors.

470951259.name: The heart of the city. Always something going on there.
470951259.author: a TripAdvisor user
470951259.reviewBody: Don\'t be shy -  savor the ice creams from the stands on the arcade.\nLovely spot to stroll and people watch.

468843093.name: Large central square with many activities
468843093.author: a TripAdvisor user
468843093.reviewBody: This is a very large square with a parquet and fountains, surrounded by uniformly old buildings with shops and restaurants. A great place to have lunch and see people strolling by.

468528653.name: Great place
468528653.author: a TripAdvisor user
468528653.reviewBody: Great place to visit you can shop souvenirs and wonderful places to visit and take pictures is a beautiful town.

467846576.name: Quite authentic
467846576.author: a TripAdvisor user
467846576.reviewBody: I was extremely impressed with this charming town, especially that it dates back to the 1300\'s.  There are dancers in the zocolo (plaza) and lots of other activity.  Stores & restaurants are clustered around it, too.  It is safe and clean.  Don\'t believe the terrible things that you hear about Mexico.  The people are wonderful and there is much to see.

463755135.name: Nice to wak around and relax. Beautiful old trees.
463755135.author: a TripAdvisor user
463755135.reviewBody: The plaza is in the middle of everything; you can visit dozens of tiny stores and restaurants around the plaza and enjoy the view of the huge trees that appear to be a hundred years or more.

462587068.name: Once you park, easy to walk and get a feel for the town, everything is close
462587068.author: a TripAdvisor user
462587068.reviewBody:
The  four corners of the town square give you bearings. The square with the city market is one block away past the Surdito restaurant and I enjoyed eating at the market.  
I ate at El Patio and the El Naranjo Restaurant and Hotel.  Half a block down Dr. Coss is the House of Eleven Patios shopping . There is also a great mescal place which had had tamarind infused mescal and a star fruit infused mescal which are perfect after dinner. Next door to them is an art, coffee,  drinks stop that has great prices on tshirts, some with the murals of Jose Guadalupe Posada who started the Catrina’s, they also have a mescal. The shop in El Naranjo two stores away has the more colorful Catrina tshirts made famous by Diego Rivera and Freida.
Walking to the other corner of the square and uphill, then left is another little outdoor market during the day.  You will also go past another small mescal shop with very friendly and outgoing bartenders.  
The Patzcuaro neon type sign is a little out of place.  Sundays are happening.  Just walk around.

452156328.name: A lot to take in.
452156328.author: a TripAdvisor user
452156328.reviewBody:
This plaza initially looks like many others in many other Mexican towns, BUT, in fact, there is a lot to see and take in.  
The square itself is lovely, busy and seems to defy or go against traditional settings.  What one thinks is the church is in fact a library.  Kitty corner to it is an old old hotel....neat old entrance and courtyard - we're talking centuries old.
Music by a quartet of the oldest fellas I've seen playing, was wonderful.  They earned their pesos from us.
And the artisan market - whew!  Breathtaking....and by that I mean in the literal and figurative sense.  Smells good and bad, sights that surprised and delighted, sounds of ever busy crafts people.  The children we were with had their mouths agape the entire time.

447322677.name: Downtown best
447322677.author: a TripAdvisor user
447322677.reviewBody: When you are here, you are in downtown and you can go to the surrounding by walking. If you can try to walk around early in the morning before the city movement starts and you will pick the sense of history and it\'s like being there a hundred years ago. Near the plaza you will find a lot of eating and hotel options you won\'t be disappointed. Try to reach and leave town during the day light and use tolled routes in order to be safer.

445481845.name: Mexico\'s Best Plaza ???
445481845.author: a TripAdvisor user
445481845.reviewBody: Patzcuaro\'s "Plaza Grande", as it is called locally, is arguably the prettiest plaza in Mexico.  Stately old trees, spacious open areas and colonial buildings surrounding it, make Plaza Vasco De Quiroga a " must see" in Mexico!  The Christmas display this year involves the entire plaza, and is a unique demonstration of the craftsmanship of the artisans of Michoacan.  Very SPECIAL indeed! \ud83d\udc4c

438866896.name: Central point.
438866896.author: a TripAdvisor user
438866896.reviewBody: Large plaza with lots of activities, lots of shade, many restaurants in the area, easy acces to many points of interest.

438792997.name: Lots of fun
438792997.author: a TripAdvisor user
438792997.reviewBody: Sit on any of the colonial benches shaded by ancient trees, and watch the world go around. What a lively place to people watch, eat some delicious \'atole de grano\' \'corn on the cob\' or ice cream which has been hand made by generations. Purepecha Indians come to perform some of their traditional dances, there are balloons, children\'s toys, families, couples in love, you name it. We had a blast strolling, buying food, or sitting in the plaza.

437945007.name: Tianguis Artesanal de Noche de Muertos Covers the Plaza
437945007.author: a TripAdvisor user
437945007.reviewBody:
Dia de los Muertos aka Day of the Dead is a huge event in the State of Michoacan and Patzcuaro in particular.  Patzcuaro has been hit hard by all the negative publicity generated by the cartels.  But for this particular function, the city is absolutely jammed to overflowing and functions are going on all over the place.

Plaza Vasco de Quiroga aka the Gran Plaza is ground zero for the huge market and if one cannot find something that appeals, they have their eyes closed.

We have visited mercados and markets all over Mexico and this was one of the best ever!

435907610.name: Typical Plaza for the region
435907610.author: a TripAdvisor user
435907610.reviewBody: Lots of local stores and cafes surround the main square. Parking is very challenging, look for a private parking area on your way in and avoid the headaches. For Noche de los Muertos, the plaza wa filled with craft vendors from around the country. Everything from candles to clothing, Katrinas and coffee. Happy Travels.

435707841.name: Day of the Dead shopping
435707841.author: a TripAdvisor user
435707841.reviewBody: Convent to hotel and offered a great assortment of local merchandise.  We found quality at very affordable prices.

434410283.name: Amazing!
434410283.author: a TripAdvisor user
434410283.reviewBody: Big plaza with all sorts of artesanias, typical clothes and wood furniture. Everything at a very good price. Attractions as live music and restaurants make it a must-see point at Patzcuaro.

433587147.name: Beautiful main square, I think it is the largest one in Mexico.
433587147.author: a TripAdvisor user
433587147.reviewBody: Great place to hangout in the afternoons. The Surtidora Restaurant   is located there as well as many others. During the weekends many local artists exhibit their paintings at very reasonable prices. Also a great place for people watching.

420973382.name: Patzcuaro Heritage
420973382.author: a TripAdvisor user
420973382.reviewBody: My family and ancestors are from this region so I have a great deal of appreciation for this place. It\'s so beautiful and full of history. The crafts and things people sell in the plaza are so cool. Also food there is amazing! Try the "elote" it\'s corn and it\'s the best snack.

418212445.name: YOU have to visit it... Period
418212445.author: a TripAdvisor user
418212445.reviewBody: Patzcuaro city is small but it has as it\'s main plaza (it has two) the plaza is the heart of this small city. restaurants, shops and museums are either on the plaza or a few steps from it. \nFew people know it but it\'s the second largest plaza in the country.

413142702.name: Historic Center of Patzcuaro
413142702.author: a TripAdvisor user
413142702.reviewBody: Surrounded by colonial building where you can eat and sleep, this is the main plaza of the city.  Look for traditional dancers who perform on Saturday and Sunday afternoons.

404069050.name: Big is better
404069050.author: a TripAdvisor user
404069050.reviewBody: The larger and more relaxed of Patzcuaro\'s two plazas.\nGreat for people watching, jogging, \nBeautifully maintained.

403266252.name: An Interesting Side Trip
403266252.author: a TripAdvisor user
403266252.reviewBody:
It had been several years since I had been to Santa Clara del Cobra and it had changed a great deal.  When I visited with my wife several years ago it was on a Saturday.  My daughters and I went on a Monday this time. It seemed more hustled and bustled, less clean and less hospitable.  But we enjoyed ourselves.  I was disappointed because the craftsmen were not working at the National Museum Of  Copper.  They are probably there on weekends and it is a very interesting demonstration.  The Museum itself is interesting with examples from the first pieces created by the Purepecha right up to recent work done by award winning national artisans.  

In previous trips artisans were insistent that we not only see their finished work on display for purchase, but invited us to their shop to see the works being crafted.  That did not happen this trip.  But the copper work is beautiful, and with the current exchange rate more than reasonably priced.   

We ate lunch at a small hotel and restaurant on the Zocalo.  We did not write down the name because we were sure we could remember it; but we do not.  The food was good, but the waiter was young and missed a few things. One of the things that distresses me most in my travels in Mexico is there are no refills on coffee.  Coffee is considered more of an after dinner drink with desert and they bring you a separate cup each time and charge you for each individually.  Some restaurants make an exception at breakfast, particularly if coffee is included in the price of the meal, but do not count on it.  It can come as a shock if you are a big coffee drinker and not aware of the practice.  

Parking is something of an issue as it is in much of Mexico.  We were able to find a place a couple of blocks from the Zocalo and go through the courtyard of the Cathedral to get there.  In addition to numerous shops around the Zocalo there are street vendors set up under the porticos around the Zocalo.  From Morelia or Patzcuaro it is a day trip well worth taking.

402640592.name: Sunday afternoon entertainmen
402640592.author: a TripAdvisor user
402640592.reviewBody: The square was full of families, vendors, dancers, and artists.  A delightful mix of stores, festaurants, and impromptu entertainment.

401317051.name: Family
401317051.author: a TripAdvisor user
401317051.reviewBody: Great Place to Enjoy a hot Esquite (mixed corn with Mayo, lime, cheese and Chile). After have an ice cream of Pasta from Erendira. If you like photos, just right after sunset there is great like for beautiful family pics. Walk around and have hot coco or coffee at Lillian\'s Coffees and enjoy a 2x1 Crepe. Nutella is my fav.  A magical place.

399796334.name: Cool town
399796334.author: a TripAdvisor user
399796334.reviewBody:
I loved this place. The square is beatiful. Full of people and good stands in the weekend. But also you will find a lot of handcraft shop and one beautiful museum. I highly recommend to go there and enjoy the city. 

Since here there is no place to put the review of the museum of the city I want to highly recommend to go there it's a beautiful, lovely and wonderful museum. 

Highly recommended

399650210.name: Lovely plaza, nice walk
399650210.author: a TripAdvisor user
399650210.reviewBody: Nice walk around patzcuaro, great to shop and eat something in its Portales, many places to pick from....hotels and restaurant all around the square.

396970794.name: Great place to hang out
396970794.author: a TripAdvisor user
396970794.reviewBody: The Plaza is a lovely space to hang out and eat something yummy. They constantly have different groups of dancers performing "LA danza de los viejitos" And it\'s a good place to just spend a relaxing afternoon. It\'s also beautifully lit at night.

392982342.name: A great plaza!
392982342.author: a TripAdvisor user
392982342.reviewBody: I visited this place a few years ago, and I was there last september. The place is great! This plaza is one of the three plazas in the city that are a walking distance from each other. \nHere at Plaza Vasco de Quiroga I enjoyed seeing local artists selling their paintings and I also liked seeing the ancient folcklore dance "Baile de los Viejitos" (the old folks dancing). \nThe plaza is surrounded by restaurants, cafes and hotels. No wonder they called "Pueblo Magico" (magic town).

381427274.name: One of the nicests pueblos in whole Mexico
381427274.author: a TripAdvisor user
381427274.reviewBody: Patzcuaro is really a magic place, it is really more a rural and typical mexican center. Live is calm and food is really good. Highly recommendable for a relaxing weekend.

380916016.name: A Must see and EAT town!
380916016.author: a TripAdvisor user
380916016.reviewBody: Quiroga is known throughout Mexico for its Carnitas, Estilo Michoacan. There is no corner you turn without encountering food and locally produced sweets and candy. The main road through the town will lead you to the main plaza where you will see a street lined up with Carnitas carts, leathe goods, candy shops, chocolate shops, coffee shops and LIME ICE CREAM. famously known and televised by travel shows, Carnitas Carmelos is the most delicious of them all. They have been visited by none other than Sofia Vergara back when she did her travel show. I must admit  a bias with Carmelo\'s Carnitas because my grandfather was a supplier  of swine for him but it is not a bias for granted. Their family recipe is truly delicious and not fatty. One can use Quiroga as a meeting point with travelers from other cities Morelia, or as a base as you tackle local "Pueblo Magico" (magical towns) like Tzinztunztan , Patzcuaro,  and the island of Janitzio (famously known for its day of the dead event). In Quiroga you will also encounter Pozole Blanco Batido, it is the richest and tastiest pozole(hominy) dish you will ever  taste. It is a local and protected recipe so don\'t expect to find it anywhere else. I can go on for hours but this is truly an awesome town located in a pine forest of Mexico that I have known since I could walk and to this never fail to visit when I\'m in the neighborhood.

377739835.name: Feels like Italy!
377739835.author: a TripAdvisor user
377739835.reviewBody: I live in San Miguel and our Jardin is very nice but I love the huge old trees, the open areas and the fountain here in the main Patzcuaro plaza.

372750670.name: One of the nicest squares in the whole of Mexico
372750670.author: a TripAdvisor user
372750670.reviewBody: The old trees, the white buildings around it, it is a wonderful square in a wonderful town.  Don\'t miss it when in Michoacan.

361037380.name: Central square
361037380.author: a TripAdvisor user
361037380.reviewBody: This is a remarkably beautiful plaza, popular with locals\nand travellers alike. Its the center of action in town. On Easter week it is surrounded by canopies and crammed with vendors selling various forms of locally crafted art and souvenirs to locals and travellers alike. Many cafes,\nsome stores.

358547702.name: Must visit!
358547702.author: a TripAdvisor user
358547702.reviewBody: Vasco de Quiroga square is located in the downtown of Patzcuaro and it\'s definitely a place to meet if you are near this region, if you visit during the weekend you\'ll probably be able to find musicians playing live music, seeing local dancers and artisans exhibitions.\nRight in front of the plaza there are some portals where you can try their famous "Pasta" ice cream (although I\'d strongly recommend trying the corn ice cream) and if it gets cold you can get inside any of the small coffee shops where you can taste the hot chocolate.

358147666.name: Central place
358147666.author: a TripAdvisor user
358147666.reviewBody: This is were the action is patzcuaro  wonderful  plaza very historical  lots of caf\u00e9 And restaurant . The site of many events  during the year

357926764.name: Full of artisans\' stalls on Palm Sunday
357926764.author: a TripAdvisor user
357926764.reviewBody: Absolutely overwhelming amount of artisans\' work available here on Palm Sunday.  It was full of marquees so hard to get the idea of the park itself, but I sat in the square in the middle of the marquees to eat my lunch and it was very pleasant with fountains and families.

354636033.name: Lovely town!
354636033.author: a TripAdvisor user
354636033.reviewBody: Beautiful town full of history Catholic Church, beautiful plazas and gardens, the handmade "Nieves" (ice cream) are delicious, the La Casa de los Once Patios" and the Muelle San Pedrito are the best places for shopping, excellent restaurants are located around the Plaza de Quiroga

353842122.name: Wonderful cultural experience
353842122.author: a TripAdvisor user
353842122.reviewBody: Immerse yourself in the local culture of the Patzcuaro Lake region.  Purepecha people inhabit this area and the culture survives despite Spanish dominance. Many local hand worked items are available for sale; pottery, weaving, painted wood, music and more. Spanish is the local language, and not much English is spoken, but the people are very friendly and patient with foreigners. Be ready to say ,"Buenos Dias" to each person you meet on the street!

351690034.name: My favorite place
351690034.author: a TripAdvisor user
351690034.reviewBody: I can spend the whole afternoon here sipping wine ... reading a book...watching people. Patzcuato is my gateway place and plaza grande is a favorite spot.

346401803.name: Beautiful and clean park
346401803.author: a TripAdvisor user
346401803.reviewBody: Big plaza with nice shades and is very well maintained. There are nice restaurants & Cafes surrounding the plaza.

346358789.name: Patzcuaro really is a Pueblo magico
346358789.author: a TripAdvisor user
346358789.reviewBody:
We love Patzcuaro and visit regularly. The square always has some form of entertainment happening be it the gentle music from the speakers around the square or the dance of the viejos. 

There are many restuarants around the square where you can enjoy a good meal, a coffee and just watch the world go by.

There is also so much more to see around Patzcuaro, I would recommend spending the day there.

341669207.name: beautiful plaza.
341669207.author: a TripAdvisor user
341669207.reviewBody: with christmas decor, clean and nice green grass around it love the 3 fountains in the plaza the one in the middle is big and has very nice lighting. nice and clean  water too.

341194832.name: Big, Calm Plaza
341194832.author: a TripAdvisor user
341194832.reviewBody: Very nice, huge plaza with a fountain, benches, and a lot to see.  It is one of the hubs of the city.  My only suggestion is for more landscaping to make it even more beautiful.

334816048.name: 100% Mexican Charm
334816048.author: a TripAdvisor user
334816048.reviewBody: Mexico doesn\'t get much better than this plaza, also know in town as The Gran Plaza. Just stunning, especially decked out for the holidays. Great restaurants, shops & colonial buildings add to the charm.

329730016.name: Wow!  This is the Mexico street life experience youre looking for
329730016.author: a TripAdvisor user
329730016.reviewBody: Just walk past the food stalls on the S side....the colors alone are amazing.\n\nMusic, bells, cannons, singing, vendors, kids, people dressed up, movie festival....this place is HAPPENING!  you could have a whole vacation on this plaza.

329434142.name: Stupendous plaza
329434142.author: a TripAdvisor user
329434142.reviewBody: Patzcuaro\'s government claims this is the largest plaza in Mexico after the Z\u00f3calo of Mexico City. Maybe it is. Doesn\'t matter. It\'s a beautiful plaza, huge, with towering trees, clean fountains and a piped-in music system for lovely background tunes that are not too loud. I cannot imagine where they found a Mexican who would play music at a reduced volume. The plaza is especially nice at night when it has subtle lighting.

328601130.name: Large square with a central garden and shops and restaurants
328601130.author: a TripAdvisor user
328601130.reviewBody: This is a nice very large square defined on the four sides by small buildings with the white and red painting typical of Patzcuaro. It lacks imposing palaces and churches but it is nevertheless interesting, with good restaurants and some less touristic shops.

326075501.name: Interesting plaza ... very nice decorations during the Day of the Dead Celebration!
326075501.author: a TripAdvisor user
326075501.reviewBody: Interesting plaza ... very nice decorations during the Day of the Dead Celebration!\n\nNice to stroll around with lots of cool trees  ... a nice open space.

324534433.name: Beautiful Plaza
324534433.author: a TripAdvisor user
324534433.reviewBody: We visited when the plaza was packed with artisans, but still found it to be a beautiful place. Restaurants and hotels surround the plaza.

323403388.name: Nice place to spend an evening
323403388.author: a TripAdvisor user
323403388.reviewBody: We were there on a Saturday evening and there was a movie screen set up, with families watching an animated children\'s movie.  Ice cream vendors, musicians, people of all ages wandering about, not unlike the plazas in many Mexican cities on a Friday or Saturday, with lots of activity surrounded by narrow streets with lots of traffic.

314938761.name: Town centre square
314938761.author: a TripAdvisor user
314938761.reviewBody:
Went in to the town centre on the Friday evening and it
was alive with people and music. Shopped in some of the
stores around the plaza and enjoyed a drink at a rather 
unique bar/restaurant. A very enjoyable evening and the
taxi ride from the Best Western was very reasonable. Much
better to take the cab than try to park

312363998.name: The best spot
312363998.author: a TripAdvisor user
312363998.reviewBody: The main spot for souvenirs, restaurants and entertainment. Experience the traditional food from the stands such as "tamales and stole" and the bread.

303507538.name: Peacfull and beautiful plaza GRANDE!!!!
303507538.author: a TripAdvisor user
303507538.reviewBody: Our best place to relax!! Plaza GRANDE!!! A lot of young and old people!!  Dogs and musicians!!!People not in a hurry!!  Kids playing on the grass,Elderly watching youngsters, pretty girls and boys!! At the evening a lot of music in the different corners!!! Great place!!!

301973137.name: Great place to sit and watch the town go by...
301973137.author: a TripAdvisor user
301973137.reviewBody: This is the municipal plaza, surrounded by restaurants and shops, and housing official offices. Perfect place to sit with some ice cream or a snack and plan your next bit of shopping. Beautiful all year round.

299701837.name: Plaza Grande Patzcuaro
299701837.author: a TripAdvisor user
299701837.reviewBody: Beautiful square in the heart of Patzcuaro. The square contains a statue of Don Vasco Quiroga and is surrounded by hotels and restaurants.

297820707.name: Charming and alive!
297820707.author: a TripAdvisor user
297820707.reviewBody: We were here on Sunday and the place was alive with families and couples and people of all ages, enjoying the charming plaza and all that it has to offer. We got a delicious ice cream from a historical street vendor, and sat and watched an amazing performance of traditional local dance. So many other things going on. Make time to hang out here if you\'re in Paztcuaro.

293808306.name: Colonial town square
293808306.author: a TripAdvisor user
293808306.reviewBody: Colonial town square surrounded by good restaurants and cafes. Walkable town with low costs in the summer "off" season.

263790317.name: placid square
263790317.author: a TripAdvisor user
263790317.reviewBody: This is the quieter square lined with gift shops and restaurants.  In the early evening people are sitting in cafes, eating ice cream, relaxing.

261058722.name: Where the action is
261058722.author: a TripAdvisor user
261058722.reviewBody: This Plaza Grande is the heart of Patzcuaro. During the 3 days we were there, there was a little parade on the eve of St. Joseph\'s Day and another on the first day of Spring (school children dressed as flowers, insects, animals). The four sides are lined with shops, restaurants and ice cream stands. Families bring children to play while others simply take a bench seat and mellow out. You will too.

260868762.name: The Center of Patzcuaro in many ways
260868762.author: a TripAdvisor user
260868762.reviewBody: There is always something going on in the plaza. Dancing, music, performances, food vendors and more. I love spending time on "Plaza Grande."

252593994.name: Michoacan
252593994.author: a TripAdvisor user
252593994.reviewBody: The Mexican state of Michoac\u00e1n has gotten a lot of bad press. We recently spent 4 days driving in Michoac\u00e1n. We spent a little time in Patzcuaro, Angangueo, and Morelia and loved every minute of it. The people were wonderful, friendly and always helpful. At no time did we feel at all threatened. We were careful to give ourselves lots of driving time so we would be off the road well before dark. A little common sense will keep travellers safe. There is so much to do and see in this state.  Most of the people are very poor so every peso you spend helps a little. The hotels were very clean and served good food. The friends we were travelling with have spent a much longer time exploring Michoac\u00e1n and have only good things to say about it. We look forward to returning there soon.

240822656.name: Fun place in Patzcuaro to people watch, especially in the evenings.
240822656.author: a TripAdvisor user
240822656.reviewBody: Lots of families and young couples.  People bring their dogs out for walks and to play with the kids.

234741986.name: If in Patzcuaro, this is your starting place
234741986.author: a TripAdvisor user
234741986.reviewBody: Few people know it but it is one of the largest plazas in the country. It is surrounded by restaurants, homes and souvenir shops. The secret is to go to the ice cream vendors and order an "Helado de Pasta" which is produced freshly from milf every single morning and it is a delicacy that I haven\'t found anywhere else.\nFrom the plaza you can pretty much walk the town.\nIt is nice to have a stroll. relax and enjoy the shops, restaurants and gardens.

233112664.name: This is Mexico?
233112664.author: a TripAdvisor user
233112664.reviewBody: This very leafy, green plaza did not seem like Mexico to me. It had no church or cathedral, and there were just so many trees! Very pretty, however, surrounded by mansions converted for more\ntourist-oriented ventures.

226790758.name: Must See
226790758.author: a TripAdvisor user
226790758.reviewBody: We were fortunate to be here on the weekend and there was a lot to see and do on the Plaza.  The dance of the "Old Man" was every hour and there were other bands playing, children enjoying themselves and people strolling and enjoying themselves.

226701045.name: Main square with no church around
226701045.author: a TripAdvisor user
226701045.reviewBody: The Plaza Don Vasco, now dedicated to the first Bishop in Michoacan, is different to others in Mexico, due to the fact that has no church around it. This town was populated before the Spanish people came to central Mexico and, they later built homes around the main square. It was renovated a few years ago and is still one of the best squares to sit and enjoy the view.

221359679.name: Artesanias y Arte
221359679.author: a TripAdvisor user
221359679.reviewBody: This place is full of history and culture. You will come to this place and not leave empty handed. Pleasureable shopping experience.

214574057.name: lovely shaded square
214574057.author: a TripAdvisor user
214574057.reviewBody: well used by the locals, so great for people watching, music is piped throughout the park, but is not too loud or unpleasant.  the portals surrounding the square are lovely, and the coffee from the stands is fantastic, much better than surrounding coffee shops, icecream stands are good too and good value

212851437.name: One of the best plazas in Mexico
212851437.author: a TripAdvisor user
212851437.reviewBody: It\'s a wonderful location for a leisurely stroll any time of the day. People watching at its best! Lots of wonderful shops and restaurants all around it, including the amazing ice-cream stands!

201259748.name: The most beautiful Plaza in all of Mexico
201259748.author: a TripAdvisor user
201259748.reviewBody: Plaza Don Vasco de Quiroga might be the most beautiful plaza ever.  IT was renovated in recent years and is even more lovely than before.  It is one of the few if not the only plaza that does NOT have a church.  The Colonial buildings around the Plaza date from the 1400\'s to the 18th century.  It is still enjoyed in the same traditional ways as always.  Families visiting from all over enjoy  strolling during the weekends.  Eating an ice cream from the famous portal Ice Cream stands, eating on one of the lovely outdoor cafes and just generally having a peaceful and lovely visit.  During fiestas one of my favorite things is the fireworks.  Independence Day is one of the best.  WOW.

197726037.name: Plaza Grande is large and the main one in town
197726037.author: a TripAdvisor user
197726037.reviewBody:
Plaza Grande might be called the center of Patzcuaro, at least the part of the city away from the lake. It has a statue of the famous Bishop Quiroga who was instrumental in the early years of the city and who helped the neighboring indigenous people find pride and economic success. 
The plaza is called Grande to differentiate it from a smaller plaza (often called Plaza Chica) that is about two blocks away. It's surrounded by hotels, restaurants, and shops, several of which sell the handicrafts produced in the nearby villages. The local tourist office is on the square. 
The plaza is quite large considering that this is not a large town. It's attractive and brings lots of folks to the center of town. We were lucky when we were there to find a show of young children who played instruments and danced for the parent's delight not to mention the others who were drawn to watch their show. 
If you go to Patzcuaro it is hard to ignore this plaza since it is in the middle of town and has a number of buildings you might want to see by stepping inside. Take a little walk around the perimeter of the square and walk through the plaza itself if you are in town.

196437099.name: fun in patzcuaro
196437099.author: a TripAdvisor user
196437099.reviewBody: Great sidewalk chalk art show. and music. great food and crafts. some really lovely shops as well. just two blocks from Posada Yolihuani

194433236.name: Serene and ample
194433236.author: a TripAdvisor user
194433236.reviewBody: The space is gracious and ample allowing an easy flow of people, pets as they find their way across town. The carefully spaced in ground speakers filled the plaza with a low key but polished musical air fit for any international city.

192111370.name: the colored corn
192111370.author: a TripAdvisor user
192111370.reviewBody:
the colored corn

  in the vasco de quiroga plaza of patzcuaro, michoacan
  it was raining all day and water was flowing in the streets
  i stopped by a restaurant where people were gathering from around  
  where rich and poor alike huddled together from the cold rain

  i passed by an elegant woman eating a colored corn 
  it looked appetizing as she was munching the kernels
  she stopped and smiled and asked if i would like to take a bite
  surprised at the kind offer i didn't know what to say

  but i missed my chance to appreciate the essence of the town
  the woman in her fine dress with a noble look in her eyes
  she was eating with delight a campesino colored corn
  the true taste of the earth in this heaven called mexico

191000233.name: Lovely
191000233.author: a TripAdvisor user
191000233.reviewBody: One of the nicest central squares I have seen in Mexico.  I was there in December and it was tastefully decorated, but not overly decorated for Christmas.

185797233.name: The most beautiful plaza in Mexico?
185797233.author: a TripAdvisor user
185797233.reviewBody: In the heart of P\u00e1tzcuaro, the Plaza Vasco de Quiroga (usually called "La Plaza Grande" by locals and savvy expats) is a green and pleasant rectangle used by residents and visitors alike for strolling and resting, as well as for civic ceremonies and the colorful "Danza de Los Viejitos". It has been called "The most beautiful plaza in Mexico."\n\nNo visit to P\u00e1tzcuaro is complete without a walk around the Plaza Grande!

183893567.name: Super Lively
183893567.author: a TripAdvisor user
183893567.reviewBody: Awesome during the holiday with lots of craft and food vendors.  After the holiday it was still a busy place and great for people watching or sitting with a good book.

182560342.name: Many vendors lot\'s of fun
182560342.author: a TripAdvisor user
182560342.reviewBody: We shopped on Saturday and the plaza was bustling with activity. There were many vendors with local pottery and assorted local crafts. We enjoyed the warmth and friendliness of the vendors and shoppers.

180085154.name: Magic
180085154.author: a TripAdvisor user
180085154.reviewBody: We came twice to Patzcuaro early 2013 and decided to come live here in August.  We have seen many Plazas or Z\u00f3calos in Mexico, many in pueblos magicos, but the Plaza Vasco de Quiroga in Patzcuaro is very special. It is a great place to come, regardless of what age you are, what time of the day you come or what you come here for. You can come to enjoy a delicious ice cream at the Erendira stand on Portal Hidalgo, visit the many stores that offer the artesanias from Michoac\u00e1n or shop the clothing and shoe stores, listen to the local musicians, or sit on a bench eating a churro or a corunda which is the Michoac\u00e1n corn (maiz) specialty. The Plaza was a very magic place on September 15 and also on September 28 for the 479 Aniversario of Patzcuaro. We love it here.

177931975.name: The prettiest plaza in all of Mexico
177931975.author: a TripAdvisor user
177931975.reviewBody: I\'ve been in most of the cities from Zacatecas to San Cristobal de las Casas, and I can tell you that I haven\'t been in a prettier plaza than Plaza Grande in Patzcuaro.  From the tall, statuesque trees to the newly refurbished fountains, pathways and benches, this plaza stands above all others I\'ve seen.  Patzcuaro is fairly unique in that there are two plazas separated by 1 block that are entirely different in their character.  Plaza Grande is much larger and has a much more relaxed and laid back atmosphere than the smaller, more active Plaza Chica at the entrance to what I feel is the most amazing Mercado in all of Mexico.  Again, I\'ve been in most of the mercados in the highlands of Central Mexico, and have yet to see one more charming and active than the one in Patzcuaro, which really doesn\'t make sense given the size of Patzcuaro compared to the other cities.  I\'ve lived here 8 years, and there are still places in this huge market that I\'ve never been to.  There is never a dull moment is this bustling little commercial center of the area.  Sorry to stray from the original subject, but I wanted to give the overall Centro area the credit it deserves.  You will enjoy it immensely if you take the time to explore a little.

169071400.name: If you are on your way to Patzcuaro...
169071400.author: a TripAdvisor user
169071400.reviewBody: ...stop by here. But, dont make a special trip if you are not drving. That is unless you absolutely love carnitas. This town is famous for carnitas and you can make a meal of just tasting samples from each vender. I am not a big carnitas fan, so the last few times I have gotten awesome caldo de res from a lady in square and also corundas. Worth the stop on the way to Patzcuaro. The town is pretty crowded otherwise and there is nothing of interest to buy.

156797836.name: The ultimate shopper\'s paradise
156797836.author: a TripAdvisor user
156797836.reviewBody: A true sensory overload! But in a good way. Great people, great bargains, great folk art. Look for the woman who makes the Adelita corn husk dolls. Beautiful, colorful, inexpensive. Street food is great; we are making enchiladas placeras at our next cooking class!

154553826.name: Lively and Lovely
154553826.author: a TripAdvisor user
154553826.reviewBody: Many stores and no real pressure to buy. Enjoyed locals doing the famous "Old Man" dance. Offered a few pesos and all were happy. Quite spacious.

151829339.name: The main square
151829339.author: a TripAdvisor user
151829339.reviewBody: This is the center of town and most of the action, with many hotels, restaurants and gift shops located around the square..

145411777.name: Not to be missed!
145411777.author: a TripAdvisor user
145411777.reviewBody: Large open square! Great people watching. We saw the Dance of the Viejitos on Sunday afternoon as well as a wonderful display of street theater by a local theater group.

145276769.name: Wow!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1 Do I LOVE this place!!!!
145276769.author: a TripAdvisor user
145276769.reviewBody: There is positively nothing more tranquil than sitting in this little plaza...smoking a cigar....watching life go by... and wondering why I live any place else.   I\'m moving here some day.  That\'s my live long DREAM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

144695230.name: Beautiful
144695230.author: a TripAdvisor user
144695230.reviewBody: Tranquil, beautiful, surrounded by stores selling local crafts, children playing, great ice cream....

144581680.name: Patzcuaro Town Square
144581680.author: a TripAdvisor user
144581680.reviewBody: The town of Patzcuaro is one of the most magical places in all of Mexico.   In the center, zocalo, you find examples of the best of Mexico, food, folklore, people watching, interesting shops, good restaurants etc.   Just being there is special.

141742572.name: Best gathering place
141742572.author: a TripAdvisor user
141742572.reviewBody: On weekends, the Viejitos dance. This is where the dance started, this town. These are men, dressed in traditional garb with old-person masks, dancing, pretending to be very old. A must see, very fun and colorful.

138269911.name: A fantastic day trip from Morelia
138269911.author: a TripAdvisor user
138269911.reviewBody: While this attraction focuses on one particular square in Patzcuaro, there are in fact many things to see and do in the town. There are several attractive squares full of life where every few seconds an old lady will approach you offering to sell you who knows what woven out of straw. More than anything, I think Patzcuaro is a place to people watch and you can truly see people who appear to belong to another age; old ladies in bare feet with no teeth, old men shining shoes as they have probably done for the last forty years, and don\'t miss the masked dance of the viejos (old men) which is offered in the square. I happened to show up at the exact time it was about to start. What a result! Patzcuaro is certainly a place where you can get a sense of the traditional Mexico and is well worth the trip.

136336181.name: this is the real mexico!
136336181.author: a TripAdvisor user
136336181.reviewBody: you could spend a lot of time in this gorgeous plaza: people watching, having a coffee or an icecream, browsing in the many stores, or watching "la danza de los viejitos". Very clean, and very authentic. It is fantastic to stay in one of the hotels sorrounding the plaza, especially in december by the time of "posadas", which are celebrated in a very traditional way in this town.

134858306.name: Great place to people watch, walk and enjoy traditional Mexican lifestyle.
134858306.author: a TripAdvisor user
134858306.reviewBody: This park is very clean, well maintained with small food vendors and entertainment on the weekends.

132248035.name: great , but there are 4 other plazas.
132248035.author: a TripAdvisor user
132248035.reviewBody: go there on the week end, particularly Sunday which is family day !!! Just the most enjoyable , good fun experience you can have AND.. its free.!! You can spend all day here and still not want to leave.

131450317.name: Shops, caf\u00e9s, dancers, grass!
131450317.author: a TripAdvisor user
131450317.reviewBody: It was clean, well taken care of (the grass was green and mowed!), and the shops, caf\u00e9s, and ice cream and cr\u00eape vendors gave the viejitos and indigenous dancers a colorful background.

130878197.name: Heaven on Earth
130878197.author: a TripAdvisor user
130878197.reviewBody: This may be the most beautiful plaza in a nation famous for its beautiful plazas. It has the exactly right elements, the ideal size (you can spot a friend across the plaza), and the flowering plants and ancient trees and thick, green grass are well-cared-for. It is really a plaza where the people go to enjoy life. The benches are mostly soft-drink-spill-free and there is next to no garbage in evidence. What more can be said?

130772210.name: Pretty especially at night with a variety of shops and services
130772210.author: a TripAdvisor user
130772210.reviewBody: We ate two dinners at restaurants on this very pleasant plaza. The park at the centre of the plaza is shaded by large trees and is pretty in the day light but is much prettier at night when the lights come on. Very pleasant place to have dinner at one of the outdoor tables of one of the restaurants that surround the square. The tourist and other government offices are also located in the portales that surround this plaza.

129710399.name: It has everything to walking distance
129710399.author: a TripAdvisor user
129710399.reviewBody: You can try all gastronomy on this place, corn, ice cream, food, coffe, traditional food, everything to 5 minutes walking distance

128200511.name: A beautiful square in the heart of Patzcuaro
128200511.author: a TripAdvisor user
128200511.reviewBody: One of the Largest Squares in Mexico surrounded by incredible restored/maintain buildings.  Very clean and inviting.

126796752.name: Beautiful Plaza in Parzcuaro
126796752.author: a TripAdvisor user
126796752.reviewBody: Start at Plaza Grande for your holiday in Patzcuaro.  Don\'t miss the Dance of the old Men.   Across the street, try the Pasta Ice Cream, but not if you are craving elbow macoronni!  Pasta is flavored with ground almonds, cream and a splash of cinnamon!  Yum!

123526435.name: interesting gathering place for a real town.I like the healthy mix of people going about their business, including artis
123526435.author: a TripAdvisor user
123526435.reviewBody: There\'s nothing to dislike.It is just a normal plaza used by normal people and not just for display for tourists. Very clean , and pretty much preserved

123353169.name: Great place in the AM
123353169.author: a TripAdvisor user
123353169.reviewBody: The neat large plaza with many walker/joggers each morning is great fun to observe.

122678284.name: Nice plaza to Chill out
122678284.author: a TripAdvisor user
122678284.reviewBody: The plaza is a big open space with beautiful tall old trees.  It is sorrounded by shops, hotels and restaurants and you can have a typical "pasta" icecream and just sit and relax.  In the afternoons there are all kinds of local performances like "El baile de los viejitos" and other typical dances

121871006.name: Picturesque Plaza with historical buildings and delicious restaurants!
121871006.author: a TripAdvisor user
121871006.reviewBody: Easy walk from any part of Centro. Many Artisans selling quality wares add character and color to the Plaza. 16th century buildings are unbelievable. Restaurants surrounding Plaza Grande offer exceptionally good food. It\'s fun to sit at a table outside and chit-chat with fellow Gringos while sipping a Margarita.

120879847.name: Full of history
120879847.author: a TripAdvisor user
120879847.reviewBody: During Dia de Los Muertos the plaza comes alive.  With so many people visiting is remarkably clean

117921732.name: The Grand Plaza of Patzcuaro
117921732.author: a TripAdvisor user
117921732.reviewBody: The cultural center of Patzcuaro surrounded by shops, restaurants and hotels.  An extremely well kept plaza that is vibrant both day and night.  A real treat that allows one to grasp the flavor of this city and some of its historical significance.  Great people watching from the numerous sidewalk restaurants.

674487633.name: Amazing Mural by Juan O\'Gorman
674487633.author: a TripAdvisor user
674487633.reviewBody: Murals are complex bits of visual history. My guide, Jaime Hern\u00e1ndez with P\u00e1tzcuaro Magic Tours explained the mural to me and helped me see things I would never have seen otherwise.

641877487.name: Be sure to see the mural.
641877487.author: a TripAdvisor user
641877487.reviewBody: This church, converted to a library, has a huge mural by Juan O\'Gorman that should not be missed!  On the plazita. on\'t miss it.

574604217.name: The mural in the Library is one of the highlights of my trip to Mexico
574604217.author: a TripAdvisor user
574604217.reviewBody: The mural by Juan O\'Gorman is stunning. It may not be in a building as huge and overwhelming as the Sistine Chapel, but it is absolutely majestic, telling the story of Mexico over time. It is a complicated history, and this beautiful painting is a good start to learning more about the events that shaped the present country. You will not be spared the truth, as you might be in a painting or certainly, in a USA history book. To fund such a treasure in such a small and warm space, free of crowds - in March, at least- was a privilege.

574594496.name: Remarkable history in this building
574594496.author: a TripAdvisor user
574594496.reviewBody: I spent an hour or so just browsing all the old books in this library.  It was quite remarkable.  Of course the star is the painting on the back wall, a painting that tells the story of Mexico.  As it was explained to  us, at a critical point in its history the Mexican government wanted to ensure the people understood their history.  Problem was most of the population could not read.  Solution- tell the story in pictures which this mural amply does.  Definitely worth visiting if you are in Patzcuaro

570260441.name: Mural by Juan O\'Gorman
570260441.author: a TripAdvisor user
570260441.reviewBody: The library is in an old church that was taken in the Revolution and turned into a library. The important thing about this place is the awesome mural by muralist Juan O\'Gorman. The history of Mexico. One of Patzcuaro\'s important sights.

569204677.name: A nice space
569204677.author: a TripAdvisor user
569204677.reviewBody: Take 10 minutes, admire the mural and the old books. It\'s free and just a nice quiet space to enjoy.

568757256.name: Beautiful Mural by Juan O\'Gorman
568757256.author: a TripAdvisor user
568757256.reviewBody: This library was originally the Augustinian Church and Cloister. It is located on the Plaza Chica and contains a library of books in Spanish as well as the spectacular mural of life in Michoacan and Mexico. Important mural!

567876524.name: Beuatiful
567876524.author: a TripAdvisor user
567876524.reviewBody: The painted mural in the back is huge and done so beautifully. Pictures cannot capture the beauty.  I bought a book from the library on the history of Patzcuaro and surrounding towns.  Very interesting.

564961332.name: Massive, Important Mural
564961332.author: a TripAdvisor user
564961332.reviewBody: First notice the lovely library and children enjoying books. But your eyes go immediately to the far wall, where the history of Michoacan is depicted from its Purepecha beginning to the post-Spanish conquest that covers the entire wall - at least 50 feet high.

560504210.name: A must see mural is in this old church building.
560504210.author: a TripAdvisor user
560504210.reviewBody: The mural telling the history of the area is awesome Loved it. There are some really interesting books if you look around. My friend found books of old architectural drawings of Mexico city there. fascinating.

574595583.name: A beautiful church with lots of history
574595583.author: a TripAdvisor user
574595583.reviewBody: I found this church to be more approachable than others in Mexico.  Its architecture and \'decoration\' is simpler and less ostentatious.  If you go take the time to read about its history and the role the Jesuits played in the Spanish conquest.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de la Compania de Jesus

568756369.name: The original Cathedral of Michoacan
568756369.author: a TripAdvisor user
568756369.reviewBody: This church was built by Vasco de Quiroga in the 16th century and is a single barrel wooden church. It currently contains examples of biblical figures in native dress and is well worth a visit. Don\'t miss the exhibits at the Jesuit College attached.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de la Compania de Jesus

538268306.name: Lovely at night
538268306.author: a TripAdvisor user
538268306.reviewBody: We visited this church a couple of times during the day but at night is when the magic happens when all the lighting on the building give it a refined and and lovely feeling. Great for pictures and to strolll through with the family.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de la Compania de Jesus

468840748.name: Large church and campus built 500 years ago
468840748.author: a TripAdvisor user
468840748.reviewBody: This is a large and austere complex of church and other building which occupies a few blocks. It is reasonably well preserved and very quiet.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de la Compania de Jesus

413140311.name: One of Many Churches
413140311.author: a TripAdvisor user
413140311.reviewBody: Add this to the list of the many places to visit while strolling through the charming streets of Patzcuaro.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de la Compania de Jesus

341196038.name: Beautiful Temple
341196038.author: a TripAdvisor user
341196038.reviewBody: This temple, church, is worth a visit.  I enjoyed the colors and the detail of the altar and columns.  Calming, peaceful.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de la Compania de Jesus

326283677.name: Nice temple ... an interesting place to get a glimpse of the history of Patzcuaro!!
326283677.author: a TripAdvisor user
326283677.reviewBody: Nice temple ... an interesting place to get a glimpse of the history of Patzcuaro!!\n\nNice for a stroll around and maybe some quick photo opps!

itemReviewed.name: Templo de la Compania de Jesus

301673601.name: A trip back in time
301673601.author: a TripAdvisor user
301673601.reviewBody: Imagine yourself walking along walls and floors where people already used to pray, celebrate mess, weddings, baptisms in the 16th or 17th century. Do I need to say more?\nThis old are the origins of this building which used to be the first cathedral in Patzcuaro.\nEnjoy

itemReviewed.name: Templo de la Compania de Jesus

568755835.name: An amazing introduction to Purepechan Life
568755835.author: a TripAdvisor user
568755835.reviewBody: This museum offers a glimpse at the entire culture of the Purepecha including crafts, cooking and holograms showing copper working and guitar making. It is a must see for the visitor to Patzcuaro.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Interpretacion Ruta Don Vasco

449275572.name: Best introduction to the  Purepecha culture \u00a1
449275572.author: a TripAdvisor user
449275572.reviewBody: Even if this is not your first visit to P\u00e1tzcuaro and  towns nearby. Visit this digital museum ,will give you an interesting guide with top quality  HD videos and photographs. They have a 360 projection hall, they display videos on  main festivities and places you should not miss. \nI  know this area and culture very well, and I must admit I  am impressed. Don\u00b4t miss it\u00a1

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Interpretacion Ruta Don Vasco

438782871.name: Highly recommended!
438782871.author: a TripAdvisor user
438782871.reviewBody: This cultural center is an impressive place, I\'ve so much more appreciation about the P\'urh\u00e9pecha Culture. I have a better perspective of their history and the legacy of Don Vasco, who was a social reformer, and humanist educator. With him at their side, the Indians of this region were able to gather their strength, and expand their talents. Bravo to the Founders & Managers of this Museum for creating a quality place where one can learn history with joy! All their interactive exhibits are tops! You can even e-mail to yourself any article/exhibit. I e-mailed the food recipes!

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Interpretacion Ruta Don Vasco

402641430.name: Interesting historical perspective beautifully presented
402641430.author: a TripAdvisor user
402641430.reviewBody: The focus of this museum is the dedication of Don Vasco de Quiroga to the Purepecha people. It tells the story of their culture with respect, and illustrates their foods, crafts, and work with innovative interactive exhibits.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Interpretacion Ruta Don Vasco

369709520.name: An Excellent Summary: history, culture, language, art...A Must to visit!
369709520.author: a TripAdvisor user
369709520.reviewBody: I was absolutely impressed by que high quality of this museum. It gives a historic summary of the Ruta Don Vasco. You experience art, language, food, traditions and when you leave you know exactly what Michoacan is all about and were to visit.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Interpretacion Ruta Don Vasco

675030585.name: Interesting for one visit
675030585.author: a TripAdvisor user
675030585.reviewBody: Tourist trap for the most part. The boat ride to the island is interesting. There\'s a statue at the high point of the island, and you can climb up inside like the Statue of Liberty. Get a nice view. The climb to the statue, however, is not for the lazy.

662460940.name: Such a nice boat ride and lovely island!
662460940.author: a TripAdvisor user
662460940.reviewBody: I live in Patzcuaro and I still enjoy a day trip to the island every now and then. The round trip in the boats will cost you 70 pesos per person and you pay at the ticket boot. Will you arrive there, you get to see other islands in the lake and some local fishermen with the traditional butterfly nets. When you arrive to the islands, there\u2019s lots of local food, art crafts and lovely views of the lake. Unfortunately, the lake is not as clean as it used to be, but the cultural experience is nice. If you go during day of the death, it is PACKED, so unless you don\u2019t mind the crowds I recommend to avoid it (unless you really really want to see it and have no other time).

660372831.name: A delighful island.
660372831.author: a TripAdvisor user
660372831.reviewBody: We took a boat over to Isla Janitzio and had a wonderful day. What a beautiful and unique place this is. The island is home to "Butterfly" fishermen who have nets that look like butterfly wings. On the island itself are hundreds of shops and restaurants with every conceivable type of merchandise and food you could imagine. There are no cars and all the town is built going uphill to a massive statue and museum of Morelos. The view is spectacular from the top! This location hosts a huge DAY OF THE DEAD festival on November 1rst.

654114709.name: Interesting island
654114709.author: a TripAdvisor user
654114709.reviewBody: After reading other reviews I was concerned that it would be dirty, crowded and we would be bothered by hawkers. Absolutely not. We paid 70 pesos each and waited for 30 minutes before the boat left the harbour. The 40 minute ride was great across the muddy lake. Lots of Pelicans and other birds to watch along with the island getting closer. A group of musicians serenaded us on the way. At the island it was obvious the huge statue of Morelos was on the top. It is a steep climb with many stairs but there is a lot to see and many shops and restaurants to look at while you rest. It took us 30 minutes to climb only because we were with an older couple who had to stop and rest a lot, probably would take 15 minutes. At the top there is a 10 peso fee each to enter the monument site but it is well worth it as the statue is 40 meters high and inside is a marvellous museum. There are flights of stairs which wind inside the statue to the top viewing area. Along the walls are murals depicting the history of Mexico and the life of Mexican hero Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon. Not a happy story as with most Mexican history lessons, the Spanish were brutal to the indigenous people. The view at the top is a marvellous 360 degrees. After leaving the monument there are the stairs back down through the town, with many tempting stores and restaurants who display the food items attractively. The streets were clean, washed and with no smell. We stopped off on the left path to see the cemetery. I was thrilled to find a thread store at the bottom by the dock and bano\'s so I was able to buy embroidery thread for a piece I am working on. A lot of shops specialize in brightly embroidered or cross stitched blouses and dresses, very good designs and quality. The boat was waiting at the dock so we hopped on, left immediately and again were serenaded home with music. The wind had started so several waves splashed in the open side of the boat, so people put on their jackets or moved away to the middle seats. A lovely 3 hour trip, and we could easily have spent more time there shopping and eating.

644857746.name: The boat trip to the lake is fun, but the island is very commercial.
644857746.author: a TripAdvisor user
644857746.reviewBody: Taking a boat trip to Lake Patzcuaro is fun.  However, once you get to the island it is full of shops selling junky tourist merchandise.  The view from the top of the island is probably the best feature.

641818888.name: Be careful what you eat.
641818888.author: a TripAdvisor user
641818888.reviewBody: Everything started perfect the boat ride to the island is relaxing. Once you get to the island you are greeted by the kids who just want money. Then you have to walk alot just to get to the statute. Once up there there restaurants and food vendors everywhere. 3 of my family members decided to get some grilled corn I must say I did enjoy it. Then my wife asked where I bought and I showed her where from.  She immediately said her hands ar dirty and she handles both money and food with out washing her hands.  I threw my corn out after I had ate half of it.  Once we got back to where we were staying the 3 that ate started feeling sick. All night we had vomit and diarrhea and it only got worse as the night went on.  Then the stomach cramps started and this lasted all the following day. So if you decide to visit look how they handle their food and how often do they wash there hands. Just trying to help your stay in Mexico more pleasant and not a whole day in bed missing out on the rest this country has to offer. Hope this was helpful and dint just apply this to this island anywhere you go.  Make sure they are clean and have good hygiene.

620858269.name: Very disappointing
620858269.author: a TripAdvisor user
620858269.reviewBody: We probably didn\'t see the island and the views at their best, muddy waters due to rainy season in lake and slightly overcast but the island itself was dirty. Rubbish everywhere, an over proliferation of tourist shops all selling the same stuff and no information on the history or the people. It\'s not expensive but it\'s really not worth the time. I was really surprised that such a well known tourist place was so badly looked after. Mexico has so many other amazing things to offer so I don\'t reccomed this.

593889470.name: Long boat ride to an unpleasant island
593889470.author: a TripAdvisor user
593889470.reviewBody: Let me say first, I don\'t like to give bad reviews. But this long (40 minute) boat ride to the isla was not spectacular in any way. Once there, the vendors had very little diversity of products and we only stayed a few minutes to take pictures. Unless you really want to see the statue, spend your time elsewhere.

593885610.name: sad
593885610.author: a TripAdvisor user
593885610.reviewBody: So glad the boat trip was cheap  because the Isla itself is very disappointing. It looks rundown, dirty and drab. There are many vendors selling food, but flies were swarming all over. We spent about ten minutes walking around and headed back to the dock to take the next boat back to Patzcuaro. Maybe we hit it during the wrong season?

592817225.name: Impossible to miss
592817225.author: a TripAdvisor user
592817225.reviewBody: No trip to P\u00e1tzcuaro is complete without Janitzio. But recently the island has been taken over by people selling cheap crafts. Walk up to the Morelos monument and wnyoj the views.

575669874.name: The boat ride is good, the walk up not sure!
575669874.author: a TripAdvisor user
575669874.reviewBody: Back in time, the idea to do the boat ride to the island as main attraction used to be a good idea, to present day not any more. Especially when you love the landscape thinking of a lake surrounded by volcanoes plus the bird watching as you navigate to Janitzio. A few minutes before you arrive to the island, you are able to picture the local fishermen with the butterfly nets that local people organize as a tourist attraction. This last was fun but, once you reach the island, the walk up to the statue of Morelos, a Mexican hero, is demanding physical effort if you are not in good shape, not to mention the smelly dirt steep walk that it was. Local restaurants will offer you to sit and try the cooking but the number of flies you can see on the tables mean a good warning to skip the lunch time. So enjoy the round trip, watch the birds, see the landscape and call it a day since you can come back to Patzcuaro and enjoy lunch in a nice & clean restaurant.

574073594.name: Nice view of the lake!
574073594.author: a TripAdvisor user
574073594.reviewBody: We were visiting Patzcuaro and decided to visit Janitzio. It was a cool place with tons of steps and shops around / The view from the top was great. That being said if you\'re in the area this is a nice place to hang out in the afternoon!

571648278.name: Do you like to walk?
571648278.author: a TripAdvisor user
571648278.reviewBody: I love walking and what better place than the Isle of Janitzio, the place of not cars.  Yes, no buses, cabs or vehicles.  Take the boat from several locations around Lake Patzcuaro, I prefer the muelle (boat dock in Patzcuaro)  and walk up hill to the best views of the Lake.  If you feel adventuresome, talk a walk up the spiral staircase to the top of the statue for peep holes for viewing.  Along the way on the interior walls is the life of Morelos is depicted in murals painted by Ram\u00f3n Alba de la Canal and other great Mexican muralists.   The boats operate daily and are a treat.

560517641.name: Nice boat ride, Unappealing Destination.
560517641.author: a TripAdvisor user
560517641.reviewBody: Decided to do this trip out to the island while visiting Patzcuaro.  We took a taxi from Centro out to the launch area around 11 am, and took one of the many boats out to The Island of Janitzio.  The lake itself is shallow and dirty, but there were some interesting birds along the way, and though the air was quite hazy, the views of the distant mountains were pretty.  It was a beautiful sunny day, so being on the water was nice and everyone on the boat seemed to be enjoying themselves.  The island itself was pretty disappointing - overcrowded, downright unattractive and overrun with trash.  There are shops, but they are filled with mostly cheap trinkets.  My partner hiked up the hill and went up into the statue, which he said was fine, but there was trash strewn all along the way, which is hard to overlook.  Obviously many people enjoy the trip and the experience, but we would not do it again.

555684275.name: Not to be missed!
555684275.author: a TripAdvisor user
555684275.reviewBody: Take a water taxi on a misty morning across the water hyacinth filled lake and this island appears like a ghost.  The entire island is a series of stairs lined with wonderful little shops, restaurants and stalls.  It is stepping back in time since nothing much has changed here in hundreds of years.  Vibrants colors, the statue at the apex of the island, the views...and the butterfly fisherman on the lake are just surreal.  You could easily spend the day here exploring.  I have been all over the planet and this is one of the most memorable places I have experienced.  GO

554264212.name: Touristy but nice
554264212.author: a TripAdvisor user
554264212.reviewBody: This is the largest and most visited of the islands.  There are many shops and restaurants.  The boat ride is fun, as there usually are entertainers on board and you get close to the fishermen.

546687638.name: Very interesting and unique.
546687638.author: a TripAdvisor user
546687638.reviewBody: In Patzcuaro, a short taxi ride from the main square, is a  small port that accommodates long boats.  This mode of transportation, transports a load of people to the island of Janitizio.  Tickets are very reasonable and there are small three piece band that travel with you to the island, where prior to your arrival\u201d you are greeted by fisherman in small boats, that demonstrate their butterfly fishing nets.  Once on the island you can shop till you drop and have a variety of,restaurants to choose from for lunch or dinner.  If you are able, you can walk to the top wher you can see the entire unobstructed view of the surrounding area as well as the religious statue that dominates the top and can be seen for miles around.  Much like Rio de Janeiro.

545227529.name: Nice boat visit
545227529.author: a TripAdvisor user
545227529.reviewBody: Pleasant boat trip. Nice shopping.  Look for the winding road to get to the top without the hundreds of steps.

538267181.name: Day of the dead visit
538267181.author: a TripAdvisor user
538267181.reviewBody: We visited the island for the dead of the dead celebrations at night and it was an amazing experience. All of the shops were open and the inhabitants were very welcoming and gave you a lot of information about the island and were to avoid the touristy crowds. The colors, the smell and the food are unique to this place. We really enjoyed it.

536401683.name: Is a must, no matter what people say
536401683.author: a TripAdvisor user
536401683.reviewBody: This is someting that you need to visit if you are in the area. More than the place, the experience of going in a boat to get and island an take the stairs to get the best higer viewpoint.\nI DO NOT RECOMMEND this to people who are looking for incredible adventures, dont like physcal activity or get bother for excesive merchandise/people asking for money.

535794647.name: Quiet time just before Day of the Dead
535794647.author: a TripAdvisor user
535794647.reviewBody: We went in the morning and it was pretty quiet and we were able to enjoy a slow amble up the hill.  We were rewarded with spectacular views and a nice cold beer.  I can only imagine this place during a fiesta time !

535168972.name: Vacation
535168972.author: a TripAdvisor user
535168972.reviewBody: What an amazing place!  Full of shops with souvenirs and food.  We enjoyed the climb up to the top of the island!!  A little treacherous but the hike up was well worth it!

534594945.name: A boat ride away
534594945.author: a TripAdvisor user
534594945.reviewBody: Do it!  Take the boat to the island and wander the small streets - you can\'t get lost - and the beauty everywhere from the lake vistas to the small shops offering hand made artifacts made on the island as well as beautiful local embroideries.

492158871.name: Great afternoon
492158871.author: a TripAdvisor user
492158871.reviewBody: Went by boat, easy ride, Butterfly net fisherman come out for a handout, expected a demonstration of how the nets work, but they just took money and left, did not like that.  The island is very steep, be in good shape to get to the top, people were not the friendly smiling Mexicans we had expected.

491571677.name: Not worth the trip anymore
491571677.author: a TripAdvisor user
491571677.reviewBody: I\'ve visited several times and each year it has become more polluted over the years. Both the island and the dock are filled with vendors who will harass you as well.

485989220.name: A must-see that was my least favorite stop in Morelia
485989220.author: a TripAdvisor user
485989220.reviewBody:
As many have said and explained so eloquently already, this is the reason that many people come to Patzcuaro.  The boat ride out and back is fine.  The water of the lake is very muddy due to human activity around the shores of Lake Patzcuaro.  Nearby Lake Zirahuen is much cleaner and prettier.  However, visiting the area and not going to Janitzio is a bit like going to NYC and not visiting the Statue of Liberty...
Many of the vendors display artwork depicting the island as some sort of paradise, and it may well have been at some point.  Today, rather sadly, it is mainly a collection of small vendors selling pretty much the same tourist nonsense on either side of quite steep pathways and stairs leading to the top of the hill where the monument to Jose Maria Morelos is located.  The monument is impressive in it's dimensions and is worth the additional steps (and 10 peso fee) that take you up inside to a very small viewing platform inside the hand of the statue.
We went quite late in the afternoon and this may have been an error because the typical food on offer is fried fish (whitebait and other white fish) and this must represent an irresistible attraction to flies from miles around... we found the entire place to be teaming with the annoying creatures and were very happy to get back onto the boat to feel the nice breeze on our faces.  The boat cost 60 pesos per person round trip from the main embarcadero in Patzcuaro.
So depending on how much time you allocate to Patzcuaro (which is lovely) you might want to think about whether this is worth a half day or not... of course time of year may also make a big difference.

484753007.name: Not worth the time
484753007.author: a TripAdvisor user
484753007.reviewBody: Dirty lake and even dirtier island.  NOT worth the time unless there are some huge changes.  Trashy  and just dirty...

482709613.name: Janitzio, An Island unto Itself.
482709613.author: a TripAdvisor user
482709613.reviewBody: From the city of Patzcuatro I took a boat ride to the island of Janitzio. I\'ve been to Patzcuaro a couple of time but never to the island.  The lake is  placid and the trip takes about 45 minutes, vendors sell candy, ice cream and other items on the boat.  Once you arrive at the dock there are tons of vendors selling everything.  The island is small and there is main stairway to climb to the statue of Jose Maria Morelos at the very top of the island.  Again, all kinds of vendors and restaurants line the climb to the top. At the top you may pay 100 pesos to enter the top of the island and the statue and climb yet another stairway inside the statue itself to the top of the statue.  Beautiful scenery of the entire lake and shore.  Fun thing to do, enjoy the island, have a drink in one of the souvenir mugs (70 pesos for both) and enjoy the view.

480758038.name: Surround and Conquer
480758038.author: a TripAdvisor user
480758038.reviewBody:
Janitzio is an impressive island rising out of the placid waters of Lake Pátzcuaro. For a delightful half-day adventure, I boated to Janitzio Island, encircled its developed shoreline, and conquered the steep stairway to its monumental summit.

From the main dock (embarcadero) outside the town of Pátzcuaro, long colorful launches make the 20 minute crossing to Janitzio Island every half-hour, between 7:30 am and 6:00 pm. The cost of a round-trip ticket is M$60 (US$3.25) per person.

The slow and pleasant voyage to the island cruised by extensive wetlands, abundant bird life, and solo fishermen in flat bottom canoes. At the island pier, multiple restaurants and souvenir shops awaited our arrival.

Rather than being ensnared by these tourist traps, I set off on a paved lakeshore footpath that encircles the island. This level 30 minute walk passed residential dwellings, small fishing piers, and even the island’s small soccer stadium.

After circumnavigating the island’s shoreline, I was ready to scale its lofty hilltop. Climbing hundreds of steps, I went by Janitzio’s church and cemetery, and several more tourist shops, before reaching the top of the island. There, crowning the summit is a colossal statue of the local revolutionary rebel leader José María Morelos.

For M$10 (US$0.55), I entered the 40-meter (130-foot) tall monument. Inside, a spiral staircase coils past a series of vivid murals depicting Morelos’ life, and leads to a small crow’s nest lookout within the statue’s heroically raised fist. From this noble vantage point, the entire island is visible, rising out of the placid waters of Lake Pátzcuaro.

480015845.name: Another World
480015845.author: a TripAdvisor user
480015845.reviewBody: Delightful visit to this small, hilly island in the middle of Lake Patzcuoro. The boat ride was refreshing and the views amazing.

470198556.name: An island full of history and delicious food!
470198556.author: a TripAdvisor user
470198556.reviewBody: Just getting to an island it\'s an experience on its own...riding in a small boat while listening to norte\u00f1o music and eating all sorts of candy and goodies. Once in the island is a hike to the top of the statue but the view is completely worth it!

465167765.name: Worth a visit.
465167765.author: a TripAdvisor user
465167765.reviewBody: We took an early morning boat there, which was not a good idea because it is really best to go there for lunch as they have many great fish restaurants at the top. There is no cafe there that serves espresso but lots of colorful drinks with alcohol. Plenty of shopping and the hike to the top is worth it as there are restaurants and vendors up there as well. The water is not very pretty and the skies were hazy when we went, which was too bad, but if it is a sunny day, it is worth the trip. The boats take you by fisherman who let you take pictures then come to the boat to get tips, which was a little annoying, but hey, it\'s Mexico and they have to make a living off tourism.

462585984.name: Fun trip, had the place to myself,  touristy but after all you are on vacation
462585984.author: a TripAdvisor user
462585984.reviewBody:
I went on a Tuesday 2/14/17. Perfect weather, went about 11am or 12, hardly anyone there.   Checked out all three places where boats leave – two were ghost towns and went for the main one with the pay parking gate and shops.  Boat left 10 minutes after I paid at the dock, bought some ice cream when the vendors come on board.  Windy on the ride over there and some water splashing if you sat on the left side of the boat.
When you get to the island I started walking up.  About half way up I looked for the cleanest restaurant with a view and a bathroom. There are three or four restauants that you will love. I was the only person in the place.
