Great for photos walking up the steep stairs with all the trinkets around. Nothing but junk stores, could not even find a tshirt I wanted. Made me feel like I was really on vacation.  I really liked it with no one there.  
On the other side of the island is a real man zip line that takes you all the way across the water to another smaller island. They send a boat to bring you back. Walked around and saw two people go, they were ready to deal on price, but I could not make a deal with my fear of heights so I passed.
Coming back on the half filled panga, seagulls were following the boat so some parents pulled out bread and threw pieces to the seagulls which entranced the kids. Then the musicians started playing for tips. Fun ride back.  
The fun was getting it with almost no one there and your pick of restaurants. Go during the week.  Don't need to pay to walk around the top or climb to the top of the statute, can get the same view from a restaurant. I think this is a must.  Nice boat ride, steep but manageable walk up the stairs.

459443170.name: A Jewel in Michoacan
459443170.author: a TripAdvisor user
459443170.reviewBody: Located near the picturesque town of Patzcuaro, Isla Janitzio is a nice daytrip.  A short boat ride takes you there.  Walk up the winding streets to the giant statue of Jose Maria Morelos.  There are lots of souvenir shops and a few restaurants.  The best time (and the most crowded) is for the Day of the Dead celebrations.

456049879.name: Touristy, but interesting
456049879.author: a TripAdvisor user
456049879.reviewBody: Probably the best part of the experience was the boat ride over and back ($3 US).  I arrived mid-morning, and many of the shops and restaurants were just opening.  The hike through the streets to the top of the island and statue is doable, but don\'t try if you have physical issues.  Lovely views, interesting cemetery, nice people, not sure about the restaurants (many street type cafes - I ate in one - don\'t remember the name - near the boat landing and it was fine - how about restaurant some reviews, TA?)  If you\'re looking for cheap souvenirs, this is the place, but I\'d stick to mainland villages and Patzcuaro for quality goods.  A good outing for a few hours.

451956800.name: Very touristy
451956800.author: a TripAdvisor user
451956800.reviewBody: Sometimes it\'s just fun to enjoy the local tourist trap. Isla Janitzio is one of those fun places. We went on a Friday figuring it would be less busy, which it certainly was, but maybe the experience would have been more entertaining with hordes of tourists. There is a bit of history inside the statue of Morelos with a bunch of murals on the walls depicting his life.

451497811.name: A short ferry ride from Patzcuaro
451497811.author: a TripAdvisor user
451497811.reviewBody: We decided to visit the island on a Sunday - which is when the most tourists come over from the mainland. If you decide to go on a Sunday go early because by early afternoon the island is hopping with tourists. They sell everything you could possibly want in terms of souvenirs but the prices are higher than in Patzcuaro.

449647787.name: Worthwhile side trip from Patzcuaro
449647787.author: a TripAdvisor user
449647787.reviewBody: A leisurely, scenic boat ride takes you to a beautiful little island/village. All paths lead to the top, where you\'ll find a historic monument to explore as well as amazing views. There are plenty of shops and restaurants throughout the island, though I think the food in Patzcuaro is better. It\'s kind of touristy but also scenic and authentic. It\'s easy and inexpensive to get a boat over from the embarcadero and back, and the island can be explored in an hour or two.

448721717.name: Janitzio
448721717.author: a TripAdvisor user
448721717.reviewBody: I was really surprised,  it was very clean, I really enjoyed the visit . Tried the blue corn tortillas they were delish.

447773889.name: A craftsmanship town in an island
447773889.author: a TripAdvisor user
447773889.reviewBody:
This is a great trip for half a day. Go to "muelle San pedrito" instead of the main docks. It's 5 minutes away but a lot less crowded. 
This is a trip to sightsee and buy handcrafts. 
Take a boat, they will show you the "traditional fishermen pretending to fish."It's a tourist attraction now.
Go up to the top of the island walking along the shops and narrow alley. Take the "fast and steep" way up and come back the back "easy" route.
At the top you'll pay to get to the park, walk around and take in the beautiful views. You can go into the big statue and see the murals inside.
Buy a bite to eat and walk back to the docks to catch a boat back.

447323088.name: Overrated
447323088.author: a TripAdvisor user
447323088.reviewBody: This site used to be nice, know it\'s very crowded and full of cheap stores. you can skip it. If you want to see the island you can take the water taxi take your pictures and go back to the pier. It really does not worth the effort of climbing all those steps. Sorry

439640172.name: Scenery is great.
439640172.author: a TripAdvisor user
439640172.reviewBody: Destination Janitzio is in need of a  facelift to take advantage of this great location, the  boats that take you there could also use some renovation. \nJanitzio offers many shops , restaurants that share the same basic menu, it is inexpensive, the boat ride is about $3.00 USD per person the restaurant most are in the low end.\nIt does not offer any significant historical value, just great views.

437898590.name: Janitzio - a workout for the senses & calf muscles
437898590.author: a TripAdvisor user
437898590.reviewBody: The launch to the island costs approximately $3.25 (depending on exchange rate) -  takes about 30 minutes & as you approach the island, the Butterfly Net fisherman will paddle out & put on a display for you. Tip is expected!!  The island has few flat surfaces - you are almost always climbing or descending stairs - wear comfy shoes.  Climb to the top of the statue of Morelos, crowded inside be careful.  Or, sit & enjoy a meal at one of the restaurants near the boat docks.

435325519.name: Just Beautiful!    Where it Rains.
435325519.author: a TripAdvisor user
435325519.reviewBody:
The town is located atop a hill and have a great view.

Janitzio can only be reached by boats which run regularly back
and forth from about 7:30 am to 6 pm, accessible from Pátzcuaro's pier.
 You have local boats that you can hire to take visitors and tourist to
different parts of the lake. Also this town is know for its butterfly
fishermen who are skilled with their nets.

434616210.name: Celebrating the Day of the Dead
434616210.author: a TripAdvisor user
434616210.reviewBody: Janitzio is an island off of Patzcuaro in the estate of Michoac\u00e1n.  It\'s a quaint and very "Mexican" place filled with local merchants whose main income is fishing and tourism.  Very friendly and welcoming natives live there.  May seem dirty (littered) but one must keep in mind that it is a very popular national and international destination - still an island.  There\'s lots of shopping, traditional restaurants, wi-fi spots, and the must climb "Morelos monument ".

434409090.name: Beautiful!!!
434409090.author: a TripAdvisor user
434409090.reviewBody: Beautiful place with good food, a lot of commerce with cheap and beautiful artesanias, and an astonishing view of the surroundings. Cemetery visit is a must, especially at the Night of The Dead. A "tirolesa" ride takes amazing 90 seconds to take you to another island, from where you go back to Janitzio in a boat, safe and quick. Totally recommend.

425694155.name: Day of the dead
425694155.author: a TripAdvisor user
425694155.reviewBody: Has anyone traveled to this island on the Day of the dead celebration? Any advice? tips? I would really like to hear anyone\'s input. Also, safety of the area during that time.

422982026.name: Fun day trip from Patzcuaro
422982026.author: a TripAdvisor user
422982026.reviewBody: We went by collectivo from Patzcuaro to the muelle (dock) and took a public boat to the island.  We went on a Saturday and the boat was full of locals and Mexican tourists, with a band of 4 musicians, creating a fun atmosphere.  On the trip over we passed the local fishermen with their butterfly Nets, who approach the boat for coins.  The narrow streets are lined with restaurants selling traditional food and stalls selling souvenirs.  The local church is pretty and we were lucky to see a wedding taking place.  At the top you can buy a ticket to climb inside the big statue, the walls decorated with amazing murals.  It gets very narrow at the top, but the views of the Lake and town below are stunning.  Buy a michelada, sit in the bandstand and take in the holiday vibe, maybe watching a group of local children, dressed in masks and costumes, performing a traditional dance.  All very touristy, but great fun.  Take lots of small change!

420974583.name: La Isla mas bonita, the prettiest island.
420974583.author: a TripAdvisor user
420974583.reviewBody: So my family is from near this area and when I went to visit them, I visited this place and it is so pretty and the monument it so large. However the stairs going the whole way up are very tiring. It is worth every step. Such beauty and excellence is rarely found in nature. When I went here I found out how pretty looking over Janitzio is. It feels so exhilarating to be at the very top of the monument with the wind blowing and I feel as though there is not a care in the world. Yeah, this place is one of my favorite places in the world.

417122048.name: Loved It
417122048.author: a TripAdvisor user
417122048.reviewBody: When I went unfortunately it was a rainy day but I still loved it.You have to take a little boat to get their.It is inspiring to see al the indigenous people their is so many and all of them make crafts if you love that king of art this is a place for you.Also dont forget to see the statue of Morelos ( a great hero from the independence of Mexico)and get a great view from the top of his head and see al Janitzio.

413138132.name: Magic Island
413138132.author: a TripAdvisor user
413138132.reviewBody: With easy access from Patzcuaro, this island is an enchanting day trip.  Lots of shops and eateries, interesting church usually bedecked with lots of flowers, and huge statue of Morelos.

403631527.name: Interesting to see once
403631527.author: a TripAdvisor user
403631527.reviewBody:
Isla Janitzio is an Island in the middle of Lake Patzcuaro.  On it is a giant statue that many mistake for a replica of the Christ Statue in Rio, similar to the one in Taxco.  But it I actually a statue of Jose Maria Morelos, a hero of the Mexican Revolution.  It is 40 meters tall and you can actually go to the top of the interior of the statue, viewing paintings of the life and history of Moreles by  Ramón Alba de la Canal and other great Mexican muralists.  Getting to the statue is not for the weak or faint at heart as it requires climbing lots and lots (and lots more) of stairs.  Once there the stairs to the top are steep and crowded.  But once inside the raised fist of Moreles you can look through peep-holes and the view is spectacular.  Or if you are lazy you can buy postcards with the picture at the dock.

The only way to the island is by boat.  The boats run back and forth all day with the last boat leaving the Island at 6.  You don’t want to miss the boat, because I do not believe there is a hotel on the Island.  There are lots of shops and places to eat.  At one time the economy was based on fishing, but as the piscado blanco have shrunk in numbers tourist are the major industry.

The island is interesting, as is the boat trip which usually includes a demonstration of the famous “butterfly net” fishermen in the lake.  Because the only way back and forth is by boat it is interesting at times when residents of the island get on the boat with lumber, groceries or other supplies.  

The trip is interesting and everyone who is visiting should go see the island if they have time.  However, other than the fact it is an island and the indigenous people live there, there is little to see or do.  So it is not the kind of place you would go every time you came to Patzcuaro.

399647445.name: Beautiful scenery and a secret
399647445.author: a TripAdvisor user
399647445.reviewBody:
The island itself is a mixture of scenery and just a place to shop and eat, all restaurants are more less the same and the little stores are the same!!

The way up the island to see the Museum and the sights is going up like 30 mins of stairs!! or of you ask around and get lucky, (this is the secret) because it's not easy to find, there is a way around the island to simply walk on a scenic route not told to tourists, but great for older people and for those that are not good with stairs.

And on the dock, you can ask about the zip line to the little island on the side, for those that are very adventurous, 1200 meters and high speed.

Once up the view is worth the hike!!
Great pictures!!

395858663.name: A must see in Michoac\u00e1n
395858663.author: a TripAdvisor user
395858663.reviewBody:
It was my first time in Michoacán and this place was beautiful.  There's a lot of cultural things to see.  You have to get there in a boat. It cost like 50 pesos per person, but it's to and from. In the boat they're going to sell food like fruit and churros.  When you arrive there's going to be kids trying to help you off the boat,  then they will ask for money. When you arrive your goal is to go up to the statue on the top of the island.  It's quite a walk if you're out of shape,  but doable. There will be signs.  When you get up there,  in the small plaza there will be these guys and children dancing the typical "viejitos" dance from Michoacán.  You can go inside the monument,  there will be murals of morelos all around. Once you're up the monument you can see the island. There's men taking souvenier  pictures. The pictures agent good quality.  It's better taking a selfie stick. They charge 100 pesos per picture.  
There are cute souvenirs like masks, paintings, magnets, clothing. 
 You must try the charales which are fried small fish that are only from the island.

 I've heard this is the place to go to for day of the dead.

387059516.name: OK it is historic and the boat ride colorful
387059516.author: a TripAdvisor user
387059516.reviewBody: I had never been and on this visit felt I should go. Once is enough and please do not go over there hungry. It is almost impossible to mess up a quesadilla but somehow the place we ate managed to do so. It[s very touristy and pretty grungy and as the title says, the boat ride over and back were the highlights.

385638040.name: What a Beautiful Island and People
385638040.author: a TripAdvisor user
385638040.reviewBody: I have to admit that I was a little hesitant as we boarded the ETN Bus in Mexico City headed north to Morelia. I was extremely excited about the bus trip and I wanted to see a part of Mexico that I had not seen before and the best part about it was that I did not have to drive. I had read the travel advisories for Morelia and Michoac\u00e1n BUT I thought what the heck, you only live once so away we went. We arrived to Morelia and the bus station was much smaller and a lot less secure looking than Mexico City BUT NOT ONE time did we encounter any hostility or even a negative stare. Everyone was nice and friendly. We took a taxi from the bus station to the town of Patzcuaro where we could board the boat out to the island. You can also take a bus from Morela to Patzcuaro. I believe that on of the operators called Purepecha runs every 20 to 30 minutes. This is not a luxury bus by any means BUT it is a good way to interact with the locals. How do I know this you might ask? Because we decided to be brave and take the bus from Patzcuaro back to Morelia and it was a very interesting experience. Once you arrive to Patzcuaro you take a short walk to the embarcadero (pier) and pay your few pesos to board a boat. Once the boat leaves the pier the real experience starts. It is a nice boat ride out across Lake Patzcuaro to the island. Parents with children can buy little fishing nets before leaving the pier and their children can let their nets skim the water during the boat ride. Just before arriving to the island the local "Butterfly Fishermen" will come out to meet the boat and put on a show with their butterfly nets. It is quite the show. Once finished a couple of them will come along side your boat for tips. Please don\'t be stingy, give them a few pesos or even more as they do provide a great experience. Also so lucky child with a fishing net on board the boat will find a live fish dropped into his or her net as well. As your boat arrives to the island the local children will come out and meet the boat. These kids will ask for Pesos. I can tell you that I arrived to the island with a pocket full of change and left with none but that is OK as I love kids and it made me feel good. Once on the island you can go exploring. They people are nice and friendly. There are plenty of shops for local merchandise and restaurants are in no short supply. If you have the energy climb to the top just below the statue of Jose Maria Morelos and have lunch / dinner at the Restaurante Monarca. Ask to sit upstairs on the patio and you will not regret the experience nor the view. Once finished with your meal finish the climb to the top to the statue of Jose Maria Morelos and look around. Enjoy the view and the experience. Once you have had enough you can make your way back down to the pier and catch the next boat back to Patzcuaro. The boats run continuously so you don\'t have to worry about there not being a boat for you. They run basically from 07:30 to about 6:00 pm. Folks let me say again, I read all of the travel advisories and almost talked myself and my group of friends out of going BUT I am glad that I did not. This was a once in a life time experience and I will do it again real soon.

381426304.name: Nice touristic place in Michoacan
381426304.author: a TripAdvisor user
381426304.reviewBody: Excellant place for a daytrip if you are in Michoacan. There are ferries going all day long and the island is filled by places selling mexican artesanias or local fish. There is a museum on top. It might get overcrowded on day of the death each year.

375295265.name: Nice stroll after a leisurely boat ride
375295265.author: a TripAdvisor user
375295265.reviewBody: My friend and I took a ferry from Patzcuaro to Janitzio.  The ferries leave roughly every 20 minutes and take about 20 minutes for the journey.  The hilly island is reminiscent of the Greek Isles, and there are many shops and restaurants that you can stroll past.  Prices were extremely affordable.  This is a trip best taken on a clear day.

373067840.name: Nice Day Trip
373067840.author: a TripAdvisor user
373067840.reviewBody:
p4*Janitzio
One of the islands on Lake Patzquaro
Several boats make the 25 minute ride to the island
Cost is 55 pesos per person; kids under five are free
Famous Morelos statue on top of the hill with a fantastic view; several stairwell passways up there passing food stands and souvenir shops
There is is a little plaza on top and is scenic restaurant
Also, a nice cemetery
Bring a light jacket and camera
Not handicapped accessible for the most part

369977899.name: Not a must see, but has its own sort of charm
369977899.author: a TripAdvisor user
369977899.reviewBody: The island is worth the visit though don\'t expect too much of the statue that you see from the shore. It might possibly be the most ugly statue I have ever seen... the island has become one big merkado (the locals used to all fish but the stocks have collapsed, now theit only income is through tourism) , the paths up to the statue are plastered with one vendor after the other but it all has its own charm, don\'t forget to try the "jarra loco" (sp) it\'s a crazy beverage with the local "rum", fruit juices and of course chilli.

365116011.name: If you are up for a hike . . .
365116011.author: a TripAdvisor user
365116011.reviewBody:
Janitzio sits in the middle of Lake Patzcuaro and is covered almost entirely with houses and tons and tons of tourist shops, crowned by an enormous statue of Benito Juarez.  Do not go if you are not up for a hike up lots and lots of steps up to the top.  When you do hike up try to remember which of the few dozen stairways you used on the way up or you'll come out in a very different spot from which you started.

At the top the statue of Juarez is worth a visit.  It's hollow so you can walk up a ramped accent with murals of the Mexican revolution on the walls until you reach a ladder which leads  up into the head.  From here there is a panoramic view of the lake.  

If you happen to be driving and make the circuit around the lake you can also take a boat from the far side.

361039508.name: Fun side trip
361039508.author: a TripAdvisor user
361039508.reviewBody: The trip out to the island, about20 minutes, in a long "canal boat" with 75-85 passengers is fun.  Great to visit with the\nMexican tourists and locals.  The island is a steep hill with a statue at the top.  One winds up and up and up along a street packed with vendors and restaurants.  I didn\'t go all the way up but was satisfied with this little adventure.\n

347256862.name: Island Experience in the heart of Mexico!
347256862.author: a TripAdvisor user
347256862.reviewBody: We went to Isla Janitzio to experience an island city in the heart of Mexico.  The climb up to the statue is well worth the effort.  There are 2 paths, the short cut or the circular less strenuous walk.  The murals in the statue  are well worth the climb, as well as, the view!\n

340029489.name: An American Visits the Island
340029489.author: a TripAdvisor user
340029489.reviewBody: I never been to Mexico before and this one one of our stops. I found it really, really unique and fun! The long walk up and crowded, narrow streets are a real adventure. Just be sure to have walking shoes on because it is a long walk to the top! The restaurants are pretty good that offer real, legit food that was very good. While prices are a bit high for tourists, I still found it worth the trip!

339687124.name: What I expected
339687124.author: a TripAdvisor user
339687124.reviewBody: An island/city in the middle of a country, it\'s exactly what I expected.  High prices and hard sellers.  Other than that, the people were pleasant and the island is beautiful.  It was surprisingly warm for December, so we had a great time.

334815168.name: Sadly Overrated
334815168.author: a TripAdvisor user
334815168.reviewBody: About 17 years ago a trip to Janitzio was something special, but it is just sad to see how the island is faring these days. Seems way too sleazy & downright dirty, with ticky-tacky souvenirs for sale. The government should help the island and its inhabitants. Mexico has some absolutely fantastic tourist sites, and this just isn\'t one of them. Very sad.

326365922.name: Overrated Tourist Trap
326365922.author: a TripAdvisor user
326365922.reviewBody: In all fairness, perhaps everyone should see it once.  I found it extremely touristy and felt uncomfortable.

326281057.name: Was totally stoked to be heading to the Day of the Dead celebration ... way too touristy!!
326281057.author: a TripAdvisor user
326281057.reviewBody: Was totally stoked to be heading to the Day of the Dead celebration ... way too touristy!!\n\nJust packed with tourists and stalls ... Tzintzuntzan and Santa Fe de la Laguna were much more interesting for the Day of the Dead then Janitzio in my opinion!!

324927331.name: Offensively commercialized
324927331.author: a TripAdvisor user
324927331.reviewBody: I\'m sure at one time Janitzio was charming but it\'s morphed into the "Bourbon Street" of Patzcuaro. Offensively commercialized, there are so many more rewarding places to visit.

324535231.name: Place to Visit during Night of the Dead
324535231.author: a TripAdvisor user
324535231.reviewBody: You have to catch a launch to get to the island. It is quite busy during Night of the Dead, when 73 launches are running between the island and the mainland. It is worth a visit.

324503427.name: Good place but not good on Nov 2nd
324503427.author: a TripAdvisor user
324503427.reviewBody: On Nov 2nd is not the best place to go, it is full of people that only goes for party and you can not see the best of the Nov 2nd ceremony. It is better to visit other smaller places around the lake as Tzintzuntzan, Pacanda, Ihuatzio and others.

312365359.name: Not worth it
312365359.author: a TripAdvisor user
312365359.reviewBody: Not worth it the trip. Kids selling candy are very rude if you don\'t buy anything. Dirty and full of mosquitoes. It is a shame that shuch a beautiful island has turned into a dirty place.

312149160.name: Good to know Spanish
312149160.author: a TripAdvisor user
312149160.reviewBody: We went on the Sunday after Mexico\'s Day of Independence and tourist traffic was very light.  Apparently many people had already spent their paycheck of the 15th.  I agree with the gist of most of the other reviews - long climb, tourist trap, great views - but would emphasize that the logistics of getting tickets, getting the right boat, and so on will likely overwhelm one that does not speak at least basic \'tourist Spanish.\'

310671712.name: See or Not - either way you\'re good.
310671712.author: a TripAdvisor user
310671712.reviewBody: Make sure you know what you are getting yourself into. There are thousands of steps to the top and they wind through tons of vendors, mostly selling the same crafts. More of a tourist trap than something to see and appreciate.

303506432.name: Great to see a native PERUCHPECHA people!!!!
303506432.author: a TripAdvisor user
303506432.reviewBody: From the town take COMBI for a 7 pesos,then a boat for a 45 pesos and you are in a different world. Island Janotzio very croud with a people, tourists and local. No photos of the naitive PERUCHPECHA people. They don\'t like it -ONLY FOR MONEY!!!Take a mirador from a top of the statue of MORELIA!!Very different people,costume and customs!!!

263791605.name: wonderful trip
263791605.author: a TripAdvisor user
263791605.reviewBody: After you pass by all the shops and restaurants, you finally arrive at the statue of Morelos.  You must go inside to see the murals depicting Morelos life.   They are both educational and inspirational.  The walk up the hill is not long.

261814777.name: Mexican Answer to Statue of Liberty
261814777.author: a TripAdvisor user
261814777.reviewBody: This island is accessible only by an inexpensive old fashioned boat from Patzcuaro\'s pier. It will get you there in about 15-20 minutes and the view of the island with the Statue of Jose Morelos in the center and the surrounding Michoac\u00e1n mountains is awesome. Make sure you\'re camera is ready for those butterfly fishermen as the boat gets closer to the island,\nYou will climb the hill and can be challenging for those with physical disabilities. Make sure you climb the statue as you will be rewarded by a phenomenal view of the surrounding area. There are many stores selling  handicrafts, artworks, antiques, clothes all over the place. Bargain, bargain all the time. Souvenirs there are cheaper than in the mainland.

259023206.name: Very Interesting Visit
259023206.author: a TripAdvisor user
259023206.reviewBody: We took the ferry to visit the island of Janitzio as part of an organized G Adventure tour. The island is quite built up and it is interesting to climb the winding steps and paths up the hill and see the houses, tourist shops and restaurants.   The main attraction on the island is an impressive 40-foot statue of Jose Morelos. You can climb to the top of the raised hand for some nice views of the lake and surrounding area. The inside of the statue has a lot of painted murals depicting Mexican history.  By luck, we were there on a Monday and there was going to be a rodeo in the local bullring that evening.  The plaza area by the boat docks was packed with people eating and getting ready for the event.  As we were leaving they all marched in a parade accompanied by a several bands over to the bullring.  It looked like it was really going to be a festive evening.

258074452.name: A Must Visit while in Patzcuaro!
258074452.author: a TripAdvisor user
258074452.reviewBody: I can\'t imagine visiting Patzcuaro and not going to Isla Janitzio.  It\'s a fun day trip that starts with a 30 minute boat ride over to the island.  On the way you will see the fisherman and they will display their nets high in the air (hoping for a small tip for their showmanship).  On arrival at the pier you\'ll find some cafes and restaurants should you desire, or better yet, do this before your departure.  The hills are steep, so have your walking shoes on.  The streets meander every which way as you climb to the top.  Many climb the interior staircase of the statue of Jose Morelos which was built in 1930.  Whether you climb or not, the views are amazing.  More cafes on the top and some street performers, particularly the Dance of the Old Men...which is quite good and shouldn\'t be missed.  Visit the cemetary where on Day of the Dead, the entire island is in party mode...unlike other villages nearby where on this night, it\'s a bit more solemn.  While waiting for the next boat, have a seat at one of the waterfront cafes and sip a cerveza or a coffee.  Total time:  3 to 4 hours depending on your pace.

257717930.name: Looks more interesting than it is
257717930.author: a TripAdvisor user
257717930.reviewBody: If you only have a short time in Patz, you can skip the island tour. The lake looks nice from a distance, but no surprise it looks pretty polluted up close. The village is nothing special,  pretty much the same trinkets you can buy anywhere in the area. But buy something to support the locals, I guess. First time I ever was compelled to tip a fisherman. If you have a few days, go ahead just to say you\'ve done it.

255143595.name: Mi Janitzio
255143595.author: a TripAdvisor user
255143595.reviewBody: My experience was fabulous. OK, so it was Dia de los Muertos, and I was with two fun women from Nova Scotia, but it was colorful, gritty, and quaint! I absolutely loved visiting the church with the fishing nets and silver aluminum foil fish dangling from the ceiling! We didn\'t get hassled or hustled--the people were sweet and helpful. The boat ride was fun--the fishermen flashing their butterfly nets then paddling to the water taxi for pesos! A Carlos Santana clone played electric guitar as we crossed the murky lake. I wouldn\'t eat fish from the lake--but then I wouldn\'t miss Janitzio, mi Janitzio!

254562171.name: Crazy climb up the statue!
254562171.author: a TripAdvisor user
254562171.reviewBody: If you are hanging around Patzcuaro for a few days, taking the ferry over to Isla Janitzio is a fun trip.  It is certainly more of a tourist trap than any other spot in the area, but the statue is worth seeing.  Unfortunately to get there you have to run the gauntlet of tourist shops and children begging for money.  Climb on past them all to reach the statue, and then make sure you pay the small price to go inside and climb up inside the statue.  Crazy!  Eventually you end up climbing inside the arm as the space becomes more narrow - the view out the wrist is great.

254383724.name: Only interesting on Dia de Muertos.
254383724.author: a TripAdvisor user
254383724.reviewBody:
Houses are in very bad shape, powerty is obvious, kids are asking for money. Unfortunatelly there is also garbage everywhere! If local goverment and local people would take better care - Janitzio could be a great tourist destination, great half day trip from Patzcuaro.
I visited this place before, always on the Day of Dead. It is a much more interesting experience.

254008732.name: Island in the lake
254008732.author: a TripAdvisor user
254008732.reviewBody: Janitzio is a must see, but not for any particular reason, as there really isn\'t any thing to see, except the journey to the top of the island for a spectacular view of the surrounding area.  We traversed the hill, climbed inside to the top of the monument, then worked our way back down and had lunch before getting back on our boat and returning to Patzcuaro.  We spent 2 hours total which was just right for us.

252142642.name: Wonderful little village
252142642.author: a TripAdvisor user
252142642.reviewBody: We walked up steps and thru the shops to get to the statue at the top, prices were good and people very nice.  We also hiked the 70 some steps inside the statue.  Enjoyed everything about our trip - speak Spanish and enjoyed hearing about people who have lived there their whole lives. The boat trip was fine - took about 1/ hour.

251780068.name: A lovely afternoon trip
251780068.author: a TripAdvisor user
251780068.reviewBody: We went by collectivo to the lake then got on the very colourful ferry full of locals. It took about 30 minutes and was a pleasant journey. On the island we enjoyed walking up the winding streets to the enormous statue and then back down through the souvenir shops for a drink. A couple was hours was enough for the round trip.

247262524.name: what a waste
247262524.author: a TripAdvisor user
247262524.reviewBody:
Just full of poor people selling crappy trinkets that you can find in any city in Mexico. For an area known for its local artesanias, Janitzio really disappoints. 

Its not even that great of a view from the top of the Morelos statue. 

Don't waste your time or money, unless it's for Day of the Dead.

241234630.name: Day of the Dead must
241234630.author: a TripAdvisor user
241234630.reviewBody: we took the boat--50 pesos roundtrip--at night for the Day of the Dead celebration and got our tickets at the muelle or embarcadero at around 8:30 when it wasn\'t as crowded.  Smooth ride to the island, not as cold as the return when I was glad I had my gloves and jacket.  Lots of little restaurants to eat at al fresco with just a sign here and there -- we ate at Tzin-something.  They had great cheese quesadillas with Oaxacan melted cheese on huarache-type tortillas but no one knew what a margarita was.  I\'m not joking.  Settled for a tequila and squirt.  Lots of little stores as you wind your way up the hill to the cemetery or pantheon with the typical Mexican tourist souvenirs.  The music there doesn\'t start till midnight and we were too tired to wait.  The crowds started coming off the boats at around 10:30 , and I mean crowds, lots of young people looking to get drunk and party. Lovely  locals.

240775217.name: Doesn\'t live up to its promise
240775217.author: a TripAdvisor user
240775217.reviewBody: We went to Janitzio looking for a traditional D\u00eda de Muertos experience and ended greatly disappointed. The island is souvenir store after souvenir store, everyone in it is completely dedicated to getting money from you to buy souvenirs, drinks or just give aways. The view from the monument and the history told as you go up is the only thing worth it. If you wish to avoid the locals trying to sell you stuff, don\'t go up the stairs, go up through the ramp. Signs will be deceiving. Find the cemetery and go right from there. Cemetery is tiny to be able to appreciate Day of the dead traditions. If this is what you\'re looking for go to Tzurumutaro (15min away from Patzcuaro).

234741414.name: Aweful
234741414.author: a TripAdvisor user
234741414.reviewBody: my family owns a hotel in Patzcuaro (posada de don Vasco) so ive travelled all my life to this town and to this island.... Sadly it is a dump, full of vendors, nauseous smells, cheap restaurants and souvenir shops. You climb, and climb, and climb till you reach the Morelos statue only to find out it is as ugly as the island. The only thing worth the exercise is the view from atop. If you want to visit a NICE lake with a couple o good "local" restaurants, skip Janitzio and drive to Zirahuen... Much MUCH nicer place.

230193855.name: Get a little exercise hiking to the statue
230193855.author: a TripAdvisor user
230193855.reviewBody: It was an inexpensive little excursion where we road a shared mini van to the muelle where we hopped a small ferry for a 15 - 20 minute ride across the lake to the island.  It didn\'t take long to visit and allowed some views around.

220175429.name: Interesting Isla
220175429.author: a TripAdvisor user
220175429.reviewBody: It is a fun excursion to take a boat to Isla Janitzio from the dock in Patzcuaro.  Tickets cost 50 pesos round trip for the boat, which took 30 minutes to cross to the island.  We were entertained by a music group during the crossing.  \n\nIsla Janitzio was nice, plenty of food and vendors along the way up all the stairs to the Morelos  monument.  The monument is within a little park, admission is 10 pesos.  More food vendors and restaurants up there.  The murals inside the monument, depicting Morelos\u2019 life and finally his execution, were very good.

216958675.name: Magical land for day of the dead November 1&2
216958675.author: a TripAdvisor user
216958675.reviewBody: Located in the middle of the famous fishing lake Patzcuaro in the magical state of Michoacan considered to be one of the most beautiful and rich states in all of Mexico for its culture architecture and food. \n\nThis island is transformed during the day of the dead when everyone outside leaves candles in the street to guide the spirit of the dead from the local crypts on the island to their homes creating rivers of light in the streets when seen from far.  This whole area is spectacular.

209539785.name: So much fun, you will not regret it
209539785.author: a TripAdvisor user
209539785.reviewBody: It\'s amazing how much things there is to see and do there. If you are planning on returning home with some gifts for family and friends I recommend you visit Janitzio. There is many hand made gifts perfect for anybody.

202853646.name: Beautiful Patzcuaro
202853646.author: a TripAdvisor user
202853646.reviewBody: A Beautiful little island with lots of history in the lake of Patzcuaro and amazing views. Pleasant people and overall a nice day trip!

199663118.name: Once in a lifetime.
199663118.author: a TripAdvisor user
199663118.reviewBody: This place is definitely something you should do at least once in your life. The boat ride over is comfortable and interesting. Seeing the Butterfly Fishermen do their thing is wonderful and something we will never forget. Going to the top of the mountain and then to the top of the statue was difficult but something I will never forget.

198303843.name: We skipped the island but the drive around the lake is superb!
198303843.author: a TripAdvisor user
198303843.reviewBody: An easy 3 hour drive around the lake, more with the numerous scenic stops of your choice. Primarily a farming area but there are numerous shops in the small towns with statuary, handmade furniture and wood carvings, which are both unique and beautiful. The shop owners we met were attentive and willing to show us around but never pressured us to buy. A very pleasant shopping experience. Beautiful vistas of the lake and surrounding mountains abound. We stopped to look at an abandoned bull fighting arena only to find it occupied with a small herd of cattle and several teenagers practicing their roping skills. After numerous attempts, one boy finally roped a small calf only to have the rope slip out of his grasp. Melee ensued as the 3 boys chased the end of the rope around the ring. At last they secured their prize. We gave them a hearty round of applause and thumbs up as we departed they returned the compliment with broad smiles.

195912501.name: If you\'re in the area, an interesting half day trip
195912501.author: a TripAdvisor user
195912501.reviewBody: Isla Janitzio is an important location for Mexicans, so it was interesting to join them on a public ferry to the island.  Yes, there are a lot of people selling tourist stuff, but it\'s interesting to look at and fun momentos can be purchased.  I enjoyed the hike up to the top to see the statue of Morelos.  Great local food is also available on the island.  \n\nIt\'s not Disney World, it\'s a slice in the life of Mexico.  It\'s a great place to take photos if you\'re an amateur or professional photographer.  If you\'re in the area, definitely spend a half day taking the ferry and exploring the island.

191867625.name: I loved visiting this place
191867625.author: a TripAdvisor user
191867625.reviewBody: When I saw some of these bad reviews, I don\'t know what those people were looking for? Of course the economy of the island is geared for tourism, people have to earn a living.  I do not appreciate the arrogance of people who visit other countries with their noses in the air.  In their own countries they are nobody.  Okay, I got that off my chest.  This place is a gem.  I wish I was more of the type to sit in restaurants, because some of the most beautiful restaurants I\'ve seen were along the hundreds of stairs I climbed, that wind to the top of the island. So picturesque.  There is nothing in Greece or the Greek Islands (other places I\'ve been) more wonderful than this place. What a trek that was, and such a feeling of accomplishement to reach the top.  People were so nice.  I was given several of those little fried fish to eat, from various venders and restaurants, to give me strength for the climb.  Once at the top; to then climb to the top of Mexico\'s "Statue of Liberty", the fabulous monument to Jose Maria Morelos!  I was staying in Morelia, and took a day trip here.  What a pleasure and and honor it was.  It was the absolute highlight of my visit to Morelia and the surrounding area.

191000338.name: WOuldn\'t go again.
191000338.author: a TripAdvisor user
191000338.reviewBody: A half hour trip on the lake sounded like a good idea.   It was okay.   Janitzio itself is wall to wall souvenir stalls.   I did find one of the prettiest little restaurants I have ever seen in Mexico with green (?) tortillas, which also were tastier than most tortillas.

186114534.name: Disappointing
186114534.author: a TripAdvisor user
186114534.reviewBody: Positives: lovely boat ride for both the clientele & the scenery.\nNegatives: Entire island devoted to tourism selling mostly non local trinkets to what turn out to be not enough tourists.

185296693.name: Ick!
185296693.author: a TripAdvisor user
185296693.reviewBody: If one did not know that this side of the lake was polluted, the ride out to the island would have been more pleasant. The island itself is AWFUL! A terrible tourist trap that I would advise you to avoid.

184710607.name: Dissapointing.
184710607.author: a TripAdvisor user
184710607.reviewBody: It is a crowded and too commercial of a place during Dia de los Muertos. All kids from Patzcuaro and Morelia gather there to get drunk and loud. You should visit Tsinzunzan instead for a better and nicer experience.

183649941.name: Nice to see if your around.
183649941.author: a TripAdvisor user
183649941.reviewBody: I went with my family on a little fishing boat to the island and its nothing extraordinary. I like getting to know new places so it was nice to see. If you are anywhere near the island it would be nice to go out of your way to see. In and out kinda place. Not bad but not like im dying to go back.

183264618.name: Isla Janitzio
183264618.author: a TripAdvisor user
183264618.reviewBody: this was about a  20 minute boat ride from the main land. It was interesting watching  families prepare the  cemetery for the Day of the Dead holiday.We also saw fisherman netting the tiny white fish this area is noted for. It is a must go once!!!!!

160177583.name: Great views and experience
160177583.author: a TripAdvisor user
160177583.reviewBody: We took a fishing boat to the island which was the more expensive option but it was private and he gave us a tour of all the islands with interesting facts and details. OK the island does look a little like a bad part of Rio de Janeiro and its tourist orientated but the atmosphere was good. For dinner we had fish from the lake which tasted great and the views from the top of the statue are phenomenal. Good day out, just dont plan to spend too long on the island, 3 - 4 hours is plenty of time.

157601981.name: Trash Island
157601981.author: a TripAdvisor user
157601981.reviewBody: We took a boat ride to Isla Janitzio, only to observe on our approach that it looked like a pile of garbage.  Getting off the boat on the island, our impression wasn\'t really changed.  It\'s heavily tourist oriented, with all the cheap trinkets you never wanted being pushed on you wherever you go.  It\'s an experience, so I don\'t entirely regret the trip, but it wasn\'t the highlight of our vacation.

151829658.name: Disappointing
151829658.author: a TripAdvisor user
151829658.reviewBody: The boat ride to the island was pleasant but the island itself was crowded and messy.  Not worth the trip.

150750915.name: Isla Janitzio
150750915.author: a TripAdvisor user
150750915.reviewBody: Make sure you climb up inside the statue, the murals on the wall are definitely worth it.  And be ready to take pictures of the butterfly fishermen just before docking on the island.

149962971.name: Dirty
149962971.author: a TripAdvisor user
149962971.reviewBody: The best part of Janitzio is the boat ride.  However, the island is surprisingly dirty - unkept.  Worth one visit for the views - climb to the top.

147632003.name: Takes your breath away - literally
147632003.author: a TripAdvisor user
147632003.reviewBody: The ride to the Island is well worth the 35+- pesos, although there can be a wait for enough travellers to fill the boat.  The climb to the top of the statue itself is not one to undertake if you have knee, leg or breathing problems, but if not, take you time and DO go up.  Coming down is just as hard on the knees so plan ahead.

147274853.name: Purepecha Island
147274853.author: a TripAdvisor user
147274853.reviewBody: Hard to say what is best about Janitzio.. the trip across the lake or the climb up to the statue of Jose Maria Morelos who was a hero of the war of Independence from Spain.  It is a great hike up to the monument and then up the stairway with a mural all the way up the inside and then this marvelous panoramic view you cannot get anywhere else in the region.  When I went there were musicians on the boat across adding to the authentic feeling.

146028231.name: Been there, done that!
146028231.author: a TripAdvisor user
146028231.reviewBody: Despite all of the hype about Janitzio, it really has become quite touristy and commercial. The boat ride over in the evening is great, but once there on Day of the Dead there are throngs of tourists snapping photos of the sole cemetery crammed between the seawall and the Lake. It felt rather inconsiderate and sacrilegious to be stepping over the tombstones which had been beautifully decorated by the families with offerings and candles.... there are lots of steps to climb as you move around the island. After three hours it was time to head back for Patzcuaro.\n\nOther travellers recommended the nearby cemeteries at Tzintzuntzan which we had visited in the daytime. It was beautifully decorated as well and the next visit would see us heading there for the evening....

145930740.name: over-used
145930740.author: a TripAdvisor user
145930740.reviewBody: Isla Janitzio is the principal island in Lake Patzcuaro. Over the Day of the Dead celebrations,  young people use it as party central and it gets trashed. We visited it two days after, and it was recovering, but still not great. One of the other islands, Pacanda, was beautiful, and it\'s small graveyard was well cared for. The trip over and back on the ferry was fun, and the fishermen fishing with butterfly nets were fascinating.

145411451.name: Worth the trip!
145411451.author: a TripAdvisor user
145411451.reviewBody: Fabulous boat ride over with wonderful photo opportunities! Island has great food, too many trinkets, and wonderful views. You must go inside the statue and walk up. There is wonderful art and history in there!

141742434.name: It\'s ok
141742434.author: a TripAdvisor user
141742434.reviewBody: The ride out on muddy water is in a boat livened up with a band playing music. Have tips ready for the band and boat driver. The fishermen near the island stand up with the nets, then sit down. Not much of a show. Have tips ready.   Climb to the top and go inside the statue - lots of murals.

139572447.name: Picturesque island village
139572447.author: a TripAdvisor user
139572447.reviewBody: A lovely boat ride on Lake Patzcuaro takes you to this quaint island village, a bit hokey with its souvenir shops but worth a visit.

136333274.name: Great day trip for families or couples seeking iconic tourism site
136333274.author: a TripAdvisor user
136333274.reviewBody: My husband and I have visited the island twice, the first time hitting just the main attractions: village market, climb stairway straight up to the top of the hill, and visiting the museum inside the huge statue of Jose Morelos. The second time we visited we took the time to go a different pathway to the top and view the graveyard and less touristy areas. At the top we sat in the park and enjoyed watching the Mexican families who were visiting on vacation. This is a very picturesque location for photographers but probably not a great place to find bargain priced artisan wares. Knowing a little Spanish and the history of this island and the area makes this an enjoyable experience as well.

133444728.name: This is what tourism has brought but visit the other islands
133444728.author: a TripAdvisor user
133444728.reviewBody: Well maybe don\'t visit the other islands as tourism has brought little to Janitzio... Unfortunately Patzcuaro is seasonally overrun by particularly American tourists keen on the \'authentic\' trip. Janitzio and the lake in general have suffered from poor water management and the lake is shrinking year-on-year. The other thing to remember is that Patzcuaro is a very poor area with many locals keen to make a little money of tourism. Very few people are employed at hotels and thus hawkers and peddlers as those on Janitzio are just people trying to make a living. It doesn\'t make Janitzio very charming, and the other islands are far more charming, but it is an honest face of Mexico. Patzcuaro is not an open-air museum of \'great authentic culture\' and \'authentic handicrafts\' where one can sip a nice coffee and eat nice food. It is a very poor city trying to get by and people there should be complimented for offering the world such a pretty face and tolerating the occasional obnoxious tourist thinking that money buys the world....

132348246.name: why do people go here?
132348246.author: a TripAdvisor user
132348246.reviewBody: Perhaps you\'ve seen pictures of the day of the dead ceremonies on Isla Janitzio and have thought "hey, that looks like a cool place". At least, that\'s what we thought - and perhaps it is, on two days a year. But after visiting in the off season, we were very happy to get back on that boat to the mainland. The much vaunted cemetery is tiny, minimal and ill-tended. The church\'s only redeeming feature was the fact that its walls slanted outwards (unless you\'re into old, ripped paintings by mediocre artists). The restaurant we ate in was the worst meal we\'ve had in the western hemisphere. Very disappointing and downright mystifying - why do people talk this place up? The boat ride was very nice though - especially coming back.

132247743.name: gets big wraps, but there are better things to do
132247743.author: a TripAdvisor user
132247743.reviewBody: considering that the lake has very little fish left in it , the island loses a lot of its attraction,, also, do not eat the food over there as cleanliness is doubtful

131744980.name: Lovely people
131744980.author: a TripAdvisor user
131744980.reviewBody: Great contact with the locals. Good food. Nice landscape.

131450425.name: Touristy
131450425.author: a TripAdvisor user
131450425.reviewBody: If you\'re going to spend more than a day in Patzcuaro, you sort of are obligated to take a boat to Janitzio, climb up to Morelos, and then climb a bit more up to the statue-building\'s wrist look-out. It\'s mildly interesting but overrated. The children nagging -- no, almost accosting at times -- to sell little pots or just to give them a coin pretty much ruins any benefit in going up to the top. And you really shouldn\'t eat the charales, the minnowish fish that the now highly contaminated lake used to be famous for.

130877800.name: Ugh!
130877800.author: a TripAdvisor user
130877800.reviewBody: Dreary place overrun by sad people trying to make a living selling junk and awful food. Only for tourists, not travelers. The statue that tops the island is totally fascist design and ugly. The view is beautiful, but not worth the trip.

130864354.name: A tourist trap with no quick exit unless you want to swim.
130864354.author: a TripAdvisor user
130864354.reviewBody: This was my second trip over here, I\'d been a few years back and vowed never again but I thought I\'d give it a chance to see if it had improved. If anything it is worse, the island is dirty, over crowded and smelly. From the moment you disembark you are bombarded with people trying to sell everything they can think of including key chains made in China! A tourist trap of the first order because, due to the fact that it is an island, one can\'t always get a boat out when one wants to leave - which in my case was right away. \n\nThere are far better things to see around Patzcuaro than this. If you want to see culture, prehispanic ruins and actual artisans and the wares they make, take a drive around the lake and check out Ihuatzio (Pur\u00e9pechan ruin), Tzintzuntzan (once capital of the Pur\u00e9pecha aka Tarascan civilization), Santa Fe de la Laguna (colourful pottery) and T\u00f3cuaro (traditional wooden masks) or head over away from the lake to visit Cuchajo (brightly painted wooden furniture) and Santa Clara del Cobre (copper). There is a nice view of the statue of Jose Maria Morelos (waving his arm as if to call a water taxi to get of of Janitzio) to be seen from the pyramid site at Ihuatzio and that is about the best way to see it IMHO.

130655386.name: A must see in Patzcuaro
130655386.author: a TripAdvisor user
130655386.reviewBody: The island of Janitzio has seen better days, that\'s for sure. But the whole experience is worth it if you are interested in seeing the mexican folklore. The boat trip, the mariachis, eating fish with a view over the lake, etc. You can spend the whole day, or just the morning. It\'s up to you, There are boats every hour or so.\n\nBe prepared to do some heavy walking up to Morelos\' statue, and bring some kind of sun protection.

125939014.name: Isla Janitzio
125939014.author: a TripAdvisor user
125939014.reviewBody:
We took a very early ferry  to the island to beat the crowds - and we were the only "gringos" onboard. The rest were locals who live on the island and we had fun chatting with them. We did the big climb to the top to see the statue of Morelo at the top of the hill. It $6peso (less than $1USD) to go in and climb all the way to the top of his arm. The view of the lake and back to Patzcuaro was great.

Yes, there are lots of vendors as you go to the top. You need to remember that this is how these people live and make their living. Even though we went on a Saturday, by going early in the morning many of the shops were not yet set up. If you are there at 11 am, you might feel like you are running a gauntlet, but at 8 am, it was quite pleasant. 

When were were leaving, we saw the local fisherman demonstrating how they artfully used their beautifully-constructed fishing nets, called butterfly nets. THey do not fish this way now. They will come up to your ferry and ask for donations. Giving them 10-20 Pesos (about $1-2USD) is a kind gesture.

Otheres have complained about trash, they need to remember that tourists contribute to the trash. At 8am, the locals are out sweeping and washing down their sidewalks.

This is an interesting trip, but one that you probably won't need to repeat once you have done it.

125805998.name: best from afar
125805998.author: a TripAdvisor user
125805998.reviewBody: The barge ride out is interesting, but the island is verticle, crowded, and littered with vendors and people selling fried minnows.   The height of the venture is the monument on the highest point of the island.   There is nothing colonial there.   I will say looking at the island from the mainland or el estribo is much more scenic.

123526593.name: not worth the trip
123526593.author: a TripAdvisor user
123526593.reviewBody: Let me put it this way. The significance of the sight I am sure is historically important. But I didnt even like the Statue(aesthetically that is.) I didn\'t mind the climb but I expected more than rows and rows of stores all the way to the top.There\'s a park  at the top , the view is great.I guess the one minute of glory was  the fisherman with their butterfly nets posing ( unfortunately that was it! a pose) The water was pretty murky unfortunate for the poor guys.There has  to be something they can do to rejuvenate the lake,

121301648.name: Nice lake view, nothing to do
121301648.author: a TripAdvisor user
121301648.reviewBody: Traveling from P\u00e1tzcuaro to Isla Janitzio by boat is nice, but once you get there the island is not pretty, and please do not eat there! Just just enjoy the lake view and get back to P\u00e1tcuaro.

120879951.name: Very interesting
120879951.author: a TripAdvisor user
120879951.reviewBody: It was a bit of a challenge to climb and climb having a very bad knee but it was very interesting.  There seemed to be alot of the same stuff for sale at every tienda

114742104.name: Tourist trap but worth the visit
114742104.author: a TripAdvisor user
114742104.reviewBody:
Like previously mentioned, when our ferry had gotten close to the island, we were greeted by local fisherman demonstrating how they artfully used their beautifully-constructed fishing net. They could almost incorporate some form of dancing and would still be pretty to look at.

The big status of Morelo was on top of the hill. So we strolled our way through uphill. On the way I could tell the town was not well-maintained. Litter was all over the place. It was a pity because it's a nice island and could have great potential.

After climbing through many steps, we made it to the top. The view was very nice. 

However there wasn't much to do after that. The restaurants looked quite empty and we weren't sure if it would be wise to have lunch there. So we headed back down and decided to eat at the dock in the mainland which turned out to be a better choice because there were more restaurant options.

60693693.name: Maybe a tourist trap, but quite pleasant in the off-season.
60693693.author: a TripAdvisor user
60693693.reviewBody: I traveled to Janitzio on a vacation with Mexican relatives, who were excited to share the richness of the traditions and history of the area.  After visiting Morelia and Patzcuaro, I can\'t say that Janitzio is as rich in "culture", as the streets are lined with vendors from the moment you step off the boat. However, learning the history of the island and its traditions and walking up to the top of the statue of Morelos was definitely worth the stop in the context of a larger tour of the region.  One thing worth checking out is the indigenous fisherman demonstrating their specific style of fishing with butterfly nets from small flat canoes ... it is amazing to watch \n\nI did not witness the pervasive drunkenness referenced by another reviewer, but I can definitely imagine what that would have been like, and the locals did mention that it gets pretty crazy around the Day of the Dead celebrations.

48765587.name: There is a difference between drunkeness and culture
48765587.author: a TripAdvisor user
48765587.reviewBody:
Someone wrote a discription of Janitzio as a place for people "hoping for a glimpse of native culture".  That's like describing Disneyland in the same terms for foreign visitors.  

Lake Patzcuaro is surrounded by little towns like Jaracuaro, Tzintzuntzan and Santa Clara del Cobre where the local culture is rich.  Janitzio is a tourist trap from the time you disembark until the time you get to the statue of Morelos on top of the island.  The Day of the Dead ceremonies are in a poorly decorated grave yard surrounded by bars serving a drunken crowd.

We have witnessed DOD ceremonies in Morelia, Tzintzuntzan and Jaracuaro and would recommend any of these places as far superior to Janitzio.  Of course, if you prefer a good drunk to culture, Janitzio is your place.

661751601.name: vista estupenda
661751601.author: a TripAdvisor user
661751601.reviewBody: Quieres divisar gran parte del lago de Patzcuaro, Janitzio y alrededores, este es el lugar preciso para observar

621553801.name: Panor\u00e1mica del lago de P\u00e1tzcuaro.
621553801.author: a TripAdvisor user
621553801.reviewBody: Desde este cerro se puede tener una panor\u00e1mica muy amplia del lago, y de los poblados aleda\u00f1os. Al subir las escaleras, podr\u00e1n ver la ciudad de P\u00e1tzcuaro, en la parte de atr\u00e1s del cerro.

666502299.name: My favorite coffee shop
666502299.author: a TripAdvisor user
666502299.reviewBody: La Mano Gr\u00e1fica is a nice art gallery but I go there for the coffee and quiet coffee shop vibe. They have a large selection of teas in addition. There really isn\u2019t any comparable cafe in town that opens up in the morning.  \n\nBeing just a bit off the plaza they don\u2019t get us much foot traffic as they might deserve. Worth the visit if you\u2019re looking for a quiet spot to relax with a good cup of coffee or tea. Even better if you want to see some good art.

642186129.name: Fascinating!
642186129.author: a TripAdvisor user
642186129.reviewBody: Unfortunately for us, this place was closed while we were there. We assumed it was for the holidays. We are both artists and really wanted to go in. We could see through the windows that this is a working fine arts print shop and studio. Next time!

642185623.name: A cool little place
642185623.author: a TripAdvisor user
642185623.reviewBody: They were hanging a new art photography show by Jeffrey Love when we walked in. Unfortunately we would not be able to attend the opening due to travel plans and hotel reservation in Morelia. Highly recommend!

593889592.name: Interesting graphics
593889592.author: a TripAdvisor user
593889592.reviewBody: There is a small selection of graphics here. I loved the style but found many of the depictions too dark for my tastes. But it is worth a look at the creativity

581140578.name: Only a few prints on the wall
581140578.author: a TripAdvisor user
581140578.reviewBody: Very disappointing based on the reviews - there were only a few prints on the wall to see and they were anything but spectacular. Maybe there are more items on exhibit during high tourist season.

568756005.name: Amazing graphic arts studio and cafe.
568756005.author: a TripAdvisor user
568756005.reviewBody: La Mano Grafica is part of the new gallery district around Calle Dr. Cos in Patzcuaro. The level of graphic excellence is astounding and there are prints and books for every taste. Highly Recommend.

534594274.name: Local Art - Hand Made
534594274.author: a TripAdvisor user
534594274.reviewBody: I purchased a very beautiful artist\'s proof print of a the square in Patzquaro during market day...  It is one of my favorite pieces and a personal treasure.  Be sure to visit as you too will fall in love with local art!\n

494986390.name: Artemio Rodruiguez, world renown artist.
494986390.author: a TripAdvisor user
494986390.reviewBody: We are so lucky to have such a talent in Patzcuaro! His work is extraordinary and affordable if you are a collector. If you just love great graphic art... go no further. La Mano Grafica... a new location on Dr Coss less than one block from the Plaza Grande.

663536148.name: Trippy, trendy and sometimes tittilating
663536148.author: a TripAdvisor user
663536148.reviewBody: Good art, food, and sometimes music.  Pleasant owners.  Lovely setting in yet another old building.  Sit, drink, and peruse.

address.streetAddress: Calle Doctor Coss 4 La Jacaranda cultural center

614934028.name: Take a Boat to the Island
614934028.author: a TripAdvisor user
614934028.reviewBody: This is a busy place useful because for 50 pesos you can take a collective boat to the island in the middle of the lake, The boat ride rather than the pier/dock itself is the attraction. The pier area is just the usual collection of souvenir shops and restaurants.

417173671.name: Lovely
417173671.author: a TripAdvisor user
417173671.reviewBody: O went their to take a ride to Janitzio island and while i was their their was a great view of the lake and lots of shops it also have a picnic area it was pretty lovely

394936310.name: TO GET THE PATZCUARO ISLAND
394936310.author: a TripAdvisor user
394936310.reviewBody: It\'s one of the piers where you can take the boat to go to the Patzcuaro island. Nothing special to mention

361038485.name: Outrageous Market
361038485.author: a TripAdvisor user
361038485.reviewBody: A huge market, even by Latin American standards. The building can get a bit claustrophobic, the outside alleys are largely covered and always delightfully full of every kind of produce imaginable.  A great market to visit or to shop.

326284138.name: Just a normal tourist boat port in Mexico ... most boats from here go to Janitzio!
326284138.author: a TripAdvisor user
326284138.reviewBody: Just a normal tourist boat port in Mexico ... most boats from here go to Janitzio!\n\nJust like Janitzio island this is essentially a place chock full of tourist stalls that gives you a boat ride to the island. Bathrooms like in much of Mexico\'s tourist destinations are pay to play.

315916098.name: Michoacan\'s Answer to Orlando, FL
315916098.author: a TripAdvisor user
315916098.reviewBody: While the docks and the boats out to Janitzio have some religious and cultural significance, it is pretty much an excuse to party.  The Sunday we were there, we spotted at least 20 tour buses and a full parking lot of cars from all over Mexico.  Nothing wrong with families having fun but the area tends to get beat up with trash being thrown around on the busy weekends!

301673082.name: Your port to Janitzio
301673082.author: a TripAdvisor user
301673082.reviewBody:
There are two main options to get on a boat to Janitzio Island. The general docks or the dock is San Pedrito.
We chose this one as less crowded and more comfortable.
Attention was good and expedited and so was the departure to the island. 
There are several stands with handicrafts and some places to grab a snack or eat.
Before getting on your boat have your drink prepared. Lemon, orange, grapefruit with some soda and tequila or mezcal.
It is refreshing and thirst killing.
Enjoy.

630841607.name: Los mejores pancakes!
630841607.author: a TripAdvisor user
630841607.reviewBody: Estuvimos desayuno dando en este lugar durante nuestra estad\u00eda y fue genial. La atenci\u00f3n de toda la familia, las mermeladas caseras y sobre todo los pancakes son de locos!

630510056.name: Precioso
630510056.author: a TripAdvisor user
630510056.reviewBody: Es un lugar pac\u00edfico en el que pude encontrar la relajaci\u00f3n, cuenta con muy buena atenci\u00f3n a los clientes. Lo recomiendo mucho, ya tengo un lugar a d\u00f3nde ir en otras ocasiones

582247124.name: Relajaci\u00f3n
582247124.author: a TripAdvisor user
582247124.reviewBody: Armon\u00eda es el lugar ideal para la relajaci\u00f3n, bienestar y cuidado corporal en P\u00e1tzcuaro. El espacio invita a liberar la mente. Hace pocos d\u00edas recib\u00ed masaje y fue una experiencia muy gratificante, de los mejores que he recibido. \nVivir la experiencia del cuerpo en alguna de las clases que ofrecen tambi\u00e9n es algo que sin duda recomiendo ampliamente. \nMucho \u00e9xito y aplausos por proyectos como \u00e9ste.

582241998.name: Eventos varios
582241998.author: a TripAdvisor user
582241998.reviewBody: Excelente, experiencias integrales , lugar hermoso y atenci\u00f3n personal. Han sido experiencias muy ricas.

357843897.name: Terapia reiki
357843897.author: a TripAdvisor user
357843897.reviewBody: Me encanto la terapia de reiki te hace sentir mucho mejor no solo f\u00edsicamente si no emocionalmente tambi\u00e9n s\u00faper recomendable

356137771.name: Terapia de Reiki
356137771.author: a TripAdvisor user
356137771.reviewBody: Armonia es un centro holistico en donde se dan diferentes tipos de terapias alternativas y clases abiertas al p\u00fablico de Yoga, Pilates y Fendelkrais entre otras. Ademas cuenta con diferente tipo de terapias alternativas entre ellas REIKI. Se las recomiendo enormemente. Sale uno lleno de bienestar y energ\u00eda.

670307276.name: For this mexcalophile, it was a pleasure!
670307276.author: a TripAdvisor user
670307276.reviewBody: I\'ve been researching, drinking and loving artisanal mezcal for several years.  But what I\'ve been researching is mostly Oaxacan mezcals.  Spending a couple of hours here with Arturo teaching us about Michoacan mezcals was a real pleasure.  We were able to taste about 7 mezcals and bought two bottles to take home.  Our favorite was a mezcal infused with coca leaves.  Michoacan is a great place for artisanal mezcal and El Carajo is a great place to learn about them!

647062627.name: Great environment for discovering Michoac\u00e1n mezcal
647062627.author: a TripAdvisor user
647062627.reviewBody: Whether you are hardcore into mezcal or just curious, El Carajo is a fantastic spot for learning, tastings, drinking, and just hanging out. The owner is quite a character with a lot of great stories from the 1960s, and the rest of the staff is great too.

547572201.name: Very friendly and a great place to try mezcal
547572201.author: a TripAdvisor user
547572201.reviewBody: Being a recent convert to mezcal, this place was high on my list of places to visit when in Patzcuaro. And it did not disappoint. I visited after dinner with the intention of having maybe one mezcal. However, the owner engaged me in a most interesting conversation about mezcal, Mexico and everything. The after dinner drink turned out to be the main event of the evening. Apart from a great conversation, I tasted several mezcales from Oaxaca and Michoac\u00e1n. Definitely worth a second visit

538765407.name: A Great Intimate Spot-Do Not Disturb
538765407.author: a TripAdvisor user
538765407.reviewBody: I "discovered" this very cool spot, and for the first time, hesitated to put a place on Trip Advisor. I\'m doing so with the owner\'s encouragement, but this is NOT the place for a loud group of gringos downing shots; you will not be appreciated by the other patrons. On the other hand, if you are really interested in learning about Mezcal, this is the place. While Oaxaca is better known Michoacan also produces a lot. You sort of put yourself in the owners\' hands as there is apparently no menu or price list. I may have missed something in the translation of the place\'s name.......

468803552.name: A good place to taste Mezcal
468803552.author: a TripAdvisor user
468803552.reviewBody: I really liked that place. The staff and the owner gave me a special service. I tasted a lot of mezcal. I remembered the warachudo with one scorpion inside the bottle. The places was very magic. I recommend that

442270867.name: Fantastic!
442270867.author: a TripAdvisor user
442270867.reviewBody: Cozy little mezcal bar.  Perfect for a nightcap or two.  Stopped in on both nights we spent in Patzcuaro.  Got to try two mezcals from Michoac\u00e1n.  Made it a point to drink mezcal on many evenings of our 2.5 week trip to Mexico and this was by far our favorite place to do so.  Bonus was that the prices were the most reasonable of the trip.

439352303.name: El Carajo is the real thing
439352303.author: a TripAdvisor user
439352303.reviewBody: Lovely place with culture, style and amazing mezcal, the food is good and prepared with care. A must go to experience the real mezcal experience in Michoacan, Mexico.

436131097.name: I love this place!!!
436131097.author: a TripAdvisor user
436131097.reviewBody: This is where I began to truly love Mezcal. They have an excellent location near the big cathedral and they have a lot of rare and interesting Mezcals to try. Arturo and Omar were excellent hosts and spoke good English. Adalberto Who is the owner, is a very interesting man with lots of great stories. He speaks great English and has traveled all over the world. It\'s worth it to go to this place just for hanging out with him and hearing his stories! If you haven\'t had really good Mezcal yet or you just want a fun evening with some nice interesting people, I highly recommend this place.

421633751.name: Great, intimate mezcaler\u00eda in P\u00e1tzcuaro
421633751.author: a TripAdvisor user
421633751.reviewBody: Arturo is your host. Friendly place, a short walk from the main square. Excellent local mezcals, cool environment. "Para todo mal, mezcal; y para todo bien, tambi\u00e9n!"

670307792.name: Nice architecture and shopping
670307792.author: a TripAdvisor user
670307792.reviewBody: Originally a convent, now it\'s a place with many shops selling high qualify things from Michoacan.  Whether you want a copper bowl, a nice guitar, a wooden mask or some straw baskets, you can get it here.  Plus, it\'s a beautiful place to walk around and enjoy the buildings an patios (I never counted them, but I\'ll trust them that there are 11).

itemReviewed.name: House of Eleven Patios (Casa de los Once Patios)

669721947.name: Great shopping
669721947.author: a TripAdvisor user
669721947.reviewBody: Lovely to look at; right in the center of town.  Excellent crafts available, most directly from the artisans.  Definitely worthwhile.

itemReviewed.name: House of Eleven Patios (Casa de los Once Patios)

658930579.name: High Quality Craft Shopping
658930579.author: a TripAdvisor user
658930579.reviewBody: Nice little stores and workshops  selling quality craft products, situated in converted old buildings.  The area has a very casual relaxed atmosphere, and is pleasant to shop or browse in.

itemReviewed.name: House of Eleven Patios (Casa de los Once Patios)

656139035.name: Must see in Patzcuaro!
656139035.author: a TripAdvisor user
656139035.reviewBody: This is more than a shopping area, this is actually a part of Patzcuaro\u2019s history. This area used to be a convent and it included more buildings of the area. You can only visit 5 of the 11 patios they the property used to have, but you can still visit the 16th century bath that the nuns used long time ago. And of course, now there are shops for the art crafts of the region and some artisans workshops. No entrance fee and right there in the heart of town. Take a quick look, you won\u2019t regret it.

itemReviewed.name: House of Eleven Patios (Casa de los Once Patios)

652851766.name: Very nice shopping
652851766.author: a TripAdvisor user
652851766.reviewBody: Lots and lots of nice shops with a wide variety of interesting items.  There were a lot of authentic crafts and attractive jewelry and clothes

itemReviewed.name: House of Eleven Patios (Casa de los Once Patios)

646181669.name: Interesting Stop
646181669.author: a TripAdvisor user
646181669.reviewBody: Centrally located you can certainly see and buy many local crafts but I found poking around the little stores and markets lots more fun. The history of the building is very interesting as are it\u2019s rooms and architecture. Worth going to but not mind blowing.

itemReviewed.name: House of Eleven Patios (Casa de los Once Patios)

630671086.name: Nice stroll and shopping
630671086.author: a TripAdvisor user
630671086.reviewBody: It used to be an eleven patio complex that now houses several handcrafts selling from textiles to jewelry to pottery. It is nice to visit if you happen to be near Vasco de Quiroga square which is the center of town.

itemReviewed.name: House of Eleven Patios (Casa de los Once Patios)

630126709.name: Very interesting
630126709.author: a TripAdvisor user
630126709.reviewBody: Old convent turned into shopping mall for local artisans. Increadible wood carvings on furniture and decoration pieces. A lot of clay ornaments for many Mexican type decoration styles. Textile section with very typical local garmets.\nIt is worth s visit.

itemReviewed.name: House of Eleven Patios (Casa de los Once Patios)

621625428.name: Beautiful
621625428.author: a TripAdvisor user
621625428.reviewBody: Lots of amazing crafts being sold. We were not shopping but really enjoyed walking around the casa looking at the building which is beautiful.

itemReviewed.name: House of Eleven Patios (Casa de los Once Patios)

614933562.name: Well?
614933562.author: a TripAdvisor user
614933562.reviewBody: It\'s just a nicely-architected collection of shops and services. It\'s worth seeing, I guess, buttony because it\'s there and it\'s convenient to Plaza Grande.

itemReviewed.name: House of Eleven Patios (Casa de los Once Patios)

674487430.name: The value of a great tour guide
674487430.author: a TripAdvisor user
674487430.reviewBody: Jaime Hern\u00e1ndez knows the Lake P\u00e1tzcuaro area, the state of Michoac\u00e1n, and Mexico ... the history, culture, art, food, and peoples. I\'ve had two tours with him and have learned more than I ever could have from Google and a dozen history books. He is passionate, always learning and happy to tailor the tour to your interests. I can\'t recommend him highly enough.

address.streetAddress: Calle Puacume # 26. Col. Vasco de Quiroga.

664607159.name: Amazing!! So worth it!!
664607159.author: a TripAdvisor user
664607159.reviewBody: I wanted to record every word Jaime spoke! I learned so much about ancient to current Mexico history...with knowledge and a great sense of humor!  We toured the villages around Lake Patzcuaro...amazing to meet these great artists and learn about the culture. My mind is blown and I can\u2019t wait to return and learn/ experience more. Jaime is the guide of guides...I just wanted to refer to him as Professor, he has my utmost respect! And he made sure we all laughed and had fun. Do it!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Puacume # 26. Col. Vasco de Quiroga.

664100020.name: Patzcuaro and surrounding villages
664100020.author: a TripAdvisor user
664100020.reviewBody: Jaime is a very gracious tour guide and very knowledgable of the region, the culture and the history.

address.streetAddress: Calle Puacume # 26. Col. Vasco de Quiroga.

664036301.name: Pat
664036301.author: a TripAdvisor user
664036301.reviewBody:
Amazing tour Copper Canyon and beyond 
So informative and beautiful
Jaime loves his country and it’s history.
He is fun and add aims to please, AND he can sing.  planning next trip now

address.streetAddress: Calle Puacume # 26. Col. Vasco de Quiroga.

662464585.name: If you like bitter chocolate, this is ok
662464585.author: a TripAdvisor user
662464585.reviewBody: Not my favorite place to buy artisanal chocolate in Patzcuaro. It\u2019s not bad, but I think there are other better places to get it. Also, the lady who sells is normally in a very bad mood (and this is not from one time). The good thing is that you get to try many different ones before buying. They also sell coffee, and it\u2019s quite good.

446635554.name: A lovely chocolate shop, an interesting lady who runs it
446635554.author: a TripAdvisor user
446635554.reviewBody: If you wish to try a high quality chocolate at very reasonable prices, this is the place for you. The owner, who is very friendly and patient, will show you everything she has. The various special chocolates are all made of the best quality cacao seeds (you can taste those seeds) and there is a wide selection. Definitely worth visiting and tasting.

672346657.name: Buen lugar cultural con venta de cervezas y mezcal artesanal
672346657.author: a TripAdvisor user
672346657.reviewBody: Buena opci\u00f3n en d\u00f3nde se re\u00fane cultura, mezcal y cervezas. Para pasar una buena tarde en P\u00e1tzcuaro. Tambi\u00e9n hay algunas tiendas con venta de productos locales. Generalmente los eventos sn de cooperaci\u00f3n voluntaria.

address.streetAddress: Calle Doctor Jose Maria Coss #4 Centro

670812014.name: M\u00fasica, ambiente y sabor...\ud83d\ude0b \ud83c\udfb6 \ud83c\udf7b
670812014.author: a TripAdvisor user
670812014.reviewBody:
Si quieres un lugar donde disfrutar la noche en Pátzcuaro, sin duda la Jacaranda es una perfecta opción.
Siempre hay un espectáculo digno del lugar, música, baile, y todo cómo dice su administrador: 
Con consciencia😌

Recomendaciones:
• Tostada de cochinita pibil
• Quiche de verduras
• Cerveza stout Libertad

address.streetAddress: Calle Doctor Jose Maria Coss #4 Centro
